en: Extremist Rebels Launch Deadly Attack in Northeast Nigeria
ny: Opanduka Onyanyira Ayamba Kuukira Kwakupha Kumpoto Chakum'mawa kwa Nigeria

en: Islamic extremist rebels have killed at least seven people in an attack in northeast Borno state in Nigeria, witnesses told The Associated Press on Wednesday.
ny: Owukira otsutsa Chisilamu apha anthu osachepera asanu ndi awiri pa kuukira kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa boma la Borno ku Nigeria, mboni zinauza The Associated Press Lachitatu.

en: The rebels attacked Kautukari village in the Chibok area of Borno on Tuesday evening, said residents. The attack happened at the same time that U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was in the state to meet with survivors of jihadi violence.
ny: Owukirawo adaukira mudzi wa Kautukari mdera la Chibok ku Borno Lachiwiri madzulo, adatero nzika. Kuukiraku kunachitika nthawi yomweyo yomwe Mlembi Wamkulu wa UN Antonio Guterres anali m'boma kukakumana ndi opulumuka chiwawa cha jihadi.

en: The Chibok area is 115 kilometers (71 miles) away from Maiduguri, the state capital, where Guterres met with former militants being reintegrated into society and thousands of people displaced by the insurgency.
ny: Dera la Chibok lili pamtunda wa makilomita 115 (71 miles) kuchokera ku Maiduguri, likulu la boma, komwe Guterres adakumana ndi anthu omwe kale anali ankhondo omwe akubwezeretsedwanso m'chitaganya ndipo anthu zikwizikwi adathamangitsidwa ndi chipanduko.

en: "They came in large number with superior firepower (and) took over the community," said Hassan Chibok, a community leader. Troops from a nearby military base were deployed to repel the attack but "the damage had been done," Chibok said, adding that "casualties are up to 10."
ny: "Iwo anabwera ambiri ndi mphamvu yapamwamba yamoto (ndipo) anatenga dera," adatero Hassan Chibok, mtsogoleri wa dera. Asilikali ochokera ku malo a asilikali apafupi anatumizidwa kukathamangitsa kuukirako koma "zowonongeka zinali zitachitidwa," anatero Chibok, ndipo anawonjezera kuti "anthu ovulala ali mpaka 10."

en: Another resident Yana Galang said at least seven people were killed in the latest violence before the Nigerian military intervened.
ny: Munthu wina wokhala kumeneko Yana Galang adati anthu osachepera asanu ndi awiri adaphedwa pachiwawa chaposachedwapa asilikali a ku Nigeria asanalowererepo.

en: Nigerian police did not immediately respond to a request for confirmation of the attack.
ny: Apolisi a ku Nigeria sanayankhe nthawi yomweyo pa pempho loti atsimikizire za kuukiraku.

en: Nigeria, Africa's most populous country with 206 million people, continues to grapple with a 10-year-old insurgency in the northeast by Islamic extremist rebels of Boko Haram and its offshoot, the Islamic State West Africa Province. The extremists are fighting to establish Shariah law and to stop Western education.
ny: Nigeria, dziko lokhala ndi anthu ambiri ku Africa lomwe lili ndi anthu 206 miliyoni, likupitilizabe kulimbana ndi chipanduko cha zaka 10 kumpoto chakum'mawa ndi zigawenga za Chisilamu za Boko Haram ndi mphukira yake, Islamic State West Africa Province. Otsutsawo akulimbana ndi kukhazikitsa malamulo a Shariah komanso kuletsa maphunziro a Kumadzulo.

en: More than 35,000 people have died and millions have been displaced by the extremist violence, according to the U.N. Development Program.
ny: Malinga ndi bungwe la U.N. Development Program, anthu oposa 35,000 afa ndipo anthu mamiliyoni ambiri athawa kwawo chifukwa cha chiwawa chonyanyirachi.

en: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari said earlier this week that the war against the extremists is "approaching its conclusion," citing continued military airstrikes and the mass defection of thousands of the fighters, some of whom analysts say are laying down their arms because of infighting within the jihadi group.
ny: Purezidenti wa dziko la Nigeria Muhammadu Buhari adanena kumayambiriro kwa sabata ino kuti nkhondo yolimbana ndi anthu okonda zachiwawa "ikuyandikira mapeto ake," potchula ndege zankhondo zomwe zikupitirirabe komanso kupanduka kwa anthu masauzande ambiri omwe akumenya nkhondo, ena mwa iwo akatswiri akuti akuyika pansi zida zawo chifukwa cha kumenyana mkati mwa gulu la jihadi.

en: The violence, however, continues in border communities and areas closer to the Lake Chad region, the stronghold of the Islamic State-linked group, ISWAP.
ny: Komabe, chiwawachi chikupitirizabe m'madera a m'malire ndi m'madera oyandikana ndi dera la Lake Chad, malo olimba a gulu logwirizana ndi Islamic State, ISWAP.

en: "Things are getting worse" in Kautukari village in Chibok and adjourning areas closer to the forest, said community leader Chibok, saying the extremists' presence near the forest is a contributing factor.
ny: "Zinthu zikuipiraipira" m'mudzi wa Kautukari ku Chibok ndikuyimitsa madera oyandikana ndi nkhalango, adatero mtsogoleri wa dera Chibok, akuti kukhalapo kwa anthu okonda kwambiri pafupi ndi nkhalango ndi chinthu chothandizira.

en: Reporting Under Attack in South Sudan, Sudan
ny: Malipoti Akuukiridwa ku South Sudan, Sudan

en: Journalists in both Sudan and South Sudan say threats, intimidation and arbitrary arrests are part of everyday life, limiting their ability to inform the public.
ny: Atolankhani ku Sudan ndi ku South Sudan akuti ziwopsezo, kuwopseza komanso kumangidwa mwachisawawa ndi mbali ya moyo wa tsiku ndi tsiku, zomwe zikuchepetsa mphamvu zawo zodziwitsa anthu.

en: South Sudan ranks 128th and Sudan ranks 151st out of 180 countries in Reporters Without Borders annual World Press Freedom Index, released Tuesday to coincide with the United Nations annual recognition of World Press Freedom Day. The bigger the number, the worse the environment for news media.
ny: South Sudan ili nambala 128 ndipo Sudan ili nambala 151 mwa mayiko 180 mu Reporters Without Borders pachaka World Press Freedom Index, yotulutsidwa Lachiwiri kuti ifanane ndi kuzindikira kwa United Nations pachaka kwa Tsiku la Ufulu Wofalitsa Nkhani Padziko Lonse. Chiwerengero chachikulu, chilengedwe choipa kwambiri kwa atolankhani.

en: Irene Ayaa of the Association for Media Development in South Sudan says government censorship in her country is widespread.
ny: Irene Ayaa wa bungwe la Association for Media Development ku South Sudan akuti boma likuyang'anira dziko lake ndi lofala.

en: "Last month, we registered four articles removed from newspapers," she said.
ny: "Mwezi watha, tinalembetsa nkhani zinayi zochotsedwa m'manyuzipepala," adatero.

en: Between January and March alone, security personnel removed dozens of articles from the Juba Monitor, Anna Namiriano, editor-in-chief of an English-language daily, told South Sudan in Focus. "They removed stories and we left the space blank. They say why we are not listening to them, so on 17th of March, they suspended the newspaper."
ny: Pakati pa Januware ndi Marichi okha, ogwira ntchito zachitetezo anachotsa nkhani zambiri ku Juba Monitor, Anna Namiriano, mkonzi wamkulu wa chinenero cha Chingerezi tsiku ndi tsiku, adauza South Sudan ku Focus. "Iwo anachotsa nkhani ndipo tinasiya malo opanda kanthu. Iwo amati chifukwa chake sitikuwamvetsera, choncho pa 17 March, anaimitsa nyuzipepalayo."

en: In February, a handful of journalists were briefly detained for covering a press conference by opposition lawmakers in parliament. A Juba Monitor newspaper article about the incident was removed by security agents at the printing plant.
ny: Mu February, atolankhani ochepa anamangidwa mwachidule chifukwa chofotokoza msonkhano wa atolankhani ndi opanga malamulo otsutsa m'nyumba ya malamulo. Nkhani ya nyuzipepala ya Juba Monitor yonena za chochitikachi inachotsedwa ndi akuluakulu a chitetezo pa fakitale yosindikizira.

en: "We dont have freedom of the press in the country," Namiriano said. "The solution is let us do our work as media houses. We have the code of conduct, we have the media law to guide us, and removal of stories is really very bad."
ny: "Tilibe ufulu wa atolankhani m'dzikoli," adatero Namiriano. "Njira yothetsera vutoli ndikuti tiyeni tichite ntchito yathu monga nyumba zofalitsa nkhani. Tili ndi malamulo a khalidwe, tili ndi lamulo lofalitsa nkhani kuti zititsogolere, ndipo kuchotsa nkhani n'koipa kwambiri."

en: South Sudans information minister, Michael Makuei, insists press freedom is alive and well in his country.
ny: Nduna ya zachidziwitso ku South Sudan, Michael Makuei, akuumirira kuti ufulu wa atolankhani uli moyo ndipo uli bwino m'dziko lake.

en: "South Sudan is the only place where journalists are free, where they enjoy absolute freedom according to the law. I say, 'according to the law,' because there is nothing absolute in this world," Makuei told South Sudan in Focus.
ny: "South Sudan ndi malo okhawo omwe atolankhani ali omasuka, komwe amasangalala ndi ufulu wonse malinga ndi malamulo. Ndikunena kuti, 'malinga ndi malamulo,' chifukwa palibe chotheratu m'dzikoli," Makuei adauza South Sudan ku Focus.

en: The United Nations Commission on Human Rights refutes that assertion. In a report issued last October, it said the government is harassing activists, journalists and their families, limiting their activities and targeting their work and finances. South Sudan is one of the most dangerous places in the world to be a journalist, according to the commission.
ny: Bungwe la United Nations Loona za Ufulu wa Anthu limatsutsa zimenezi. Mu lipoti lomwe linaperekedwa mwezi wa Okutobala watha, linanena kuti boma likuvutitsa anthu omenyera ufulu, atolankhani ndi mabanja awo, kuchepetsa ntchito zawo komanso kuyang'ana ntchito ndi ndalama zawo. South Sudan ndi imodzi mwa malo oopsa kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi kukhala mtolankhani, malinga ndi bungweli.

en: "South Sudan has a lot of work to do to establish and solidify the institutions that are critical to a well-functioning democratic state," David Renz, charge daffaires for the U.S. Embassy in South Sudan, said in a statement Tuesday, adding that the U.S. remains deeply concerned about the state of press freedom in South Sudan.
ny: "South Sudan ili ndi ntchito yambiri yoti ikhazikitse ndi kulimbitsa mabungwe omwe ali ofunika kwambiri ku boma la demokalase lomwe likugwira ntchito bwino," David Renz, akuyang'anira daffaires kwa U.S. Embassy ku South Sudan, adatero m'mawu Lachiwiri, ndikuwonjezera kuti U.S. idakali ndi nkhawa kwambiri ndi mkhalidwe wa ufulu wa atolankhani ku South Sudan.

en: "We have seen some of the local radio stations shut down over very trivial matters," Renz said. "And we also are aware that journalists of radio and television and even social media are self-censored" and wary of local and national governments actions "to penalize journalists who say things the government would prefer that they not say."
ny: "Tawona mawailesi ena am'deralo akutsekedwa pazinthu zazing'ono kwambiri," adatero Renz. "Ndipo tikudziwanso kuti atolankhani a wailesi ndi wailesi yakanema komanso ngakhale ma social media amadziyang'anira okha" ndipo akuchenjera ndi zochita za maboma am'deralo komanso a dziko lonse "kulanga atolankhani omwe amanena zinthu zomwe boma lingakonde kuti asanene."

en: Further complications from coup
ny: Zovuta zina kuchokera ku coup

en: In Sudan, journalists in the capital city of Khartoum say harassment and threats have increased since the October 25 military takeover.
ny: Ku Sudan, atolankhani mumzinda waukulu wa Khartoum akuti kuvutitsidwa ndi kuwopseza kwawonjezeka kuyambira pa 25 October kulanda asilikali.

en: Shoggi Abdulazeem, an investigative journalist in Sudan, said he received a death threat in November and was warned not to speak to international media.
ny: Shoggi Abdulazeem, mtolankhani wofufuza ku Sudan, adati adalandira chiwopsezo cha imfa mu Novembala ndipo adachenjezedwa kuti asayankhule ndi atolankhani apadziko lonse.

en: "I was hosting live on Al Jazeera and after leaving their office, eight armed security men followed me in a pickup. They surrounded my car," Abdulazeem said. He told South Sudan in Focus he was blindfolded and moved around "for more than two hours" and was ordered "not to criticize the military again."
ny: "Ndinali kuchititsa moyo pa Al Jazeera ndipo atachoka mu ofesi yawo, amuna asanu ndi atatu achitetezo okhala ndi zida ananditsatira mu pickup. Anazungulira galimoto yanga," Abdulazeem adatero. Iye anauza South Sudan ku Focus kuti anamangidwa maso ndipo anasamuka "kwa maola oposa awiri" ndipo analamulidwa "kuti asadzudzulenso asilikali."

en: Covering pro-democracy protests in Sudan continues to be a dangerous endeavor, Abdulazeem said.
ny: Kuphimba zionetsero zolimbikitsa demokalase ku Sudan kukupitirizabe kukhala ntchito yoopsa, Abdulazeem adatero.

en: "Many newspapers, TV channels and radio stations received directives not to host or conduct interviews with some named individuals" who criticize military leaders, Abdulazeem said. He added, "There are intelligence officers who are assigned to monitor this situation."
ny: "Manyuzipepala ambiri, ma TV ndi mawailesi adalandira malangizo osati kuchititsa kapena kuchita zokambirana ndi anthu ena otchulidwa" omwe amatsutsa atsogoleri ankhondo, Abdulazeem adatero. Iye anawonjezera kuti, "Pali akuluakulu azinsinsi omwe apatsidwa ntchito yoyang'anira mkhalidwewu."

en: Aisha Assamani, an executive member of the independent Sudanese Media Network, told South Sudan in Focus he has recorded more than 10 attacks on journalists and media houses since last year's coup.
ny: Aisha Assamani, membala wamkulu wa bungwe lodziimira lokha la Sudanese Media Network, adauza South Sudan ku Focus kuti adalemba zoposa 10 kuukira atolankhani ndi nyumba zofalitsa nkhani kuyambira kulanda boma chaka chatha.

en: "They are targeting freedom of speech with so much excessive force," Assamani said. "The majority of our journalists now are fearful and their lives are in danger. Most of them remain anonymous due to the danger of the situation."
ny: "Iwo akuyang'ana ufulu wa kulankhula ndi mphamvu yopitirira muyeso kwambiri," Assamani adatero. "Atolankhani athu ambiri tsopano akuchita mantha ndipo miyoyo yawo ili pangozi. Ambiri a iwo amakhalabe osadziwika chifukwa cha kuopsa kwa mkhalidwewo."

en: On December 30, Sudanese security forces stormed the offices of three television stations — al-Arabiya, al-Hadath and al-Sharq — firing tear gas, assaulting staff and destroying broadcast equipment, according to local news media. That same day, security forces detained al-Sharq correspondents Maha Al-Talb and Sally Othman for hours before releasing them.
ny: Pa Disembala 30, asilikali achitetezo a ku Sudan anaukira maofesi a ma TV atatu - al-Arabiya, al-Hadath ndi al-Sharq - akuwombera mpweya wamisozi, kuukira antchito ndi kuwononga zipangizo zofalitsa, malinga ndi atolankhani am'deralo. Tsiku lomwelo, asilikali achitetezo anagwira atolankhani a al-Sharq Maha Al-Talb ndi Sally Othman kwa maola ambiri asanawatulutse.

en: On January 16, Sudanese authorities withdrew the broadcast license of Al Jazeera Live and closed its office in Khartoum. A letter from the Information Ministry to the director of Al Jazeera television in Sudan attributed the closing to an "unprofessional approach" and media content that "harmed the countrys higher interests and national security." The Doha-based network condemned the closure.
ny: Pa Januware 16, akuluakulu a dziko la Sudan anachotsa chilolezo chofalitsa nkhani cha Al Jazeera Live ndipo anatseka ofesi yake ku Khartoum. Kalata yochokera ku Unduna wa Zachidziwitso kwa mtsogoleri wa wailesi yakanema ya Al Jazeera ku Sudan inanena kuti kutsekedwako kunachitika chifukwa cha "njira yopanda akatswiri" komanso nkhani zofalitsa nkhani zomwe "zinavulaza dzikolo zofuna zapamwamba komanso chitetezo cha dziko." Intaneti yochokera ku Doha idatsutsa kutsekedwa.

en: In February, Sudanese authorities arrested a group of BBC reporters in Khartoum and questioned them for several hours before releasing them.
ny: Mu February, akuluakulu a boma la Sudan anagwira gulu la atolankhani a BBC ku Khartoum ndipo anawafunsa kwa maola angapo asanawatulutse.

en: VOA repeatedly called Sudans government for comment, but those calls — to Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja, press advisor to military leader Abdul Fattah al-Burhan — went unanswered.
ny: VOA mobwerezabwereza idayitanitsa boma la Sudan kuti lipereke ndemanga, koma maitanidwe amenewo - kwa Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja, mlangizi wa atolankhani kwa mtsogoleri wa asilikali Abdul Fattah al-Burhan - sanayankhidwe.

en: Michael Atit reported from Khartoum, Sudan; Deng Ghai Deng and Manyang David Mayar reported from Juba, South Sudan.
ny: Michael Atit adanena kuchokera ku Khartoum, Sudan; Deng Ghai Deng ndi Manyang David Mayar adanena kuchokera ku Juba, South Sudan.

en: At Least 30 Burundian AU Soldiers Killed in Al-Shabab Attack, Official Says
ny: Asilikali Osachepera 30 a AU a ku Burundi Aphedwa pa Nkhondo ya Al-Shabab, Mkulu Akuti

en: At least 30 Burundian soldiers were killed and 20 others injured in Tuesday's attack by al-Shabab militants on an African Union base in southern Somalia, according to a Burundian official.
ny: Asilikali osachepera 30 a ku Burundi anaphedwa ndipo ena 20 anavulala pa kuukira kwa Lachiwiri kwa asilikali a al-Shabab pa malo a African Union kumwera kwa Somalia, malinga ndi mkulu wa ku Burundi.

en: The official, who requested anonymity because he is not allowed to speak to media, told VOA Somali that 10 soldiers died on the spot, and the rest of the soldiers succumbed to their wounds. He confirmed that other soldiers are still missing.
ny: Mkuluyu, yemwe adapempha kuti asadziwike chifukwa saloledwa kulankhula ndi atolankhani, adauza VOA Somali kuti asilikali 10 adafa pomwepo, ndipo asilikali ena onse adafa ndi mabala awo. Iye anatsimikizira kuti asilikali ena akusowabe.

en: Al-Shabab said it killed 173 soldiers in the attack on the AU base in the village of El-Baraf, about 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu. The casualty figure has not been independently verified. A separate source told VOA Somali that 161 soldiers were at the camp at the time of attack. The Burundian official confirmed that number.
ny: Al-Shabab idati idapha asilikali 173 pa kuukira malo a AU m'mudzi wa El-Baraf, pafupifupi makilomita 150 kumpoto kwa Mogadishu. Chiwerengero cha anthu ovulala sichinatsimikizidwe palokha. Gwero lina linauza VOA Somali kuti asilikali 161 anali pamsasapo panthawi yomwe anaukira. Mkulu wa boma la Burundi anatsimikizira chiŵerengero chimenecho.

en: The Burundian official told VOA Somali that the soldiers had intelligence al-Shabab was gathering in a nearby village about 48 hours prior to the attack. He said the soldiers prepared to defend themselves and dug trenches.
ny: Mkulu wa dziko la Burundi anauza VOA Somali kuti asilikaliwo anali ndi chidziwitso cha al-Shabab akusonkhana m'mudzi wina wapafupi pafupifupi maola 48 asanayambe kuukira. Iye anati asilikaliwo anakonzekera kudziteteza ndi kukumba ngalande.

en: He said what caught the soldiers by surprise was the enormity of al-Shabab explosives detonated at the camp. He said the militants used three truck bombs, one of which fell into a ditch. He estimated the militants detonated about 20 kilograms of explosives, and that 450 militants overran the camp.
ny: Iye anati chomwe chinadabwitsa asilikaliwo chinali kukula kwa mabomba a al-Shabab omwe anaphulika pamsasapo. Iye adati ankhondowo adagwiritsa ntchito mabomba atatu a galimoto, imodzi mwa iwo inagwera m'ngalande. Iye anayerekezera kuti ankhondowo anaphulitsa mabomba pafupifupi makilogalamu 20, ndipo asilikali 450 anagonjetsa msasawo.

en: The official said the suicide truck bombs caused most of the casualties.
ny: Mkuluyo adati mabomba a galimoto yodzipha adapangitsa kuti anthu ambiri aphedwe.

en: Earlier, the government of Burundi reported 10 of their soldiers were killed, with five others missing and 25 injured. Burundi also said 20 al-Shabab militants were killed in the attack.
ny: M'mbuyomu, boma la Burundi linanena kuti asilikali awo 10 anaphedwa, ndipo ena asanu anasowa ndipo 25 anavulala. Burundi inanenanso kuti asilikali 20 a al-Shabab anaphedwa pa nkhondoyi.

en: On Twitter, Burundi President Evariste Ndayishimiye said there are no words strong enough to condemn the terrorist attack against the Burundian contingent. He wrote, "I join with all of Africa which has just lost sons and daughters … to console the hard-hit families."
ny: Pa Twitter, Purezidenti wa dziko la Burundi Evariste Ndayishimiye adati palibe mawu amphamvu kwambiri otsutsa zigawenga zomwe zikuchitika ku gulu la Burundi. Iye analemba kuti, "Ndikugwirizana ndi Africa yense yomwe yangotaya ana aamuna ndi aakazi ... kutonthoza mabanja amene akhudzidwa kwambiri."

en: The African Union, the Somali government and the embassy of the United States in Mogadishu have all strongly condemned the al-Shabab attack.
ny: Bungwe la African Union, boma la Somalia komanso akazembe a dziko la United States ku Mogadishu onse atsutsa kwambiri kuukira kwa al-Shabab.

en: AU chief Moussa Faki Mahamat paid tribute to the Burundian soldiers killed, and said the "heinous" attack will not lessen support of AU forces to Somalia.
ny: Mkulu wa AU Moussa Faki Mahamat adapereka msonkho kwa asilikali a ku Burundi omwe anaphedwa, ndipo adati kuukira "koopsa" sikudzachepetsa thandizo la magulu a AU ku Somalia.

en: The Somali ministry of foreign affairs called on the international community to increase and provide higher-end capability to Somali security forces and AU forces so they can effectively combat terrorism in Somalia.
ny: Unduna wa zakunja wa Somalia unapempha anthu apadziko lonse kuti awonjezere ndikupereka mphamvu zapamwamba kwa magulu achitetezo a Somalia ndi magulu a AU kuti athe kulimbana bwino ndi uchigawenga ku Somalia.

en: The U.S. embassy in Mogadishu said the U.S. extends condolences to the families of the troops killed and wished a quick recovery to those injured.
ny: Ofesi ya kazembe wa dziko la America ku Mogadishu inati dziko la United States likupereka chisoni kwa mabanja a asilikali omwe anaphedwa ndipo akufuna kuti anthu ovulalawo achire mwamsanga.

en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, told VOA that Tuesday's fighting at the camp was the heaviest the area has seen.
ny: Meya wa El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, adauza VOA kuti kumenyana kwa Lachiwiri pamsasawu ndi kwakukulu kwambiri komwe derali lawona.

en: "Fighting like this never happened in this area," he said, explaining that the violence also killed two civilians and injured 10 others. "It was heavy fighting."
ny: "Kulimbana ngati kumeneku sikunachitikepo m'dera lino," adatero, pofotokoza kuti chiwawachi chinaphanso anthu wamba awiri ndikuvulaza ena 10. "Inali nkhondo yaikulu."

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
ny: Chochitikachi chinali kuukira kwakukulu koyamba kwa al-Shabab pa magulu a AU kuyambira pamene ntchitoyi inasintha dzina lake ndi zomangamanga zogwirira ntchito mwezi watha.

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia, gave it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to the Somali government. The mission's mandate runs through the end of 2024.
ny: Bungwe la UN Security Council, lomwe linavomereza ntchito yatsopano yotchedwa African Union Transition Mission ku Somalia, linalipatsa mphamvu yochepetsera chiwopsezo chomwe al-Shabab idapereka, kuthandizira kupanga mphamvu za magulu achitetezo a Somalia, ndikuchita gawo lopereka maudindo achitetezo ku boma la Somalia. Lamulo la ntchitoyi limadutsa kumapeto kwa 2024.

en: This story comes from VOA's Somali and Central African services.
ny: Nkhaniyi ikuchokera ku ntchito za VOA za ku Somalia ndi Central Africa.

en: Kenya Trains Domestic Workers in Middle East About Rights
ny: Kenya Imaphunzitsa Ogwira Ntchito Zapakhomo ku Middle East Zokhudza Ufulu

en: Kenyan authorities are training domestic workers who accept jobs in the Middle East about their rights after years of reported abuses there, including beatings, rapes and deaths.
ny: Akuluakulu a ku Kenya akuphunzitsa ogwira ntchito zapakhomo omwe amalandira ntchito ku Middle East za ufulu wawo pambuyo pa zaka zambiri za nkhanza zomwe zanenedwa kumeneko, kuphatikizapo kumenyedwa, kugwiriridwa ndi imfa.

en: It's been a year since Bernard Njenga learned his wife, Esther Thuku, had died in Saudi Arabia, where she had been a domestic worker for three years.
ny: Patatha chaka chimodzi kuchokera pamene Bernard Njenga anamva kuti mkazi wake, Esther Thuku, wamwalira ku Saudi Arabia, komwe adakhala wantchito wapakhomo kwa zaka zitatu.

en: Saudi authorities reported that his wife had committed suicide at her employer's home, Njenga said, but he believes the mother of four was murdered.
ny: Akuluakulu a dziko la Saudi adanena kuti mkazi wake adadzipha kunyumba kwa abwana ake, Njenga adatero, koma akukhulupirira kuti mayi wa ana anayi adaphedwa.

en: Njenga said his wife's body did not have any marks that would show that she had hanged herself. It appeared the body had been buried because it was very dirty and looked like she had been stabbed on the left side, he added.
ny: Njenga adati mtembo wa mkazi wake sunakhale ndi zizindikiro zilizonse zomwe zingasonyeze kuti wadzipachika. Zinaoneka kuti mtembowo waikidwa m'manda chifukwa unali wodetsedwa kwambiri ndipo unaoneka ngati wabayidwa kumbali ya kumanzere, anawonjezera motero.

en: Kenyan authorities say that since November, at least 23 domestic workers have died while working in the Middle East. Most of those deaths occurred in Saudi Arabia, according to labor officials.
ny: Akuluakulu a dziko la Kenya akuti kuyambira mwezi wa November, anthu osachepera 23 ogwira ntchito zapakhomo afa akugwira ntchito ku Middle East. Ambiri mwa imfa zimenezo zinachitika ku Saudi Arabia, malinga ndi akuluakulu ogwira ntchito.

en: Saudi authorities have reported that all 23 of those deaths resulted from cardiac arrest.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma la Saudi Saudi koposa asimba kuti imfa zonse 23 zimenezo zinachitika chifukwa cha kuima kwa mtima.

en: In April of 2020, rights advocacy group Amnesty International reported that Kenyans who have jobs as domestic workers in the Middle East often complain of lack of payment, forced labor, physical abuse, rape and dangerous working conditions.
ny: Mu Epulo wa 2020, gulu lolimbikitsa ufulu la Amnesty International linanena kuti anthu a ku Kenya omwe ali ndi ntchito monga ogwira ntchito zapakhomo ku Middle East nthawi zambiri amadandaula kuti alibe malipiro, kugwira ntchito mokakamiza, kuzunza thupi, kugwirira chigololo komanso ntchito zoopsa.

en: Now, Kenya is offering safety training for domestic workers who take jobs abroad.
ny: Tsopano, Kenya ikupereka maphunziro a chitetezo kwa ogwira ntchito zapakhomo omwe amatenga ntchito kunja.

en: "When you don't train them, basically, you are exposing them to a lot of exploitation and abuse," said Edith Murogo, director at East Africa Institute of Homecare Management in Nairobi. "Part of the training also includes labor rights awareness. They have to know how to bargain and talk to employees about decent terms and conditions of employment."
ny: "Pamene simukuwaphunzitsa, kwenikweni, mukuwavumbula ku kudyeredwa masuku pamutu kwambiri ndi nkhanza," anatero Edith Murogo, mkulu wa East Africa Institute of Homecare Management ku Nairobi. "Gawo la maphunzirowa limaphatikizaponso kuzindikira ufulu wa antchito. Ayenera kudziwa mmene angakanganizidwe ndi kulankhula ndi ogwira ntchito za mawu abwino ndi mikhalidwe ya ntchito."

en: An estimated 30,000 Kenyans migrate to the Middle East to find work each year.
ny: Anthu pafupifupi 30,000 a ku Kenya amasamukira ku Middle East kukapeza ntchito chaka chilichonse.

en: Kenya's cabinet secretary for labor, Simon Chelugui, said his department is working with Saudi officials on labor law reforms.
ny: Mlembi wa nduna za ntchito ku Kenya, Simon Chelugui, adati dipatimenti yake ikugwira ntchito ndi akuluakulu a Saudi pa kusintha kwa malamulo antchito.

en: "We would want them also to upscale their law to protect workers and employers equally, not to discriminate and have the attitude of the employer is right always," Chelugui said. "Number two is the pay is reasonable and commensurate to the work."
ny: "Tikufuna kuti nawonso upscale lamulo lawo kuteteza antchito ndi olemba ntchito mofanana, osati tsankho ndi kukhala ndi maganizo a abwana ndi bwino nthawi zonse," Chelugui anati. "Nambala yachiwiri ndi malipiro ndi omveka komanso ofanana ndi ntchito."

en: VOA reached out to the Saudi embassy in Nairobi for comment on alleged mistreatment and deaths of Kenyan workers. In an email response, the embassy said the kingdom does not condone illegal and ill treatment of anyone and said Riyadh is working with Nairobi to protect citizens from any offense.
ny: VOA idafikira akazembe a Saudi ku Nairobi kuti apereke ndemanga pa nkhani ya nkhanza komanso imfa za antchito a ku Kenya. Poyankha imelo, akazembewo adati ufumuwo sumalekerera kuchitira nkhanza aliyense mosavomerezeka komanso molakwika ndipo adati Riyadh ikugwira ntchito ndi Nairobi kuteteza nzika ku mlandu uliwonse.

en: Meanwhile, officials say with an estimated 2 million young people graduating each year, according to national figures, and only about 800,000 new jobs, many Kenyans will continue to go abroad to find work.
ny: Pakadali pano, akuluakulu akuti ndi achinyamata pafupifupi 2 miliyoni omwe amamaliza maphunziro chaka chilichonse, malinga ndi ziwerengero za dziko, ndi ntchito zatsopano pafupifupi 800,000 zokha, anthu ambiri a ku Kenya adzapitiriza kupita kunja kukapeza ntchito.

en: South Africa Urges Africa’s First COVID-19 Vaccine Plant to Keep Its Doors Open
ny: South Africa Ikulimbikitsa Chomera Choyamba cha Katemera wa COVID-19 ku Africa Kuti Zitseko Zake Zikhale Zotseguka

en: South African health officials are urging COVID-19 vaccine manufacturer Aspen to keep its plant in the Eastern Cape province open. This follows a Reuters article quoting Aspens senior director saying they may have to shut down as there have been no orders for their rebranded COVID vaccine.
ny: Akuluakulu azaumoyo ku South Africa akulimbikitsa wopanga katemera wa COVID-19 Aspen kuti chomera chake chikhale chotseguka m'chigawo cha Eastern Cape. Izi zikutsatira nkhani ya Reuters yomwe ikugwira mawu mtsogoleri wamkulu wa Aspens akuti mwina angafunike kutseka popeza pakhala palibe malamulo a katemera wawo wa COVID.

en: A South African-owned subsidiary of pharmaceutical giant Aspen struck a deal with American company Johnson & Johnson in March to package, price, sell and distribute its vaccine in Africa.
ny: Wothandizira wa ku South Africa wa chimphona cha mankhwala Aspen adagwirizana ndi kampani ya ku America Johnson &Johnson mu Marichi kuti apereke phukusi, mtengo, kugulitsa ndi kufalitsa katemera wake ku Africa.

en: This vaccine was rebranded as Aspenovax.
ny: Katemera ameneyu anatchedwanso Aspenovax.

en: The move was hailed by many as there had been much concern about Africas reliance on imported vaccines which were often costly and at times in short supply.
ny: Zimenezi zinatamandidwa ndi anthu ambiri chifukwa panali nkhawa kwambiri kuti anthu a ku Africa azidalira katemera wochokera kunja yemwe nthawi zambiri anali wokwera mtengo komanso nthawi zina wosowa.

en: But there have been no orders for Aspenovax. South Africas National Health Department Spokesperson Foster Mohale said the lack of orders is due to low vaccination rates not only at home, but globally.
ny: Koma pakhala palibe malamulo a Aspenovax. Mneneri wa Dipatimenti ya Zaumoyo ku South Africas Foster Mohale adati kusowa kwa malamulo ndi chifukwa cha kuchepa kwa katemera osati kunyumba kokha, komanso padziko lonse lapansi.

en: "Vaccine hesitancy is one of the factors which contribute to these low vaccination rates or demand for more vaccines which also affect the production. Because obviously we understand that they are in a business, they cant keep on producing vaccines when they know that the demand for vaccines is very low. So, we understand the situation where they are, and we sympathize with them," he said.
ny: "Kuzengereza katemera ndi chimodzi mwazinthu zomwe zimapangitsa kuti katemera akhale wotsika kwambiri kapena kufunika kwa katemera wambiri zomwe zimakhudzanso kupanga. Chifukwa chakuti mwachiwonekere timamvetsetsa kuti ali mu bizinesi, iwo sangapitirize kupanga katemera pamene akudziwa kuti kufunika kwa katemera kuli kotsika kwambiri. Choncho, timamvetsetsa mkhalidwe umene ali, ndipo timawamvera chisoni," adatero.

en: Mohale said for now, South Africa has enough vaccines. He adds that in March, 100,000 vaccines expired. And more are due to expire in June and July.
ny: Mohale adati pakali pano, South Africa ili ndi katemera wokwanira. Iye akuwonjezera kuti mu March, katemera 100,000 anatha. Ndipo zambiri zikuyenera kutha mu June ndi July.

en: However, he said that Aspens vaccine plant is important because no one knows what the future holds.
ny: Komabe, adati chomera cha katemera cha Aspens ndi chofunika chifukwa palibe amene akudziwa zomwe zili mtsogolo.

en: "We will try to engage them not to rush their decision precisely because we anticipate especially our scientists, our epidemiologists, we anticipate that the fifth wave might hit the country, South Africa, during the winter season which is a few weeks away from now. As you can see the number of daily COVID-19 patients has been rising for the past seven days," he said.
ny: "Tidzayesetsa kuwaloŵetsa kuti asafulumire chisankho chawo ndendende chifukwa tikuyembekezera makamaka asayansi athu, akatswiri athu a matenda, tikuyembekezera kuti mafunde achisanu angagunde dziko, South Africa, m'nyengo yozizira yomwe ili masabata angapo kuchokera tsopano. Monga mukuonera chiwerengero cha odwala COVID-19 tsiku ndi tsiku chakhala chikukwera kwa masiku asanu ndi awiri apitawo," adatero.

en: Professor Petro Terblanche, who is the managing director of South African company, Afrigen, which in a continent-first made an mRNA COVID vaccine using Modernas data — said the situation at Aspen is a tragedy for the industry.
ny: Pulofesa Petro Terblanche, yemwe ndi mtsogoleri wamkulu wa kampani ya ku South Africa, Afrigen, yomwe mu kontinenti yoyamba idapanga katemera wa mRNA COVID pogwiritsa ntchito deta ya Modernas - adati mkhalidwe ku Aspen ndi tsoka kwa makampani.

en: "This is just indicating again how important it is that this continent looks at policy reform. This is about how are we going to make sure that we give preferential procurement to local companies. How are we going to make sure that we create a marketplace and eco-system that will absorb local capacity? Otherwise, we will not have capacity locally in a sustainable manner and were going to get the next pandemic and we will be unprepared, and we will not have health security," said Terblanche.
ny: "Izi zikungosonyezanso kuti ndizofunikira kwambiri kuti kontinentiyi iyang'ane kusintha kwa ndondomeko. Izi ndizokhudza momwe tikuonetsetsa kuti tikupereka zogula zosankhidwa kwa makampani am'deralo. Kodi tidzaonetsetsa bwanji kuti tipange msika ndi eco-system yomwe idzayamwa mphamvu zam'deralo? Kupanda kutero, sitidzakhala ndi mphamvu m'deralo m'njira yokhazikika ndipo tinali kupita kukatenga mliri wotsatira ndipo tidzakhala osakonzekera, ndipo tidzakhalabe ndi chitetezo chaumoyo," adatero Terblanche.

en: She believes money should also be put into educating people on the importance of vaccines.
ny: Iye akukhulupirira kuti ndalama ziyenera kuikidwanso pophunzitsa anthu kufunika kwa katemera.

en: "We need to ensure that we also put effort into advocacy for vaccination. Because we now have 17% of the continent that is vaccinated. We need to get them to at least 40% to ensure that we fully arrest this pandemic," she said.
ny: "Tiyenera kuonetsetsa kuti tikuyesetsanso kulimbikitsa katemera. Chifukwa tsopano tili ndi 17% ya kontinenti yomwe imapatsidwa katemera. Tiyenera kuwafikitsa osachepera 40% kuonetsetsa kuti tikumanga mokwanira mliriwu," adatero.

en: Mohale was unable to say when the Health Department would be meeting with Aspens executives.
ny: Mohale sanathe kunena kuti ndi liti pamene Dipatimenti ya Zaumoyo idzakhala ikukumana ndi akuluakulu a Aspens.

en: Journalists in Ethiopia Say Press Freedom is at 'Crossroads'
ny: Atolankhani ku Ethiopia Amati Ufulu Wofalitsa Nkhani uli pa 'Crossroads'

en: When Ethiopia's Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed took office four years ago, Reporters Without Borders, a Paris-based group that promotes press freedom, raised Ethiopia's ranking in its international press freedom index by 40 places.
ny: Pamene Nduna Yaikulu ya Ethiopia Abiy Ahmed adayamba kugwira ntchito zaka zinayi zapitazo, reporters Without Borders, gulu la Paris lomwe limalimbikitsa ufulu wa atolankhani, linakweza malo a Ethiopia mu index yake ya ufulu wa atolankhani padziko lonse ndi malo 40.

en: It was a giant leap forward after decades of media repression by the state. But since the war between federal government forces and rebels in the Tigray region began in late 2020, Ethiopia has dropped in the rankings.
ny: Kunali kupita patsogolo kwakukulu pambuyo pa zaka makumi ambiri za kupondereza kwa ofalitsa nkhani kwa boma. Koma kuyambira pamene nkhondo pakati pa magulu ankhondo a boma la federal ndi oukira m'chigawo cha Tigray inayamba kumapeto kwa 2020, Ethiopia yatsika m'malo.

en: To mark World Press Freedom Day 2022, VOA spoke to Ethiopian journalists about how free they feel to carry out their work.
ny: Kukumbukira Tsiku la Ufulu Wofalitsa Nkhani Padziko Lonse la 2022, VOA adalankhula ndi atolankhani a ku Ethiopia za momwe amamvera ufulu wogwira ntchito yawo.

en: Elias Meseret, who worked with the Associated Press, told VOA that press freedom in Ethiopia is at a crossroads.
ny: Elias Meseret, yemwe adagwira ntchito ndi Associated Press, adauza VOA kuti ufulu wa atolankhani ku Ethiopia uli pa mphambano.

en: "Overall, I can say that lack of professionalism and also extreme views have become the hallmarks of the state of the media in Ethiopia, at this point in time," Elias said. "For this to change, I think the government has a responsibility to let media professionals do their job freely. This means without any harassment and intimidation."
ny: "Chonsecho, ndikhoza kunena kuti kusowa kwa akatswiri komanso malingaliro okhwima akhala zizindikiro za boma la atolankhani ku Ethiopia, panthawiyi," adatero Elias. "Kuti izi zisinthe, ndikuganiza kuti boma lili ndi udindo wolola akatswiri ofalitsa nkhani kugwira ntchito yawo momasuka. Izi zikutanthauza popanda kuvutitsidwa ndi kuwopsezedwa."

en: Assegid Mulugeta, a radio presenter for the government-owned broadcaster, the Ethiopian Broadcasting Corporation, or EBC, thinks press freedom has improved in recent years. In 2018, the prime minister released all journalists from prison, However, that progress has since been reversed according to Ethiopian journalists, who documented that 46 journalists were detained in the country in 2021, making Ethiopia one of the worst jailers of journalists in Africa.
ny: Assegid Mulugeta, yemwe ndi mtsogoleri wa wailesi ya wailesi ya boma, bungwe la Ethiopian Broadcasting Corporation, kapena EBC, akuganiza kuti ufulu wa atolankhani wawongokera m'zaka zaposachedwa. Mu 2018, nduna yaikulu inatulutsa atolankhani onse m'ndende, Komabe, kupita patsogolo kumeneko kwasinthidwa malinga ndi atolankhani a ku Ethiopia, omwe adalemba kuti atolankhani 46 adasungidwa m'dzikoli mu 2021, zomwe zimapangitsa Ethiopia kukhala imodzi mwa oyang'anira ndende oipitsitsa a atolankhani ku Africa.

en: The state-backed Ethiopian Human Rights Commission released a statement Tuesday expressing concern for journalist Gobeze Sisay, whose whereabouts are unknown since plainclothes officers arrested him on Sunday.
ny: Bungwe lothandizidwa ndi boma la Ethiopian Human Rights Commission linatulutsa mawu Lachiwiri osonyeza nkhawa kwa mtolankhani Gobeze Sisay, yemwe malo ake sakudziwika popeza akuluakulu ovala zovala wamba adamugwira Lamlungu.

en: Another journalist, Amir Aman Kiyaro, and his colleague Thomas Engida were arrested in November and released in March. But they still may face years in prison if convicted of violating the country's wartime state of emergency law and anti-terrorism law.
ny: Mtolankhani wina, Amir Aman Kiyaro, ndi mnzake Thomas Engida anamangidwa mu November ndipo anamasulidwa mu March. Komabe angayang'anizane ndi zaka zambiri m'ndende ngati apezedwa ndi mlandu wophwanya malamulo a nthawi ya nkhondo m'dzikoli komanso malamulo oletsa uchigawenga.

en: Still, radio presenter Assegid said he sees improvement.
ny: Komabe, wotsogolera wailesi Assegid adati akuwona kusintha.

en: Under the pre-2018 government where the Tigray People's Liberation Front political party dominated, he said, there were "lots of stifling systems, there was lots of censorship, there was beating of journalists, there was lots of pressures and censorship against journalists and now we are seeing the booming of YouTube and online media … this is a good thing to hear."
ny: Pansi pa boma la pre-2018 kumene chipani cha ndale cha Tigray People's Liberation Front chinalamulira, adati, panali "machitidwe ambiri oletsa, panali zambiri zowunikira, panali kumenya atolankhani, panali zovuta zambiri komanso kuwunika kwa atolankhani ndipo tsopano tikuwona kukula kwa YouTube ndi atolankhani pa intaneti ... ichi ndi chinthu chabwino kumva."

en: Sisay Sahlu, editor at The Reporter, a private newspaper based in Addis Ababa, said independent media often get stonewalled by the government.
ny: Sisay Sahlu, mkonzi wa nyuzipepala ya The Reporter, nyuzipepala ya payekha yomwe ili ku Addis Ababa, adati atolankhani odziimira pawokha nthawi zambiri amalepheretsedwa ndi boma.

en: "My experience and the experience of my friends from public media is totally different," he said. "As a private newspaper employee, it's tough to get information for me."
ny: "Zomwe ndakumana nazo komanso zomwe anzanga akukumana nazo kuchokera ku atolankhani aboma ndizosiyana kotheratu," adatero. "Monga wogwira ntchito m'nyuzipepala payekha, zimakhala zovuta kupeza chidziwitso kwa ine."

en: Sisay said that for a simple story, he might call 10 officials, who all may be unwilling to answer his questions.
ny: Sisay ananena kuti pa nkhani yosavuta, akhoza kuitana akuluakulu 10, omwe onse angakhale osafuna kuyankha mafunso ake.

en: "When you call them, they don't give us any clue," he said. "We write a letter to them, they are not talking. Finally, when we publish [the story], they are coming to our office. Sometimes they are on the phone and start a verbal fight. Either they are giving us information or not."
ny: "Mukawaimbira foni, samatipatsa chidziwitso chilichonse," adatero. "Timawalembera kalata, sakulankhula. Pomaliza, pamene tifalitsa [nkhaniyi], iwo akubwera ku ofesi yathu. Nthawi zina amakhala pa foni n'kuyamba kumenyana ndi mawu. Mwina akutipatsa chidziwitso kapena ayi."

en: A government spokesman was not immediately available for comment.
ny: Mneneri wa boma sanapezeke mwamsanga kuti apereke ndemanga.

en: In the latest World Press Freedom Index, Ethiopia is ranked 114th, down 13 places from its ranking in 2021.
ny: Mu World Press Freedom Index yaposachedwa, Ethiopia ili pa 114th, pansi malo 13 kuchokera pa malo ake mu 2021.

en: Editor's note: The story has been updated with additional information about the arrests of journalists.
ny: Cholemba cha mkonzi: Nkhaniyi yasinthidwa ndi zina zowonjezera zokhudzana ndi kumangidwa kwa atolankhani.

en: As Tigray Aid Blockade Continues, Nearby Areas Also in Desperate Need of Food, Medicine
ny: Pamene Kutsekedwa kwa Chithandizo cha Tigray Kukupitirizabe, Madera Oyandikana Nawonso Akufunikira Kwambiri Chakudya, Mankhwala

en: Despite Ethiopias declared humanitarian cease-fire with Tigrayan rebels, aid groups said they are struggling to get food and medicine to those in need. Even outside the worst affected areas in Tigray, which are off limits to reporters, providing aid is fraught with risks and challenges.
ny: Ngakhale kuti dziko la Ethiopia linalengeza kuti anthu aleka kumenya nkhondo ndi zigawenga za Tigrayan, magulu othandiza anthu anati akuvutika kupeza chakudya ndi mankhwala kwa anthu ovutika. Ngakhale kunja kwa madera okhudzidwa kwambiri ku Tigray, omwe alibe malire kwa atolankhani, kupereka chithandizo kuli ndi zoopsa ndi zovuta.

en: In Ethiopias northern Amhara region, burned tanks and other ruined military equipment lie at the roadside four months after occupying forces of the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front, or TPLF, left the area. As the region recovers from a brutal civil war, the U.N. said some 9.4 million people in the Amhara region and neighboring Afar and Tigray regions need humanitarian assistance. But aid has been slow to arrive.
ny: M'chigawo cha kumpoto kwa Amhara ku Ethiopia, akasinja otenthedwa ndi zida zina zankhondo zowonongeka zili m'mphepete mwa msewu miyezi inayi pambuyo pa kulanda magulu ankhondo a Tigray Peoples Liberation Front, kapena TPLF, kuchoka m'deralo. Pamene chigawochi chikuchira kuchokera ku nkhondo yapachiweniweni yankhanza, bungwe la UN linati anthu pafupifupi 9.4 miliyoni m'dera la Amhara komanso madera oyandikana nawo a Afar ndi Tigray akufunikira thandizo. Koma chithandizo chakhala chochedwa kufika.

en: Seventeen-year-old Ahmed Nuru was living in the Oromia region, but said he had to flee after facing persecution for his Amhara ethnicity. He lost his mother when he was young. Last year, his father died after being unable to get lifesaving treatment due to the wars impact on the local health care system.
ny: Ahmed Nuru wazaka khumi ndi zisanu ndi ziwiri anali kukhala m'chigawo cha Oromia, koma adati ayenera kuthawa atakumana ndi chizunzo chifukwa cha mtundu wake wa Amhara. Amayi ake anamwalira ali wamng'ono. Chaka chatha, bambo ake anamwalira atalephera kupeza chithandizo chopulumutsa moyo chifukwa cha zotsatira za nkhondo pa dongosolo la zaumoyo m'deralo.

en: Now, Nuru is left to take care of his sisters, ages 10 and 8. He said life is very difficult and doesnt know how he will be able to raise his sisters.
ny: Tsopano, Nuru wasiyidwa kuti asamalire alongo ake, azaka 10 ndi 8. Iye anati moyo ndi wovuta kwambiri ndipo sakudziwa kuti adzatha bwanji kulera alongo ake.

en: Daniel Tigabu, a public health officer based in the camp for the displaced where Ahmed lives, said there is not enough medical equipment or medicine. The center is running out of basic medical kits, as well as a shortage of kits for malaria, hepatitis and HIV testing.
ny: Daniel Tigabu, yemwe ndi mkulu wa zaumoyo wa anthu omwe ali mumsasa wa anthu othaŵa kwawo kumene Ahmed amakhala, adati palibe zipangizo zachipatala kapena mankhwala okwanira. Malowa akutha zida zoyambirira zachipatala, komanso kuchepa kwa zida zoyezera malungo, chiwindi ndi HIV.

en: Tens of thousands live in camps for the displaced in the Amhara region. Others live in host communities, like Tsgenet Tibebu, who lost her husband during the conflict with the TPLF.
ny: Anthu zikwi makumi ambiri amakhala m'misasa ya anthu othaŵa kwawo m'dera la Amhara. Ena amakhala m'madera omwe akulandira, monga Tsgenet Tibebu, yemwe anataya mwamuna wake panthawi ya mkangano ndi TPLF.

en: Tibebu said she and her son rely on what her husbands friends provide as charity, which includes a room to stay in. As tears begin to flow, she said she is a housewife who has nothing and is waiting for support to help her raise her two children. She believes she should pay rent even though the owners have given her a place to stay. She wonders how she can plan for the future when she has nothing.
ny: Tibebu adati iye ndi mwana wake wamwamuna amadalira zomwe anzake a amuna ake amapereka monga chithandizo, chomwe chimaphatikizapo chipinda chokhaliramo. Pamene misozi ikuyamba kuyenda, iye adati ndi mkazi wa panyumba yemwe alibe kanthu ndipo akuyembekezera thandizo kuti amuthandize kulera ana ake awiri. Amakhulupirira kuti ayenera kulipira lendi ngakhale kuti eni ake amupatsa malo okhala. Amadabwa kuti angakonzekere bwanji zam'tsogolo pamene alibe kanthu.

en: Mulugeta Kebede, an aid worker who works in the Hayk camp, spoke to VOA and said stories like Nurus and Tibebus are not uncommon across Amhara.
ny: Mulugeta Kebede, wogwira ntchito yothandiza anthu omwe amagwira ntchito mumsasa wa Hayk, adalankhula ndi VOA ndipo adati nkhani monga Nurus ndi Tibebus sizachilendo kudutsa Amhara.

en: He said the situation makes aid workers cry day and night. He said if someone is hungry, they cant sleep because they think about their empty stomach. He said he has seen displaced people sell pans or mattresses to surved and added that the situation is at a critical stage.
ny: Iye adati mkhalidwewu umapangitsa ogwira ntchito yothandiza anthu kulira usana ndi usiku. Iye anati ngati wina ali ndi njala, iwo sangagone chifukwa amaganiza za mimba yawo yopanda kanthu. Iye adati wawona anthu othaŵa kwawo akugulitsa mapani kapena matiresi kuti oganiza ndipo adawonjezera kuti zinthu zili pa nthawi yovuta.

en: About 30,000 people displaced by conflict live just north of Hayk, in Weldiya. A local government representative, Habtemariam Assefa, North Wollo Zone spokesperson, said there was a little support shortly after TPLF left, after the area had been a conflict zone for months. But, he said, aid has been distributed only twice since and the aid provided by the U.N. or the federal government is not enough.
ny: Anthu pafupifupi 30,000 othaŵa kwawo chifukwa cha nkhondo amakhala kumpoto kwa Hayk, ku Weldiya. Woimira boma la m'deralo, Habtemariam Assefa, mneneri wa North Wollo Zone, adati panali chithandizo pang'ono TPLF itangochoka, pambuyo poti derali lakhala malo otsutsana kwa miyezi yambiri. Koma, iye adati, chithandizo chagawidwa kawiri kokha kuyambira pamenepo ndipo chithandizo choperekedwa ndi U.N. kapena boma la federal sichikwanira.

en: North of the Amhara region, in Tigray where journalists are banned from entering, the U.N. said the situation is worse, with famine-like conditions. Tigray is under a de facto humanitarian blockade, according to the U.N.
ny: Kumpoto kwa chigawo cha Amhara, ku Tigray komwe atolankhani akuletsedwa kulowa, bungwe la U.N. linati zinthu zafika poipa kwambiri, ndipo zinthu zili ngati njala. Tigray ali pansi pa kutsekedwa kwa chithandizo, malinga ndi U.N.

en: For now, all Ahmed Nuru and his sisters can do is try to scrape by and hope more assistance arrives soon.
ny: Pakadali pano, zonse zomwe Ahmed Nuru ndi alongo ake angachite ndikuyesera kupeza ndikuyembekeza kuti thandizo lambiri lifika posachedwa.

en: State Group Investigates Video Allegedly Showing Abuse by Ethiopian Army
ny: Gulu la Boma Likufufuza Kanema Yomwe Ikunenedwa Kuti Ikuwonetsa Nkhanza ndi Asilikali a ku Ethiopia

en: The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission is investigating a video shared online that appears to show government troops abusing and shooting an ethnic Tigrayan boy.
ny: Bungwe Loona za Ufulu wa Anthu ku Ethiopia likufufuza kanema yomwe yagawidwa pa intaneti yomwe ikuwoneka kuti ikuwonetsa asilikali a boma akuchitira nkhanza ndi kuwombera mnyamata wa fuko la Tigrayan.

en: The four-minute video shows an alleged ethnic Tigray teenager being surrounded by men in Ethiopian army uniforms. The forces are seen abusing the boy, who they refer to as being from Abbi Adi, a location in the northern Tigray region of Ethiopia.
ny: Kanema wa mphindi zinayi akuwonetsa wachinyamata wa fuko la Tigray yemwe akuti akuzunguliridwa ndi amuna ovala yunifolomu ya asilikali a ku Ethiopia. Maguluwo akuwoneka akuchitira nkhanza mnyamatayo, yemwe amamutchula kuti ndi wa ku Abbi Adi, malo omwe ali kumpoto kwa dera la Tigray ku Ethiopia.

en: In response to a query from VOA, the state-run Human Rights Commission said it was "gathering information regarding the incident."
ny: Poyankha funso lochokera ku VOA, bungwe la boma loyang'anira ufulu wachibadwidwe linanena kuti "likusonkhanitsa chidziwitso chokhudza chochitikachi."

en: In the video, the boy, with blood on his face, is seen sitting while the men in uniform surround him and threaten him with death. One of the men in uniforms calls for the boy to suffer rather than being killed immediately.
ny: Mu kanema, mnyamatayo, ali ndi magazi kumaso, akuwoneka atakhala pamene amuna ovala yunifolomu akumuzungulira ndikumuopseza ndi imfa. Mmodzi mwa amuna ovala yunifolomu akufuna kuti mnyamatayo avutike m'malo mophedwa nthawi yomweyo.

en: They tell a teenage girl to forcefully feed the boy. Finally, one man steps forward and shoots the boy, and the video ends.
ny: Iwo akuuza mtsikana wina kuti adyetse mnyamatayo mwamphamvu. Potsirizira pake, mwamuna wina akupita patsogolo ndikuwombera mnyamatayo, ndipo kanemayo akutha.

en: VOA cannot independently verify the location of the incident or the identities of the individuals in the footage. Asked about the video, both the Ethiopian government communication minister and Ethiopian ministry of defense spokesperson declined to comment.
ny: VOA singatsimikizire payekha malo omwe chochitikacho chinachitika kapena zizindikiro za anthu omwe ali pazithunzi. Atafunsidwa za kanema, onse nduna yolankhulana ndi boma la Ethiopia komanso mneneri wa unduna wa zachitetezo ku Ethiopia anakana ndemanga.

en: A similar incident was reported by rights groups in January 2021 in which Ethiopian army members were seen executing a number of civilians in Mahibere Dego, in central Tigray.
ny: Chochitika chofananacho chinafotokozedwa ndi magulu omenyera ufulu mu Januware 2021 pomwe mamembala a asilikali a ku Ethiopia adawonedwa akupha anthu wamba angapo ku Mahibere Dego, pakati pa Tigray.

en: Rights group Amnesty International has verified the killing of 11 civilians in that incident.
ny: Gulu loona za ufulu wa anthu lotchedwa Amnesty International latsimikizira kuti anthu wamba 11 anaphedwa pa chochitikachi.

en: Forces from the rebel Tigray People's Liberation Front also have been accused of committing human rights violations. In February 2022, Amnesty International reported that TPLF forces and their affiliates have killed more than a dozen people and gang raped women in towns of the Amhara region they occupied.
ny: Magulu ankhondo ochokera ku gulu loukira la Tigray People's Liberation Front nawonso akhala akuimbidwa mlandu wophwanya ufulu wa anthu. Mu February 2022, Amnesty International inanena kuti magulu ankhondo a TPLF ndi othandizira awo apha anthu oposa khumi ndi awiri ndikugwirira akazi m'matauni a dera la Amhara omwe adakhala.

en: The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission recently reported that more than 740 civilians were killed in the Tigray war between July 2021 and March 2022.
ny: Bungwe Loona za Ufulu wa Anthu ku Ethiopia posachedwapa linanena kuti anthu wamba oposa 740 anaphedwa pankhondo ya Tigray pakati pa Julayi 2021 ndi Marichi 2022.

en: Both the government and the TPLF deny accusations of rights violations, saying their operations do not target civilians.
ny: Boma komanso bungwe la TPLF likukana milandu yophwanya ufulu, ndipo likuti ntchito zawo sizikukhudza anthu wamba.

en: Disinformation, Censorship, Trigger Global Retreat of Press Freedom
ny: Disinformation, Censorship, Kuyambitsa Kubwerera Padziko Lonse kwa Ufulu wofalitsa nkhani

en: Led by the Kremlin's example, a global rise in disinformation and propaganda is having a disastrous effect on independent news around the world, a new report finds.
ny: Motsogoleredwa ndi chitsanzo cha Kremlin, kukwera kwapadziko lonse kwa chinyengo ndi mabodza kukukhudza kwambiri nkhani zodziyimira pawokha padziko lonse lapansi, lipoti latsopano limapeza.

en: In its 2022 World Press Freedom Index released Tuesday, the Paris-based Reporters Without Borders (RSF) said Russia's invasion of Ukraine has contributed vastly to the spread of fake news and propaganda.
ny: Mu 2022 World Press Freedom Index yake yomwe inatulutsidwa Lachiwiri, bungwe la ku Paris la Reporters Without Borders (RSF) linanena kuti kuwukira kwa Russia ku Ukraine kwathandizira kwambiri kufalitsa nkhani zabodza komanso zofalitsa.

en: The journalism watchdog group said its findings are worrying, as they show deep divisions among media within countries and between countries at the international level.
ny: Gulu loyang'anira atolankhani linanena kuti zomwe lapeza ndizodetsa nkhawa, popeza zikuwonetsa kugawanika kwakukulu pakati pa atolankhani mkati mwa mayiko komanso pakati pa mayiko omwe ali padziko lonse lapansi.

en: "In 2022, it's really undeniable that media polarization and information chaos are really fueling social divisions in ways that are pretty new," said Clayton Weimers, deputy director of RSF for the United States, told VOA. He said the prevalence of partisan news around the world has come at the expense of authentic journalism.
ny: "Mu 2022, ndizosatsutsika kwenikweni kuti polarization media ndi chisokonezo cha chidziwitso kwenikweni zikuwonjezera kugawanika kwa anthu m'njira zomwe zili zatsopano kwambiri," adatero Clayton Weimers, wachiwiri kwa mtsogoleri wa RSF ku United States, adauza VOA. Iye adati kufalikira kwa nkhani zachipani padziko lonse lapansi kwabwera chifukwa cha utolankhani weniweni.

en: The group's annual report ranks 180 countries based on the environment for independent journalism. This year, however, RSF said it used a new method that blends each country's political, legal, economic, sociocultural and security conditions.
ny: Lipoti la pachaka la gululi likuika mayiko 180 potengera chilengedwe cha atolankhani odziimira pawokha. Komabe, chaka chino, RSF inanena kuti inagwiritsa ntchito njira yatsopano yomwe imagwirizanitsa ndale za dziko lililonse, malamulo, zachuma, chikhalidwe cha anthu ndi chitetezo.

en: Now, the index classifies a record 28 countries as "having very bad media freedom." That group includes China, which is exporting censorship beyond its borders while also amplifying the Kremlin's propaganda on Russia's devastating war against Ukraine.
ny: Tsopano, index imagawa mbiri ya mayiko 28 kuti "ali ndi ufulu woipa kwambiri wofalitsa nkhani." Gulu limenelo limaphatikizapo China, yomwe ikutumiza kunja kuwunika kupitirira malire ake pomwe ikuwonjezeranso mabodza a Kremlin pa nkhondo yowononga ya Russia ndi Ukraine.

en: Russia, China among worst
ny: Russia, China pakati pa zoipa kwambiri

en: Since its invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Russia has sought total control over news coverage, passing a new law that carries 15-year prison terms for reporting "false news" on the military, and even forbids calling the conflict a "war."
ny: Kuyambira pamene anaukira dziko la Ukraine pa 24 February, dziko la Russia lakhala likufunafuna ulamuliro wonse pa nkhani zofalitsa nkhani, ndipo likupereka lamulo latsopano lomwe limanyamula mawu a zaka 15 m'ndende chifukwa chofotokoza "nkhani zabodza" pa asilikali, ndipo ngakhale kuletsa kutcha nkhondoyo kuti ndi "nkhondo."

en: That has forced most remaining independent news outlets, including the renowned Novaya Gazeta newspaper, Ekho Moskvy radio and Dozhd TV, to shut down or move outside Russia to continue operating.
ny: Zimenezo zakakamiza atolankhani ambiri otsala odziimira pawokha, kuphatikizapo nyuzipepala yotchuka ya Novaya Gazeta, wailesi ya Ekho Moskvy ndi Dozhd TV, kutseka kapena kusamukira kunja kwa Russia kuti apitirize kugwira ntchito.

en: With independent voices absent, experts say, the Russian government has been able to flood state-run airwaves with propaganda that downplays the war and spreads false or misleading justifications for the Kremlin's invasion.
ny: Pokhala ndi mawu odziimira pawokha omwe alibe, akatswiri akuti, boma la Russia lakwanitsa kusefukira ma airwaves oyendetsedwa ndi boma ndi mabodza omwe amachepetsa nkhondo ndikufalitsa zifukwa zabodza kapena zosocheretsa za kuwukira kwa Kremlin.

en: Russia's media repression stands at 155 out of 180 countries included in RSF's index, where one is the most free and 180 the least.
ny: Kupondereza kwa atolankhani ku Russia kumayimira pa 155 mwa mayiko 180 omwe amaphatikizidwa mu index ya RSF, pomwe imodzi ndi yaulere kwambiri ndipo 180 ndi yochepa.

en: "It's safe to say at this point that the free press is a thing of the past in Russia," Clayton said.
ny: "Ndi otetezeka kunena panthawiyi kuti atolankhani aulere ndi chinthu chakale ku Russia," Clayton adatero.

en: Throughout Russian President Vladimir Putin's 22 years in power, Moscow has been targeting journalists and the independent press, he said.
ny: Pa zaka 22 zonse za Pulezidenti wa Russia Vladimir Putin mu ulamuliro, Moscow yakhala ikuyang'ana atolankhani ndi atolankhani odziimira pawokha, adatero.

en: "But since the invasion of Ukraine, it seems that Putin has really finished off the independent media once and for all in Russia," Clayton said. "At this point, it is impossible to accurately report on the war in Ukraine."
ny: "Koma kuyambira pamene anaukira Ukraine, zikuwoneka kuti Putin wamalizadi atolankhani odziimira pawokha kamodzi ku Russia," adatero Clayton. "Pa nthawi ino, n'zosatheka kufotokoza molondola za nkhondo ku Ukraine."

en: China ranked 175th in the new report. And now that it is firmly under Beijing's influence, Hong Kong also registered a dramatic decline, ranking 148th out of 180 following a lengthy series of raids and arrests that shuttered pro-democracy news sites.
ny: China inali nambala 175 mu lipoti latsopanoli. Ndipo tsopano popeza ili yolimba pansi pa chisonkhezero cha Beijing, Hong Kong inalembetsanso kuchepa kwakukulu, kukhala nambala 148 kuchokera ku 180 potsatira mndandanda wautali wa kuwukira ndi kumangidwa komwe kunatseka malo a nkhani za pro-democracy.

en: RSF's country file on China says it is the world's biggest jailer of journalists, with 120 in detention. The regime uses coercion, harassment, intimidation and surveillance to keep independent and foreign journalists from reporting on issues deemed "sensitive."
ny: Fayilo ya dziko la RSF ku China ikuti ndi ndende yaikulu kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi ya atolankhani, ndi 120 omwe ali m'ndende. Ulamulirowu umagwiritsa ntchito kukakamiza, kuzunza, kuwopseza ndi kuyang'anira kuti atolankhani odziimira pawokha komanso akunja asa kufotokoza nkhani zomwe zimaonedwa kuti ndi "zovuta."

en: "President Xi Jinping, in power since 2013, has restored a media culture worthy of the Maoist era, in which freely accessing information has become a crime and to provide information an even greater crime," RSF's country file states.
ny: "Pulezidenti Xi Jinping, yemwe akulamulira kuyambira 2013, wabwezeretsa chikhalidwe cha atolankhani choyenera nthawi ya Maoist, yomwe kupeza chidziwitso momasuka kwakhala mlandu komanso kupereka chidziwitso kukhala mlandu waukulu kwambiri," fayilo ya dziko la RSF ikutero.

en: Rising authoritarianism
ny: Kukwera kwa ulamuliro

en: North Korea remains the worst country in the rankings at 180th. Elsewhere in the Asia-Pacific region, political turmoil, conflict and rising authoritarianism have wiped out years of progress.
ny: North Korea imakhalabe dziko loipa kwambiri pa maulendo pa 180th. Kwinakwake m'chigawo cha Asia-Pacific, chisokonezo cha ndale, nkhondo ndi kukwera kwa ulamuliro wa authoritarianism kwafafaniza zaka za kupita patsogolo.

en: The 2021 coup in Myanmar marked a 10-year setback for media rights, with journalists detained, media licenses revoked, and many news outlets returning to exile. Under the military junta, Myanmar, ranking 176th, is one of the world's biggest jailers of journalists.
ny: Kulanda boma kwa 2021 ku Myanmar kunasonyeza kumbuyo kwa zaka 10 pa ufulu wofalitsa nkhani, ndi atolankhani osungidwa, ziphatso zofalitsa nkhani zinachotsedwa, ndipo atolankhani ambiri akubwerera ku ukapolo. Pansi pa junta ya asilikali, Myanmar, yomwe ili nambala 176, ndi imodzi mwa ndende zazikulu kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi za atolankhani.

en: In Afghanistan, the Taliban insurgents pledged to uphold press freedom when they took power in August 2021. Instead, RSF said the "Taliban's seizure of power has further worsened conditions for reporters and news organizations, who are the targets of all forms of intimidation and violence." Afghanistan ranked 154th.
ny: Ku Afghanistan, zigawenga za Taliban zinalonjeza kuti adzachirikiza ufulu wa atolankhani pamene adatenga ulamuliro mu Ogasiti 2021. M'malo mwake, RSF inati "kulanda mphamvu kwa Taliban kwawonjezera mikhalidwe kwa atolankhani ndi mabungwe a nkhani, omwe ali zolinga za mitundu yonse ya kuwopseza ndi chiwawa." Afghanistan inali nambala 154.

en: Across Africa, laws criminalizing online journalism have dealt a new blow to the right to information, RSF said, while the spread of rumors, propaganda, and disinformation has contributed to undermine access to quality information.
ny: Kuzungulira Africa, malamulo oletsa utolankhani wa pa intaneti awononga kwambiri ufulu wa chidziwitso, RSF idati, pamene kufalikira kwa mphekesera, mabodza, ndi chinyengo kwathandizira kusokoneza kupeza chidziwitso chabwino.

en: In Ethiopia, the war in the Tigray region, with its communication blackouts and restricted access, were the main factors that placed the country 114 on the index. Neighboring Eritrea and Djibouti are far worse, ranking near the bottom at 179 and 164, respectively.
ny: Ku Ethiopia, nkhondo m'chigawo cha Tigray, ndi kuzimiririka kwake kwa mauthenga ndi mwayi woletsedwa, zinali zinthu zazikulu zomwe zinayika dziko la 114 pa index. Dziko loyandikana nalo la Eritrea ndi Djibouti ndi loipa kwambiri, ndipo ndi pafupi ndi pansi pa 179 ndi 164.

en: African media continue to struggle economically, RSF said it its accompanying analysis.
ny: Zofalitsa za ku Africa zikupitirizabe kulimbana ndi zachuma, RSF idati ndi kusanthula kwake kotsagana nawo.

en: "Despite a wave of liberalization in the 1990s, there are still, too often, cases of arbitrary censorship, especially on the internet, with occasional network shutdowns in some countries, arrests of journalists and violent attacks," the group said.
ny: "Ngakhale mafunde a ufulu m'zaka za m'ma 1990, padakali, nthawi zambiri, milandu yowunikira mwachisawawa, makamaka pa intaneti, ndi kutsekedwa kwa intaneti nthawi zina m'mayiko ena, kumangidwa kwa atolankhani ndi ziwawa," gululi linatero.

en: Clayton said the rising authoritarianism feeds on itself.
ny: Clayton ananena kuti ulamuliro wankhanza umene ukukwera umadzidyetsa wokha.

en: "When we allow a culture of impunity to exist where authoritarians are allowed to go after journalists, harass them, arrest them, beat them in the streets and kill them, it has a knock-on effect," he said. "It emboldens that same authoritarian to do it again next time, and it emboldens other authoritarians who are watching to do the same."
ny: "Tikalola chikhalidwe chopanda chilango kukhalapo komwe olamulira amaloledwa kupita pambuyo pa atolankhani, kuwavutitsa, kuwamanga, kuwamenya m'misewu ndikuwapha, zimakhala ndi zotsatira zogogoda," adatero. "Zimalimbitsa mtima wolamulira yemweyo kuti achitenso nthawi yotsatira, ndipo zimalimbitsa mtima olamulira ena omwe akuyang'ana kuti achite zomwezo."

en: US not perfect
ny: US si wangwiro

en: After a period of seeing its media attacked as "fake news" by former President Donald Trump, the United States retained a relatively high ranking of 42 in RSF's index. That is largely thanks to the return of regular White House and federal agency press briefings.
ny: Pambuyo pa nthawi yowona atolankhani ake akuwukiridwa ngati "nkhani zabodza" ndi Purezidenti wakale Donald Trump, United States inasunga malo apamwamba kwambiri a 42 mu index ya RSF. Izi zikuchitika makamaka chifukwa cha kubwerera kwa nthawi zonse White House ndi bungwe la federal press briefings.

en: But RSF said problems persist, including "the disappearance of local newspapers, the systematic polarization of the media, and the erosion of journalism by digital platforms amid a climate of animosity and aggression toward journalists, among others."
ny: Koma RSF inati mavuto akupitirizabe, kuphatikizapo "kuzimiririka kwa manyuzipepala am'deralo, kugawanika kwadongosolo kwa atolankhani, ndi kuwonongeka kwa utolankhani ndi nsanja za digito pakati pa mkhalidwe wa udani ndi kuukira atolankhani, pakati pa ena."

en: Barriers exist, for instance, when it comes to covering state governments and protests.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, zopinga zilipo pankhani ya kuphimba maboma a boma ndi zionetsero.

en: "We typically find that this is either due to just a blatant disregard for the laws governing open records or meetings, or they're simply misinterpreting them. An individual is misinterpreting whether a journalist can be present at a particular event," said Beth Francesco, senior director of the National Press Club Journalism Institute.
ny: "Nthawi zambiri timapeza kuti zimenezi zimachitika chifukwa chongonyalanyaza malamulo okhudza zolemba kapena misonkhano yotseguka, kapena amangowamasulira molakwika. Munthu wina akumasulira molakwika ngati mtolankhani angapezeke pa chochitika china," adatero Beth Francesco, mkulu wa National Press Club Journalism Institute.

en: A few bright spots
ny: Mawanga angapo owala

en: Despite an overall trend of decline, Clayton said there are positives.
ny: Ngakhale chizoloŵezi chonse cha kuchepa, Clayton adati pali zabwino.

en: Some governments provide funding for news media without interfering in their operations, to ensure independence from political influence.
ny: Maboma ena amapereka ndalama zofalitsa nkhani popanda kulowerera ntchito zawo, kuonetsetsa ufulu wodzilamulira ku chisonkhezero cha ndale.

en: "If you look at the top of our list, some of the things that stand out are these are countries that have robust public funding for media," he said, noting that "it's always important to separate state funding for media and state-controlled media."
ny: "Mukayang'ana pamwamba pa mndandanda wathu, zinthu zina zomwe zimaonekera ndi izi ndi mayiko omwe ali ndi ndalama zolimba za boma zofalitsa nkhani," adatero, akuwona kuti "nthawi zonse ndikofunikira kulekanitsa ndalama za boma kwa atolankhani ndi atolankhani olamulidwa ndi boma."

en: Three Scandinavian countries — Norway, Denmark and Sweden — respectively come at the top of RSF's index. Estonia, a former Soviet Union republic, ranked 4th.
ny: Maiko atatu a ku Scandinavia - Norway, Denmark ndi Sweden - motsatira amabwera pamwamba pa index ya RSF. Estonia, yomwe kale inali Soviet Union republic, inali nambala 4.

en: RSF said the free exercise of journalism plays a major role in emerging democracies such as East Timor, ranked 17, Bhutan, ranked 33, and Mongolia, ranked 90.
ny: RSF inati kugwiritsa ntchito kwaufulu kwa utolankhani kumathandiza kwambiri pa ma demokalase omwe akutulukira monga East Timor, omwe ali pa 17, Bhutan, omwe ali pa 33, ndi Mongolia, omwe ali pa 90.

en: East Timor was one country whose ranking skyrocketed, rising 54 places. But RSF cautioned that because of its change in methodology this year, "care should be taken when comparing the 2022 rankings and scores with those from 2021."
ny: East Timor inali dziko limodzi limene malo ake anakwera kwambiri, kukwera malo 54. Koma RSF inachenjeza kuti chifukwa cha kusintha kwake kwa njira chaka chino, "chisamaliro chiyenera kutengedwa poyerekeza maulendo a 2022 ndi zolemba ndi zomwe zimachokera ku 2021."

en: UN’s Guterres Meets with Nigerian Leaders After Visiting Volatile Borno State
ny: Guterres wa UN Akumana ndi Atsogoleri a ku Nigeria Atapita ku Volatile Borno State

en: U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres met with Nigerian leaders Wednesday at the end of a two-day visit to Nigeria and three-nation trip to Africa. On Tuesday, he visited internally displaced people (IDPs) in northeast Nigeria and called for them to be safely returned to their homes. Nigerian authorities plan to close all IDP camps in the next few years despite security concerns.  Antonio Guterres arrived the United Nations house in Abuja around 9 a.m. Wednesday and met with U.N. local coordinators before holding talks with Nigerian womens representatives.
ny: Mlembi wamkulu wa UN Antonio Guterres adakumana ndi atsogoleri a Nigeria Lachitatu kumapeto kwa ulendo wa masiku awiri ku Nigeria ndi ulendo wa mayiko atatu ku Africa. Lachiwiri, adayendera anthu othaŵa kwawo (IDPs) kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa Nigeria ndipo adapempha kuti abwezeredwe bwinobwino kunyumba zawo. Akuluakulu a ku Nigeria akukonzekera kutseka misasa yonse ya IDP m'zaka zingapo zikubwerazi ngakhale kuti ali ndi nkhawa za chitetezo.  Antonio Guterres anafika kunyumba ya United Nations ku Abuja cha m'ma 9 koloko m'mawa. Lachitatu ndipo anakumana ndi oyang'anira am'deralo a UN asanachite zokambirana ndi oimira akazi a ku Nigeria.

en: The delegates, led by Nigeria's minister for womens affairs, Pauline Kedem Tallen, discussed gender equality and the inclusion of women in politics with the U.N. secretary-general.
ny: Nthumwi, motsogozedwa ndi nduna yoona za akazi ku Nigeria, Pauline Kedem Tallen, anakambirana za kufanana kwa amuna ndi akazi komanso kuphatikiza akazi pa ndale ndi mlembi wamkulu wa bungwe la United States.

en: "His coming to Nigeria today has given us hope, because we know that he will lend his voice to all the issues affecting women, gender-based violence, early marriage, lack of implementation of some of our laws," said Tallen.
ny: "Kubwera kwake ku Nigeria lero kwatipatsa chiyembekezo, chifukwa tikudziwa kuti adzapereka mawu ake pa nkhani zonse zomwe zikukhudza azimayi, chiwawa cha amuna ndi akazi, ukwati woyambirira, kusowa kwa malamulo athu ena," adatero Tallen.

en: Guterres afterwards met with Nigeria's religious leaders and later attended a wreath-laying ceremony at the U.N. house to remember the 23 people killed during the 2011 bombing of the building.
ny: Pambuyo pake Guterres adakumana ndi atsogoleri achipembedzo a ku Nigeria ndipo pambuyo pake adapezeka pamwambo woika korona kunyumba ya UN kukumbukira anthu 23 omwe anaphedwa pa bomba la nyumbayi mu 2011.

en: He began his three-nation Africa visit Sunday in Senegal as part of his Ramadan solidarity tour, and later went to Niger.
ny: Anayamba ulendo wake wa mayiko atatu ku Africa Lamlungu ku Senegal monga gawo la ulendo wake wa mgwirizano wa Ramadan, ndipo kenako anapita ku Niger.

en: On Tuesday, he visited northeastern Borno state and met with the state governor as well as IDPs and families impacted by the Boko Haram conflict.
ny: Lachiwiri, adayendera kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa boma la Borno ndipo adakumana ndi bwanamkubwa wa boma komanso idPs ndi mabanja omwe anakhudzidwa ndi nkhondo ya Boko Haram.

en: Guterres also visited repentant Boko Haram fighters and praised authorities' reintegration program for more than 1,000 former fighters.
ny: Guterres adayenderanso asilikali a Boko Haram omwe adalapa ndipo adayamikira pulogalamu yobwezeretsanso akuluakulu a boma kwa anthu oposa 1,000 omwe kale anali ankhondo.

en: He also commended authorities efforts to resettle displaced people back to their communities and called for more support to rebuild the region.  "The Borno that I found today is the Borno of hope, the Borno with future and I was very impressed to see the policy that is being deployed here, recognizing that you don't fight terrorism just by military means, you fight terrorism addressing the root causes of terrorism," he said. "The people that I met today in the IDP camps want to go back home in safety and dignity. The way to address terrorism effectively is to provide not only hope but a future of reality."
ny: Iye anayamikiranso akuluakulu a boma pofuna kukhazikitsanso anthu othaŵa kwawo kubwerera kumadera awo ndipo anapempha kuti athandizidwe kwambiri kuti amangenso chigawochi.  "Borno yemwe ndapeza lero ndi Borno wa chiyembekezo, Borno yemwe ali ndi tsogolo ndipo ndinachita chidwi kwambiri kuona ndondomeko yomwe ikugwiritsidwa ntchito pano, pozindikira kuti simukulimbana ndi uchigawenga mwa njira zankhondo zokha, mumalimbana ndi uchigawenga pothana ndi zoyambitsa uchigawenga," adatero. "Anthu amene ndakumana nawo lero m'misasa ya IDP akufuna kubwerera kwawo mwachitetezo ndi ulemu. Njira yothetsera uchigawenga mogwira mtima ndiyo kupereka osati chiyembekezo chokha komanso tsogolo la zenizeni."

en: Nigerian authorities have been closing IDP camps since late last year and want to close all camps by 2026. More than 2 million people have been displaced from their homes since the start of the Boko Haram insurgency in 2009.
ny: Akuluakulu a ku Nigeria akhala akutseka misasa ya IDP kuyambira kumapeto kwa chaka chatha ndipo akufuna kutseka misasa yonse pofika 2026. Anthu oposa 2 miliyoni athamangitsidwa m'nyumba zawo kuyambira pamene gulu loukira la Boko Haram linayamba mu 2009.

en: But aid groups have been warning some communities may still be attacked.
ny: Koma magulu othandiza anthu akhala akuchenjeza kuti anthu ena akhoza kuukiridwabe.

en: "There are multiple solutions when it comes to resettlement. We need to get people stabilized," said Adenike Oladosu, a climate justice activist, met with the U.N. secretary-general. "Climate change is leading to the rise of armed conflicts affecting people in the region and around and the need for us to see that we have more climate action and not always military action."
ny: "Pali njira zambiri zothetsera vutoli pankhani yokhazikitsanso. Tiyenera kuti anthu akhazikike," adatero Adenike Oladosu, yemwe amagwira ntchito zachilungamo cha nyengo, adakumana ndi mlembi wamkulu wa UN. "Kusintha kwa nyengo kukutsogolera kukwera kwa nkhondo zomwe zikukhudza anthu m'deralo komanso mozungulira komanso kufunika kwa ife kuti tiwone kuti tili ndi zochita zambiri za nyengo osati nthawi zonse zochita zankhondo."

en: The U.N. secretary-general ended his visit at the Abuja presidential village, where he met with President Muhammadu Buhari and his top Cabinet members.
ny: Mlembi wamkulu wa UN adathetsa ulendo wake kumudzi wa pulezidenti wa Abuja, komwe adakumana ndi Purezidenti Muhammadu Buhari ndi mamembala ake apamwamba a Cabinet.

en: Al-Shabab Raids African Union Military Base
ny: Al-Shabab Raids African Union Military Base

en: Al-Shabab fighters stormed an African Union military base in the village of El-Baraf in Somalias Middle Shabelle region early Tuesday, local officials and security sources say.
ny: Asilikali a Al-Shabab adawombera malo a asilikali a African Union m'mudzi wa El-Baraf m'dera la Somalias Middle Shabelle m'mawa Lachiwiri, akuluakulu am'deralo ndi magwero achitetezo akuti.

en: Officials told VOA Somali that the militants briefly seized the base before withdrawing from it. State media said Burundian solders at the base repulsed the attack.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma anauza VOA Somali kuti zigawengazo zinalanda malowa kwa kanthawi kochepa asanachokemo. Nyuzipepala za boma zinati ogulitsa malonda a ku Burundi pamalopo ananyansa kuukirako.

en: "The Federal Government of Somalia condemns in the strongest possible terms the heinous attack targeting the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia forward operating base in Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle," the Somali Ministry of Foreign Affairs posted on its official Facebook page.
ny: "Boma la Federal la Somalia likutsutsa mwamphamvu kwambiri kuukira koopsa kwa African Union Transition Mission ku Somalia patsogolo pa maziko ogwira ntchito ku Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle," Unduna wa Zakunja wa Somalia unaikidwa patsamba lake lovomerezeka la Facebook.

en: "We extend our deepest condolences to the victims of this terrorist attack and their families."
ny: "Tikupereka chisoni chathu chachikulu kwa anthu amene anaphedwa ndi zigawenga zimenezi ndi mabanja awo."
