en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, said the militants started their attack with two suicide truck bombs. He said the militants then fought their way onto the base.
ny: Meya wa El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, adati ankhondowo adayamba kuukira kwawo ndi mabomba awiri a galimoto odzipha. Iye anati ankhondowo kenaka anamenyana njira yawo pa maziko.

en: Al-Shabab claimed the killing of 173 African Union forces. The group also claimed responsibility for capturing AU forces as prisoners-of-war. Both claims could not be independently verified. AU force headquarters and Somali military officials could not be immediately reached for comment.
ny: Al-Shabab inanena kuti asilikali 173 a African Union anaphedwa. Gululi linanenanso kuti lili ndi udindo wogwira magulu a AU ngati akaidi-a-nkhondo. Mawu onsewa sanathe kutsimikiziridwa paokha. Likulu la gulu lankhondo la AU ndi akuluakulu a asilikali a Somalia sanafikiridwe mwamsanga kuti apereke ndemanga.

en: In an interview with VOA, Muhumed, who was not at the village at the time of the attack, said he was told there were "many deaths" among Burundian forces but could not give an exact figure.
ny: Poyankhulana ndi VOA, Muhumed, yemwe sanali pa mudziwu panthawi yomwe anaukira, adati adauzidwa kuti pali "imfa zambiri" pakati pa magulu ankhondo a Burundi koma sangathe kupereka chiwerengero chenicheni.

en: "Fighting like this never happened in this area," he said. "It was heavy fighting."
ny: "Kulimbana ngati kumeneku sikunachitikepo m'dera lino," adatero. "Inali nkhondo yaikulu."

en: He said two civilians were also killed and more than 10 others injured.
ny: Iye adati anthu wamba awiri adaphedwanso ndipo ena oposa 10 avulala.

en: Muhumed confirmed to VOA that al-Shabab militants withdrew from the base. He also reported airstrikes targeting the militants as they left the base but did not say who was responsible for the strikes.
ny: Muhumed adatsimikiza ku VOA kuti asilikali a al-Shabab adachoka pamalopo. Iye adanenanso za kuwukira kwa ndege kwa ankhondowo pamene adachoka pamalopo koma sananene kuti ndi ndani yemwe anachititsa kumenya kumeneku.

en: El-Baraf, approximately 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu, is one of the forward operating bases of African Union forces from Burundi.
ny: El-Baraf, pafupifupi makilomita 150 kumpoto kwa Mogadishu, ndi imodzi mwa malo oyendetsa kutsogolo kwa magulu ankhondo a African Union ochokera ku Burundi.

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
ny: Chochitikachi chinali kuukira kwakukulu koyamba kwa al-Shabab pa magulu a AU kuyambira pamene ntchitoyi inasintha dzina lake ndi zomangamanga zogwirira ntchito mwezi watha.

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS), gives it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity-building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to Somalia. The mission has until the end of 2024 to operate in the country.
ny: Bungwe la UN Security Council, lomwe linavomereza ntchito yatsopano yotchedwa African Union Transition Mission ku Somalia (ATMIS), limapereka mphamvu yochepetsera chiwopsezo chomwe al-Shabab imapereka, kuthandizira kupanga mphamvu za magulu achitetezo a Somalia, ndikuchita gawo lopereka maudindo achitetezo ku Somalia. Ntchitoyi ili mpaka kumapeto kwa 2024 kuti igwire ntchito m'dzikoli.

en: India’s Muslims Mark Eid al-Fitr Amid Community Violence
ny: Asilamu a ku India Mark Eid al-Fitr Pakati pa Chiwawa cha Anthu

en: Muslims across India marked Eid al-Fitr on Tuesday by offering prayers outside mosques, even as the celebrations this year came in the backdrop of a series of recent attacks against the community during the month of Ramadan.
ny: Asilamu kuzungulira India adasonyeza Eid al-Fitr Lachiwiri popereka mapemphero kunja kwa mizikiti, ngakhale pamene zikondwerero chaka chino zinabwera kumbuyo kwa mndandanda wa kuukira kwaposachedwa kwa anthu m'deralo m'mwezi wa Ramadan.

en: "We will not have the same kind of festivity" this time, said Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, a civil engineer in Indias financial capital, Mumbai. "This is the most painful Eid with worst memories for Indian Muslims."
ny: "Sitidzakhala ndi mtundu womwewo wa phwando" nthawi ino, adatero Mohammad Habeeb Wanu Rehman, injiniya wa zomangamanga ku likulu la ndalama ku India, Mumbai. "Iyi ndi Eid yopweteka kwambiri yokhala ndi zikumbukiro zoipa kwambiri kwa Asilamu a ku India."

en: Anti-Muslim sentiment and attacks have surged across the country in the last month, including stone throwing between Hindu and Muslim groups during religious processions and subsequent demolitions of a number of properties mostly belonging to Muslims by authorities.
ny: Maganizo odana ndi Asilamu komanso kuukira kwawonjezeka m'dziko lonselo mwezi watha, kuphatikizapo kuponya miyala pakati pa magulu a Ahindu ndi Asilamu pa ndondomeko zachipembedzo komanso kugwetsa katundu wambiri makamaka wa Asilamu ndi akuluakulu.

en: The community, which makes up 14% of Indias 1.4 billion population, is reeling from vilification by hard-line Hindu nationalists who have long espoused an anti-Muslim stance. Some leaders of Indias ruling Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party have tacitly supported the violence, while Prime Minister Narendra Modi has so far been silent about it. Eid al-Fitr is typically marked with communal prayers, celebratory gatherings around festive meals and new clothes, but celebrations in India for the past two years have been marred by COVID-19 restrictions.
ny: Dera, lomwe limapanga 14% ya anthu a ku India 1.4 biliyoni, likugwedezeka chifukwa cha kunyozedwa ndi Ahindu olimba omwe akhala akugwirizana ndi kaimidwe kotsutsana ndi Asilamu. Atsogoleri ena a Indias omwe akulamulira chipani cha Hindu cha Bharatiya Janata Party athandizira mobisa chiwawachi, pomwe Prime Minister Narendra Modi pakadali pano akhala chete. Eid al-Fitr nthawi zambiri amadziwika ndi mapemphero amtundu, misonkhano yokondwerera kuzungulira chakudya chachikondwerero ndi zovala zatsopano, koma zikondwerero ku India kwa zaka ziwiri zapitazi zasokonezedwa ndi ziletso za COVID-19.

en: In Indian-controlled Kashmir, the Muslim festival has been subdued for the past three years because of an unprecedented military lockdown after India stripped the regions semi-autonomy in 2019, followed by the pandemic. The region also saw a rise in violence during Ramadan, with at least 20 militants, two civilians and five police and soldiers killed.
ny: Ku Kashmir yomwe ikulamulidwa ndi India, chikondwerero cha Asilamu chakhala chikugonjetsedwa kwa zaka zitatu zapitazi chifukwa cha kutsekedwa kwa asilikali kosaneneka pambuyo poti India idachotsa madera omwe ali ndi ufulu wodzilamulira mu 2019, kenako mliriwu. Derali linawonanso kuwonjezeka kwa chiwawa pa Ramadan, ndipo asilikali osachepera 20, anthu wamba awiri ndi apolisi ndi asilikali asanu aphedwa.

en: "As we prepare to celebrate Eid, a strong sense of collective loss jars at us," said Bashir Ahmed, a businessman in Srinagar.
ny: "Pamene tikukonzekera kukondwerera Eid, lingaliro lamphamvu la mitsuko yotayika pamodzi pa ife," adatero Bashir Ahmed, wamalonda ku Srinagar.

en: Kashmir is the Muslim-majority disputed region where a violent insurgency against Indian rule and New Delhis brutal crackdown has raged for over three decades. Tens of thousands of people have died in the conflict.
ny: Kashmir ndi dera la Asilamu ambiri omwe amatsutsana nawo komwe kuwukira kwachiwawa kwa ulamuliro wa India ndi nkhanza za New Delhis zakhala zikuchitika kwa zaka zoposa makumi atatu. Anthu zikwi makumi ambiri afa pa nkhondoyi.

en: Meanwhile in the capital, New Delhi, hundreds assembled in the Jama Masjid, one of Indias largest mosques, while offering Eid prayers there for the first time in over two years due to pandemic restrictions. Families came together early on Tuesday morning while many people shared hugs and wishes.
ny: Pakadali pano ku likulu, New Delhi, mazana ambiri adasonkhana ku Jama Masjid, imodzi mwa mizikiti yayikulu kwambiri ku India, pamene akupereka mapemphero a Eid kumeneko kwa nthawi yoyamba m'zaka zoposa ziwiri chifukwa cha ziletso za mliri. Mabanja anasonkhana pamodzi m'mawa Lachiwiri pamene anthu ambiri ankagawana kukumbatirana ndi zofuna.

en: Beijing Residents Brace for COVID-19 Lockdown
ny: Anthu okhala ku Beijing Akukonzekera Kutsekedwa kwa COVID-19

en: Unlike Shanghai, Beijing has yet to require that all its residents remain at home to contain the spread of COVID-19. Nevertheless, many people in its Chaoyang district and elsewhere are preparing for that possibility.
ny: Mosiyana ndi Shanghai, Beijing idakalibe kufuna kuti nzika zake zonse zikhalebe kunyumba kuti zikhale ndi kufalikira kwa COVID-19. Komabe, anthu ambiri m'chigawo chake cha Chaoyang ndi kwina kulikonse akukonzekera kuthekera kumeneko.

en: On Wednesday, city officials closed 60 subway stations, more than 10% of Beijing's vast system. They did not say when service would be resumed, according to ABC News.
ny: Lachitatu, akuluakulu a mzinda anatseka malo okwerera sitima zapamtunda a 60, oposa 10% ya dongosolo lalikulu la Beijing. Iwo sananene kuti ndi liti pamene utumiki udzayambiranso, malinga ndi ABC News.

en: Beijing, a city of 21 million people, has been on high alert for the spread of COVID-19, as restaurants and bars pivot to takeout, gyms close and schools suspend classes indefinitely, according to CNBC.
ny: Beijing, mzinda wa anthu 21 miliyoni, wakhala tcheru kwambiri chifukwa cha kufalikira kwa COVID-19, monga malo odyera ndi mipiringidzo pivot kuti atenge, masewera olimbitsa thupi amatseka ndipo masukulu amaimitsa makalasi mpaka kalekale, malinga ndi CNBC.

en: People who live in "controlled" areas, neighborhoods where cases have been discovered, have been told to stay in the city, and all residents must test for the virus three times throughout the week, according to ABC.
ny: Anthu omwe amakhala m'madera "olamulidwa", madera omwe milandu yapezeka, auzidwa kuti akhale mumzindawu, ndipo nzika zonse ziyenera kuyesa kachilomboka katatu sabata yonse, malinga ndi ABC.

en: Chinese authorities reported 5,489 cases nationwide on Wednesday, of which 4,982 were in Shanghai, which has been under a draconian lockdown for weeks.
ny: Akuluakulu a ku China adanena za milandu 5,489 mdziko lonse Lachitatu, yomwe 4,982 anali ku Shanghai, yomwe yakhala ikutsekedwa kwambiri kwa milungu ingapo.

en: Beijing reported 46 symptomatic cases and five asymptomatic on Wednesday. The city's total since April 22, what it considers the start of its omicron outbreak, is 544.
ny: Beijing inanena za milandu 46 ya zizindikiro ndi zisanu asymptomatic Lachitatu. Mzinda wonse kuyambira pa April 22, zomwe amaona kuti ndi chiyambi cha mliri wake wa omicron, ndi 544.

en: Mr. Zhang, a Beijing resident, said he had bought extra food and water, even though he doesn't think Beijing will be locked down like Shanghai. He asked that VOA not use his full name because he was afraid of attracting official attention.
ny: Bambo Zhang, omwe amakhala ku Beijing, adati adagula chakudya ndi madzi owonjezera, ngakhale kuti sakuganiza kuti Beijing idzatsekedwa ngati Shanghai. Iye anapempha kuti VOA asagwiritse ntchito dzina lake lonse chifukwa ankaopa kukopa chidwi cha boma.

en: "I have six bags of rice, two bags of noodles, and several boxes of water, instant noodles and (nutritionally dense) biscuits, and I haven't stocked up too much," Zhang told VOA Mandarin in a phone interview last week. He said he bought his groceries online because the supermarket was crowded.
ny: "Ndili ndi matumba asanu ndi limodzi a mpunga, matumba awiri a noodles, ndi mabokosi angapo a madzi, noodles yomweyo ndi (zakudya zambiri) mabisiketi, ndipo sindinasunge zambiri," Zhang adauza VOA Mandarin mu kuyankhulana kwa foni sabata yatha. Iye anati anagula zakudya zake pa intaneti chifukwa supamaketi inali yodzaza.

en: Ms. Yao, who lives in the Chaoyang district, told VOA Mandarin that she had been stocking up on necessities since the beginning of this year, after the Ministry of Commerce recommended that everyone do so. She asked that VOA Mandarin not use her full name because she wanted to avoid official retribution.
ny: Mayi Yao, omwe amakhala m'chigawo cha Chaoyang, adauza VOA Chimandarini kuti akhala akusunga zinthu zofunika kuyambira kumayambiriro kwa chaka chino, pambuyo poti Unduna wa Zamalonda unalimbikitsa kuti aliyense achite zimenezo. Anapempha kuti VOA Mandarin asagwiritse ntchito dzina lake lonse chifukwa akufuna kupewa kubwezera kwa boma.

en: "I have always maintained a good habit of reserving food. So I have a lot of rice, noodles and oil at home," she said, adding that she figured her family would be fine even if Beijing locked down for a month.
ny: "Nthawi zonse ndakhala ndi chizolowezi chabwino chosunga chakudya. Kotero ndili ndi mpunga wambiri, noodles ndi mafuta kunyumba," adatero, ndipo adawonjezera kuti adaganiza kuti banja lake lidzakhala bwino ngakhale Beijing ikatsekedwa kwa mwezi umodzi.

en: And while Beijing has not yet closed the city, citizens' lives have been disrupted.
ny: Ndipo ngakhale kuti Beijing sinatsekebe mzindawo, miyoyo ya nzika yasokonezedwa.

en: On April 28, the Beijing Chaoyang District Maternal and Child Health Care Hospital issued a notice that the outpatient and emergency departments of the hospital would suspend the admission of patients.
ny: Pa April 28, chipatala cha Beijing Chaoyang District Maternal and Child Health Care Hospital chinapereka chidziwitso chakuti madipatimenti odwala kunja ndi othandizira mwadzidzidzi a chipatalachi adzaimitsa kulandira odwala.

en: On the same day, Chaoyang Hospital, one of the largest hospitals in Beijing, announced on its official Weibo account that its emergency department would also suspend the admission of patients. Weibo is China's equivalent of Twitter.
ny: Pa tsiku lomwelo, chipatala cha Chaoyang, chimodzi mwa zipatala zazikulu kwambiri ku Beijing, chinalengeza pa akaunti yake ya Weibo kuti dipatimenti yake yadzidzidzi idzaimitsanso kulandira odwala. Weibo ndi China yofanana ndi Twitter.

en: Angry Chinese netizens left more than 800 messages under the official WeChat account "Beijing Headline."
ny: Okwiya Chinese netizens anasiya mauthenga oposa 800 pansi pa boma WeChat nkhani "Beijing Mutu."

en: "Why do you stop the emergency room as soon as there is a new COVID case, and how many people will be killed due to the secondary disaster caused by the COVID?" a netizen asked in a Weibo post.
ny: "N'chifukwa chiyani mumaimitsa chipinda chamwadzidzidzi mwamsanga pamene pali mlandu watsopano wa COVID, ndipo ndi anthu angati omwe adzaphedwe chifukwa cha tsoka lachiwiri lomwe limayambitsidwa ndi COVID?" a netizen adafunsa mu positi ya Weibo.

en: Some Beijing residents said they were not worried about a Shanghai-like lockdown.
ny: Anthu ena okhala ku Beijing adati sanali kuda nkhawa ndi kutsekedwa kofanana ndi Shanghai.

en: "Basically, I'm not afraid," said Mr. Wang, who asked VOA Mandarin to not use his full name so he could avoid attracting authorities' attention. "The party, government and military are here, and the people are here."
ny: "Kwenikweni, sindikuopa," adatero a Wang, omwe adapempha VOA Chimandarini kuti asagwiritse ntchito dzina lake lonse kuti apewe kukopa chidwi cha akuluakulu. "Chipani, boma ndi asilikali ali pano, ndipo anthu ali pano."

en: However, Wang told VOA Mandarin, in mid-October last year, after one person in his apartment building was diagnosed as positive, about 600 people from more than 200 families were forced into isolation at several hotels in the Changping district for 21 days.
ny: Komabe, Wang adauza VOA Mandarin, pakati pa mwezi wa Okutobala chaka chatha, pambuyo poti munthu mmodzi m'nyumba yake ya nyumba adapezeka kuti ali ndi matenda, anthu pafupifupi 600 ochokera m'mabanja oposa 200 adakakamizidwa kudzipatula pa mahotela angapo m'chigawo cha Changping kwa masiku 21.

en: Wang and his wife were not allowed to share a room at their hotel.
ny: Wang ndi mkazi wake sanaloledwe kukhala m'chipinda chimodzi ku hotelo yawo.

en: What particularly puzzled and annoyed Wang was that on the last day of the mandatory hotel quarantine, in addition to routine nasal and oral swabs during testing, authorities added anal swabs to the regimen.
ny: Chomwe chinadabwitsa kwambiri komanso chokwiyitsa Wang chinali chakuti pa tsiku lomaliza la kukhazikitsidwa kwa hotelo, kuwonjezera pa mphuno zachizolowezi ndi mphuno za pakamwa panthawi yoyesa, akuluakulu a boma anawonjezera ma swabs a anal ku regimen.

en: Kasim Abdurehim contributed to this report.
ny: Kasim Abdurehim anathandizira pa lipotili.

en: At US Urging, Fiji Seizes Russian Oligarch’s Yacht
ny: Pa Kulimbikitsa kwa US, Fiji Imalanda Yacht ya Russian Oligarch

en: Another Russian oligarchs yacht was seized Thursday as part of efforts to punish Russia over its war in Ukraine.
ny: Boti lina la oligarchs la Russia linagwidwa Lachinayi monga gawo la zoyesayesa za kulanga Russia pa nkhondo yake ku Ukraine.

en: At the request of the United States, Fijian officials took a $300 million yacht belonging to Suleiman Kerimov, the Justice Department said. Officials say the yacht is in Lautoka, Fiji.
ny: Pa pempho la United States, akuluakulu a ku Fiji anatenga boti la $ 300 miliyoni la Suleiman Kerimov, Dipatimenti ya Chilungamo idati. Akuluakulu a boma akuti bwatoli lili ku Lautoka, Fiji.

en: Kerimovs yacht, the Cayman Island-flagged Amadea, reportedly has been in Fiji since last month, arriving from Mexico. Defense lawyers claimed the vessel belonged to another oligarch.
ny: Kerimovs yatchi, Cayman Island-flagged Amadea, akuti wakhala ku Fiji kuyambira mwezi watha, akufika kuchokera ku Mexico. Maloya oteteza ananena kuti chombocho chinali cha oligarch wina.

en: Kerimov had already been sanctioned by the U.S. in 2014 and 2018 for Russias activities in Syria and Ukraine. The European Union also sanctioned him.
ny: Kerimov anali atavomerezedwa kale ndi US mu 2014 ndi 2018 pa ntchito za Russia ku Syria ndi Ukraine. Bungwe la European Union linam'patsanso chilango.

en: In March, the U.S. government announced a comprehensive effort to identify and seize the assets of wealthy Russians who have supported the government of Russian President Vladmir Putin, as part of the response to Moscows February 24 invasion of Ukraine.
ny: Mu Marichi, boma la United States linalengeza zoyesayesa zambiri kuti lidziwe ndi kulanda katundu wa anthu olemera a ku Russia omwe athandizira boma la Purezidenti wa Russia Vladmir Putin, monga gawo la kuyankha kwa Moscows February 24 kuwukira Ukraine.

en: The initiative, led by the Justice Department, is called Task Force KleptoCapture.
ny: Ntchitoyi, yotsogoleredwa ndi Dipatimenti ya Chilungamo, imatchedwa Task Force KleptoCapture.

en: U.S. Attorney General Merrick Garland said Thursday in a statement there is "no hiding place for the assets of criminals who enable the Russian regime." He also said, "The Justice Department will be relentless in our efforts to hold accountable those who facilitate the death and destruction we are witnessing in Ukraine."
ny: Loya wamkulu wa dziko la United States Merrick Garland anati Lachinayi m'mawu ake palibe "malo obisika a chuma cha zigawenga zomwe zimathandiza boma la Russia." Iye ananenanso kuti, "Dipatimenti ya Zachilungamo idzakhala yosasunthika poyesetsa kuimba mlandu anthu amene amathandiza imfa ndi chiwonongeko chimene tikuchitira umboni ku Ukraine."

en: In April, at the urging of the U.S., Spanish authorities seized a yacht belonging to Russian oligarch Viktor Vekselberg, the owner of the Russian conglomerate Renova Group.
ny: Mu Epulo, atalimbikitsidwa ndi dziko la United States, akuluakulu a boma la Spain anagwira boti la oligarch wa ku Russia Viktor Vekselberg, mwiniwake wa Russian conglomerate Renova Group.

en: Last week, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a measure that would allow the U.S. government to sell forfeited Russian properties worth more than $2 million for the benefit of Ukraine. The measures next step is the Senate.
ny: Sabata yatha, Nyumba ya Malamulo ya United States idapereka njira yomwe idzalola boma la United States kugulitsa katundu wotayidwa wa Russia woposa $ 2 miliyoni kuti apindule ndi Ukraine. Miyeso yotsatira ndi Senate.

en: (Some information in this report comes from Reuters.)
ny: (Chidziwitso china mu lipoti ili chimachokera ku Reuters.)

en: WHO Report Says COVID Cases Decline, Except in Americas, Africa
ny: Lipoti la WHO Likuti Milandu ya COVID Ikuchepa, Kupatula ku America, Africa

en: The World Health Organization said Wednesday that the number of newly reported coronavirus cases and deaths globally continued to fall in the last week, continuing a decline that began in March.
ny: Bungwe Loona za Umoyo Padziko Lonse linanena Lachitatu kuti chiwerengero cha anthu atsopano omwe ali ndi matenda a coronavirus komanso imfa padziko lonse lapansi chinapitiriza kutsika sabata yatha, kupitiliza kuchepa komwe kunayamba mu Marichi.

en: In its weekly report on the pandemic, the U.N. health agency said there were about 3.8 million new infections and more than 15,000 deaths last week, a 17% and 3% drop on the week respectively. But those figures are believed to be a significant underestimate of COVID-19's true toll as increasing numbers of countries abandon widespread testing and surveillance.
ny: Mu lipoti lake la mlungu uliwonse la mliriwu, bungwe la zaumoyo la UN linanena kuti panali pafupifupi 3.8 miliyoni matenda atsopano ndi imfa zoposa 15,000 sabata yatha, kutsika kwa 17% ndi 3% pa sabata. Koma ziwerengero zimenezo zimakhulupirira kuti ndizochepa kwambiri za chiwerengero chenicheni cha COVID-19 pamene chiwerengero chowonjezereka cha mayiko chikusiya kuyezetsa ndi kuwunika kofala.

en: Still, WHO noted that cases rose by about a third in Africa and 13% in the Americas. There was also a nearly 70% jump in deaths reported in India, although that was attributed to delayed reporting rather than a recent surge of disease.
ny: Komabe, bungwe la WHO linanena kuti milandu inakwera ndi pafupifupi gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu ku Africa ndi 13% ku America. Panalinso pafupifupi 70% kudumpha kwa imfa zomwe zinanenedwa ku India, ngakhale kuti zimenezo zinachitika chifukwa cha kuchedwa kwa malipoti osati kuwonjezeka kwaposachedwa kwa matenda.

en: Last week, authorities in South Africa said they had noted an uptick in COVID-19 cases attributable to the BA.4 mutant of omicron, although they said it was too early to tell if that would result in a significant new wave of disease. Although the BA.4 version of COVID-19's omicron variant appears more infectious than omicron, WHO said there was no evidence yet that it was leading to substantially higher rates of hospitalization or death.
ny: Sabata yatha, akuluakulu ku South Africa adanena kuti adawona kukwera kwa milandu ya COVID-19 yomwe imagwiritsidwa ntchito ndi BA.4 mutant ya omicron, ngakhale kuti adanena kuti ndi nthawi yoyambirira kudziwa ngati zomwe zingayambitse mafunde atsopano a matenda. Ngakhale kuti mtundu wa BA.4 wa mtundu wa omicron wa COVID-19 umawoneka wopatsirana kwambiri kuposa omicron, WHO inanena kuti panalibe umboni komabe kuti ukutsogolera kuchuluka kwakukulu kwa kuchipatala kapena imfa.

en: Salim Abdool Karim, a public health expert at the University of KwaZulu-Natal, said that while only a "modest" rise in cases had been noted, South Africa was also in the middle of a holiday period and testing had dropped significantly. He said the cases were slowing and were "not following a rocket-like upward trajectory we would expect" in another spike of disease.
ny: Salim Abdool Karim, katswiri wa zaumoyo wa anthu pa yunivesite ya KwaZulu-Natal, adati ngakhale kuti kukwera "kochepa" kokha kwa odwala kunadziwika, South Africa inalinso pakati pa nthawi ya tchuthi ndipo kuyezetsa kunatsika kwambiri. Iye anati milandu anali kuchepa ndipo anali "osati kutsatira roketi ngati m'mwamba trajectory tingayembekezere" mu misomali ina ya matenda.

en: At a press briefing on Wednesday, WHO emergencies chief Dr. Michael Ryan said it was too soon to tell if COVID-19 was entering a seasonal pattern and warned against countries dropping all of their restrictions too quickly — as many in the West have done.
ny: Pamsonkhano wa atolankhani Lachitatu, mkulu wa WHO mwadzidzidzi Dr. Michael Ryan adati zinali zofulumira kwambiri kudziwa ngati COVID-19 ikulowa mu ndondomeko ya nyengo ndipo adachenjeza kuti mayiko asiye zoletsa zawo zonse mofulumira kwambiri - monga momwe ambiri Kumadzulo achitira.

en: "The jury is still out as to how seasonal this virus will become," he said, explaining that it wasn't proven yet that COVID-19 would naturally drop off in the summer and that the world could yet face more unsettling variants. "If people are crowded together in conditions where a new variant is spreading, you will see high levels of transmission," he said.
ny: "Oweruza adakali kunja momwe nyengo ya kachilombo kameneka ikhalira," adatero, akufotokoza kuti sizinatsimikizidwe komabe kuti COVID-19 idzatsika mwachibadwa m'chilimwe ndikuti dziko lapansi likhoza kuyang'anizanabe ndi mitundu yosasangalatsa kwambiri. "Ngati anthu akukhamukira pamodzi m'mikhalidwe yomwe mtundu watsopano ukufalikira, mudzawona kuchuluka kwa kufala," adatero.

en: Meanwhile in China, authorities continued to crack down on cities, including Beijing, where more than 10% of the subway system was shut down in an effort to curb the virus' spread, after authorities in the capital already closed down indoor dining, gyms and school classes.
ny: Pakadali pano ku China, akuluakulu a boma adapitilizabe kuphwanya mizinda, kuphatikizapo Beijing, komwe oposa 10% ya dongosolo la sitima yapansi panthaka adatsekedwa poyesetsa kuthetsa kufalikira kwa kachilomboka, pambuyo poti akuluakulu a likulu adatseka kale malo odyera m'nyumba, masewera olimbitsa thupi ndi makalasi a sukulu.

en: In Shanghai, rigid and widely derided restrictions have led to shortages of food and medical aid along with a wider — though likely temporary — impact on the national economy. Desperate, outraged citizens have confronted authorities at barricades and online, screamed out of their windows and banged pots and pans in a sign of frustration and anger.
ny: Ku Shanghai, ziletso zolimba ndi zonyozedwa kwambiri zachititsa kusoŵa kwa chakudya ndi chithandizo cha mankhwala limodzi ndi chiyambukiro chachikulu — ngakhale kuti mwachiwonekere chosakhalitsa — pa chuma cha dzikolo. Nzika zothedwa nzeru, zokwiya zayang'anizana ndi akuluakulu a boma pamalo otchinga ndipo pa intaneti, zafuula m'mawindo awo ndi kugunda miphika ndi miphika posonyeza kukhumudwa ndi mkwiyo.

en: Myanmar Supreme Court Rejects Aung San Suu Kyi Appeal on Corruption Charges
ny: Khoti Lalikulu Kwambiri ku Myanmar Lakana Apilo ya Aung San Suu Kyi pa Milandu ya Ziphuphu

en: An appeal of a five-year jail sentence against ousted Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi was rejected Wednesday by the country's supreme court.
ny: Apilo ya chilango cha zaka zisanu m'ndende motsutsana ndi mtsogoleri wochotsedwa wa Myanmar Aung San Suu Kyi idakanidwa Lachitatu ndi khoti lalikulu kwambiri mdziko muno.

en: The decision reportedly came as soon as the claim for an appeal was lodged, and the court didn't entertain arguments from either side in the case.
ny: Chigamulochi akuti chinabwera mwamsanga pamene mlandu wa apilo unaperekedwa, ndipo khoti silinapereke mikangano kuchokera kumbali zonse ziwiri pa mlanduwu.

en: Suu Kyi, 76, was sentenced last week after being found guilty of 11 counts of corruption, including taking a bribe of cash and gold bars worth $600,000.
ny: Suu Kyi, yemwe ali ndi zaka 76, adaweruzidwa sabata yatha atapezeka ndi mlandu wa ziphuphu 11, kuphatikizapo kutenga chiphuphu cha ndalama ndi golide zokwana madola 600,000.

en: Her lawyer called the charge absurd.
ny: Loya wake ananena kuti mlanduwo ndi wopanda pake.

en: Suu Kyi had already been sentenced to six years for actions against the military, breaking COVID-19 rules and breaking a telecommunications law.
ny: Suu Kyi adaweruzidwa kale zaka zisanu ndi chimodzi chifukwa cha zochita zotsutsana ndi asilikali, kuphwanya malamulo a COVID-19 komanso kuphwanya lamulo la telefoni.

en: She faces many more charges, and if found guilty could be sentenced to more than 150 years in jail.
ny: Iye akuyang'anizana ndi milandu ina yambiri, ndipo ngati apezedwa wolakwa angaweruzidwe kukhala m'ndende zaka zoposa 150.

en: Suu Kyi has been under house arrest since a military coup took over the country last year.
ny: Suu Kyi wakhala ali m'ndende kuyambira pamene asilikali analanda dziko lonse chaka chatha.

en: Since the coup, on Feb. 1, 2021, there have been widespread protests against the military regime. The regime cracked down violently in many cases, leaving more than 1,800 civilians dead and more than 10,000 arrested, charged or sentenced, according to the Assistance Association for Political Prisoners (Burma).
ny: Kuchokera pa kulanda boma, pa Feb. 1, 2021, pakhala pali zionetsero zambiri zotsutsana ndi boma lankhondo. Boma linaphwanya mwachiwawa m'zochitika zambiri, kusiya anthu wamba oposa 1,800 akufa ndipo oposa 10,000 amangidwa, kuimbidwa mlandu kapena kuweruzidwa, malinga ndi bungwe la Assistance Association for Political Prisoners (Burma).

en: Some information in this report comes from Reuters and Agence France-Presse.
ny: Zina zomwe zili mu lipotili zimachokera ku Reuters ndi Agence France-Presse.

en: Foreign Tourists Begin Arriving in New Zealand After COVID Restrictions Lifted.
ny: Alendo Akunja Ayamba Kufika ku New Zealand Pambuyo Poti Ziletso za COVID Zachotsedwa.

en: For the first time in over two years, overseas tourists have been allowed to enter New Zealand starting Monday.
ny: Kwa nthawi yoyamba m'zaka zoposa ziwiri, alendo akunja aloledwa kulowa ku New Zealand kuyambira Lolemba.

en: The island nation known for its natural beauty enacted some of the strictest lockdown measures during the COVID-19 pandemic, including very restrictive travel limitations.
ny: Mtundu wa chilumbachi wodziwika chifukwa cha kukongola kwake kwachilengedwe unakhazikitsa njira zina zokhwima kwambiri zotsekera panthawi ya mliri wa COVID-19, kuphatikizapo zoletsa kwambiri kuyenda.

en: The country had reopened for tourists from Australia weeks ago, but the new relaxation of restrictions now allows tourists from over 60 countries to visit, including most European countries and the U.S.
ny: Dzikoli linali litatsegulidwanso kwa alendo ochokera ku Australia masabata apitawo, koma kupumula kwatsopano kwa ziletso tsopano kumalola alendo ochokera m'mayiko oposa 60 kuyendera, kuphatikizapo mayiko ambiri a ku Ulaya ndi US.

en: "Today is a day to celebrate and is a big moment in our reconnection with the world," said Tourism Minister Stuart Nash.
ny: "Lero ndi tsiku lokondwerera ndipo ndi nthawi yayikulu pakugwirizananso kwathu ndi dziko," adatero Minister of Tourism Stuart Nash.

en: Tourists must show they are fully vaccinated and test negative for the virus.
ny: Alendo odzaona malo ayenera kusonyeza kuti ali ndi katemera wokwanira ndipo amayesedwa kuti alibe kachilomboka.

en: Citizens of China, India and other countries not given a waiver Monday are still not allowed to visit.
ny: Nzika za China, India ndi mayiko ena osapatsidwa waiver Lolemba saloledwabe kuyendera.

en: Before the pandemic, tourism accounted for 5% of the countrys economic activity and 20% of its foreign income.
ny: Mliriwu usanachitike, zokopa alendo zinali 5% ya ntchito zachuma za dziko ndi 20% ya ndalama zake zakunja.

en: On Monday, 43 international flights carrying around 9,000 passengers were scheduled to leave or arrive at Auckland International Airport, Reuters reported.
ny: Lolemba, ndege za mayiko 43 zonyamula anthu ozungulira 9,000 zinakonzedwa kuchoka kapena kufika ku Auckland International Airport, a Reuters adanena.

en: Some information in this report comes from The Associated Press and Reuters.
ny: Zina zomwe zili mu lipotili zimachokera ku The Associated Press ndi Reuters.

en: Report: Iran to Execute Swedish-Iranian National by May 21.
ny: Lipoti: Iran Kupha Swedish-Iranian National ndi Meyi 21.

en: Iran will later this month execute a Swedish-Iranian national whom it has imprisoned since 2016 and convicted of spying for Israel, media reported.
ny: Iran idzapha kumapeto kwa mwezi uno kupha dziko la Sweden-Iran lomwe lamutsekera m'ndende kuyambira 2016 ndikuweruzidwa kuti akuzonda Israel, atolankhani adanena.

en: Irans semiofficial ISNA news agency on Wednesday released a report in which Iranian officials stated that Tehran will implement the death penalty against Ahmad Reza Jalali by May 21.
ny: Irans semiofficial ISNA news agency Lachitatu inatulutsa lipoti lomwe akuluakulu a Iran adanena kuti Tehran idzagwiritsa ntchito chilango cha imfa kwa Ahmad Reza Jalali pofika Meyi 21.

en: Jalali, a researcher and physician who specializes in disaster relief, was arrested during a visit to Iran in April 2016. In 2017, Jalali was sentenced to death in Iran after he had been found guilty of passing information about two Iranian nuclear scientists to Israel to help it assassinate several nuclear scientists.
ny: Jalali, wofufuza komanso dokotala yemwe ndi katswiri wothandizira masoka, anamangidwa paulendo wopita ku Iran mu Epulo 2016. Mu 2017, Jalali adaweruzidwa kuti aphedwe ku Iran atapezeka ndi mlandu wopereka chidziwitso chokhudza asayansi awiri a nyukiliya a Iran ku Israel kuti awathandize kupha asayansi angapo a nyukiliya.

en: Rights groups have condemned Jalalis detention, citing Irans pattern of detaining dual nationals and expatriates without due process.
ny: Magulu omenyera ufulu atsutsa kusungidwa kwa Jalalis, akumatchula Irans chitsanzo cha kusunga nzika ziwiri ndi anthu ochokera kunja popanda ndondomeko yoyenera.

en: Iran does not recognize dual nationals.
ny: Iran samazindikira mayiko awiri.

en: The announcement came as authorities in Stockholm wrapped up the trial of Hamid Nouri, a former Iranian prosecution official whom Swedish officials arrested in November 2019.
ny: Chilengezochi chinabwera pamene akuluakulu a boma ku Stockholm adakulunga mlandu wa Hamid Nouri, yemwe kale anali mkulu wozenga milandu ku Iran yemwe akuluakulu a Sweden adamugwira mu November 2019.

en: Authorities say Nouri played a role in the deaths of political prisoners executed on Iranian government orders at Irans Gohardasht prison during the final phase of the Iran-Iraq war in 1988. Nouri has been held in custody in Sweden since his arrest.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma akuti Nouri adachitapo kanthu pa imfa za akaidi andale omwe anaphedwa pa malamulo a boma la Iran ku ndende ya Irans Gohardasht panthawi yomaliza ya nkhondo ya Iran-Iraq mu 1988. Nouri wakhala akusungidwa m'ndende ku Sweden kuyambira pamene anamangidwa.

en: On Wednesday, the final day of Nouri's trial, a Stockholm district court judge set the date of the verdict for July 14.
ny: Lachitatu, tsiku lomaliza la mlandu wa Nouri, woweruza wa khoti lachigawo la Stockholm adakhazikitsa tsiku la chigamulo cha July 14.

en: Amnesty International put the number of those executed at the prison at 5,000 but said in a 2018 report that the number could be higher.
ny: Bungwe la Amnesty International linayika chiwerengero cha anthu omwe aphedwa pa ndendeyi pa 5,000 koma linanena mu lipoti la 2018 kuti chiwerengerochi chikhoza kukhala chokwera.

en: Human Rights Watch, in a recent report, said, "Iran continues to be one of the worlds leading implementers of the death penalty."
ny: Bungwe loona za ufulu wa anthu, m'lipoti laposachedwapa, linati, "Iran ikupitirizabe kukhala imodzi mwa anthu amene akutsogolera padziko lonse amene akugwiritsa ntchito chilango cha imfa."

en: If Nouri is convicted, he will face a maximum life sentence on charges of international war crimes and human rights abuses. Iran recently summoned the Swedish envoy in protest over Nouris case.
ny: Ngati Nouri apezedwa ndi mlandu, adzayang'anizana ndi chilango chachikulu cha moyo wake wonse pa milandu ya nkhondo yapadziko lonse komanso kuphwanya ufulu wa anthu. Iran posachedwapa idayitanitsa nthumwi ya Sweden potsutsa nkhani ya Nouris.

en: Maja Aberg, senior policy adviser with Amnesty International Sweden, says it is no coincidence that Iran announced Jalalis pending execution just after Swedish prosecutors moved on Nouris trial.
ny: Maja Aberg, mlangizi wamkulu wa ndondomeko ndi Amnesty International Sweden, akuti sizodabwitsa kuti Iran inalengeza Jalalis kuyembekezera kuphedwa pambuyo poti akuluakulu a boma ku Sweden apita ku mlandu wa Nouris.

en: "It indicates that (Iran) sees him as a kind of piece in the jigsaw puzzle, which is very worrying," Aberg told Sweden's TT news agency.
ny: "Zikuwonetsa kuti (Iran) amamuwona ngati mtundu wa chidutswa mu jigsaw puzzle, zomwe zimadetsa nkhawa kwambiri," Aberg adauza bungwe la Sweden la TT.

en: Swedish law allows for the prosecution of Swedish citizens and other nationals for crimes against international law committed abroad.
ny: Lamulo la Sweden limalola kuzengedwa mlandu kwa nzika za Sweden ndi nzika zina chifukwa cha milandu yotsutsana ndi malamulo apadziko lonse omwe amachitidwa kunja.

en: Some information for this report came from The Associated Press, Reuters and Agence France-Presse.
ny: Chidziwitso china cha lipotili chinachokera ku The Associated Press, Reuters ndi Agence France-Presse.

en: Erdogan Goes to Riyadh to Seal Rapprochement
ny: Erdogan Amapita ku Riyadh Kuti Asindikize Kuyandikira

en: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan heads to Saudi Arabia Thursday for a two-day visit aimed at easing old tensions between Ankara and Riyadh.
ny: Purezidenti wa Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan akupita ku Saudi Arabia Lachinayi ulendo wa masiku awiri womwe cholinga chake ndi kuchepetsa mikangano yakale pakati pa Ankara ndi Riyadh.

en: The Turkish leaders visit with the Saudi king comes after years of rivalry between their once-close countries.
ny: Atsogoleri a ku Turkey amayendera ndi mfumu ya Saudi akubwera pambuyo pa zaka zambiri zotsutsana pakati pa mayiko awo omwe kale anali pafupi.

en: Mehmet Ogutcu is the head of the London Energy Club, a grouping of government and energy sector leaders. Ogutcu says the visit is the culmination of intense international diplomacy.
ny: Mehmet Ogutcu ndi mkulu wa London Energy Club, gulu la atsogoleri a boma ndi gawo la mphamvu. Ogutcu akuti ulendowu ndiwo chimake cha ulaliki waukulu wapadziko lonse.

en: "President Erdogan has good relations with the king; with the crown prince Muhammad Bin Salman, we had serious difficulties," said Ogutcu. "Now it looks that I believe the*(Britons), and Americans, and the Qataris of course played some role, even the Azeris might have done this. And things are changing and relaxing a bit more, and now at the presidential level, it's going to be sealed."
ny: "Pulezidenti Erdogan ali ndi ubale wabwino ndi mfumu; ndi kalonga wachifumu Muhammad Bin Salman, tinali ndi zovuta zazikulu," adatero Ogutcu. "Tsopano zikuwoneka kuti ndikukhulupirira *(Britons), ndi America, ndipo Qataris ndithudi adachita mbali ina, ngakhale Azeris mwina adachita izi. Ndipo zinthu zikusintha ndipo zikupuma pang'ono, ndipo tsopano pamlingo wa pulezidenti, zidzasindikizidwa."

en: Erdogan and the crown prince have been bitter rivals. The Turkish president led international condemnation over the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, who was killed inside Saudi Arabias consulate in Istanbul.
ny: Erdogan ndi kalonga wachifumu akhala akulimbana kwambiri. Purezidenti wa dziko la Turkey adatsogolera kutsutsidwa kwapadziko lonse chifukwa cha kuphedwa kwa mtolankhani wa Saudi Jamal Khashoggi, yemwe anaphedwa mkati mwa kazembe wa Saudi Arabia ku Istanbul.

en: The killing was linked to the crown prince, a charge he denied. But the decision earlier this month to move the Khashoggi murder trial from Istanbul to Riyadh is seen as a gesture by Ankara, opening the way for Erdogan's visit.
ny: Kuphako kunagwirizanitsidwa ndi kalonga wachifumu, mlandu umene iye anakana. Koma chisankho kumayambiriro kwa mwezi uno chosamutsira mlandu wakupha Khashoggi kuchokera ku Istanbul kupita ku Riyadh chikuwoneka ngati chizindikiro cha Ankara, kutsegula njira ya ulendo wa Erdogan.

en: Ogutcu says with presidential elections due next year, Erdogan is looking for Saudi help to bail out the ailing Turkish economy.
ny: Ogutcu akuti ndi chisankho cha pulezidenti chomwe chikuyenera chaka chamawa, Erdogan akuyang'ana thandizo la Saudi kuti atulutse chuma cha Turkey chomwe chikudwala.

en: "Turkey has an interest in reviving relations with Riyadh because Turkey needs financial support," said Ogutcu. "The Turkish economy is not attracting any significant portfolio investments nor sovereign wealth funds coming to invest Turkey. But this will be a give-and-take package deal involving these countries. So, there are real economic and political security interests involved."
ny: "Turkey ili ndi chidwi choyambitsanso ubale ndi Riyadh chifukwa Turkey ikufuna thandizo la ndalama," adatero Ogutcu. "Chuma cha Turkey sichikukopa ndalama zilizonse zazikulu za portfolio kapena ndalama zachuma zaufumu zomwe zikubwera kudzaika Turkey. Koma izi zidzakhala mgwirizano wa phukusi lopereka ndi kutenga wokhudzana ndi mayiko awa. Choncho, pali zofuna zenizeni za chitetezo cha zachuma ndi ndale zomwe zimaphatikizidwa."

en: Shared concerns over Iran's growing influence in the region -- along with its nuclear energy program -- provide important common ground between Riyadh and Ankara, says international relations professor Soli Ozel of Istanbul's Kadir Has University, especially as American attention is expected to pivot away from the Middle East and toward China.
ny: Nkhawa zogwirizana ndi chisonkhezero cha Iran chomwe chikukula m'derali - pamodzi ndi pulogalamu yake ya mphamvu ya nyukiliya - zimapereka malo ofunika kwambiri pakati pa Riyadh ndi Ankara, akutero pulofesa wa maubwenzi apadziko lonse Soli Ozel wa Istanbul's Kadir Has University, makamaka pamene chidwi cha America chikuyembekezeka kuchoka ku Middle East ndikupita ku China.

en: "Turkey does propose itself as a counterweight to Iran. Both countries have an interest along with all the western countries for Iran not to be as influential throughout the region as it is today," said Ozel. "And the Iranians are also constantly sending signals that they are not going to let others draw them away from those countries - Iraq, Lebanon and Syria - where they have quite a lot of influence."
ny: "Turkey amachita akufuna yekha monga counterweight kwa Iran. Maiko onsewa ali ndi chidwi pamodzi ndi mayiko onse akumadzulo kuti Iran isayenera kukhala ndi mphamvu m'chigawo chonsecho monga momwe zilili lero," adatero Ozel. "Ndipo anthu a ku Iran nawonso nthawi zonse amatumiza zizindikiro kuti sadzalola ena kuwakokera kutali ndi mayiko amenewo - Iraq, Lebanon ndi Syria - kumene ali ndi mphamvu zambiri ndithu."

en: Erdogan's Saudi visit is part of a wider policy of seeking to repair relations across the region in a bid to end its isolation. The Turkish president has recently visited the United Arab Emirates and earlier this month hosted the Israeli president, Isaac Herzog.
ny: Ulendo wa Erdogan wa Saudi ndi gawo la ndondomeko yowonjezereka yofuna kukonza ubale kudutsa dera pofuna kuthetsa kudzipatula kwake. Purezidenti wa dziko la Turkey posachedwapa wapita ku United Arab Emirates ndipo kumayambiriro kwa mwezi uno adalandira pulezidenti wa Israel, Isaac Herzog.

en: But analyst Ozel warns Ankara is in a vulnerable position.
ny: Koma katswiri Ozel akuchenjeza Ankara kuti ali pamalo osatetezeka.

en: "Turkey alienated, insulted, offended a lot of countries with which it had at least decent relations. And they all recognize that this burst of diplomacy is coming out of weakness rather than strength," said Ozel.
ny: "Turkey inapatutsa, kunyoza, kukhumudwitsa mayiko ambiri omwe anali nawo osachepera ubale wabwino. Ndipo onse amazindikira kuti kuphulika kwa diplomacy kumeneku kukutuluka mu kufooka osati mphamvu," adatero Ozel.

en: But analysts say Ankara is banking on its importance as a potential bulwark to Iranian ambitions, a factor that may help overcome any remaining hostility among the neighbors it is trying to win back.
ny: Koma akatswiri akuti Ankara ndi banki pa kufunika kwake monga kuthekera linga kwa zolinga Iran, chinthu chimene chingathandize kugonjetsa udani uliwonse otsala pakati pa oyandikana nawo akuyesera kupambana kumbuyo.

en: Executions, Detentions Hang Over Saudi Legal Reforms
ny: Kuphedwa, Kusungidwa Kumapachikidwa Pa Kusintha Kwalamulo kwa Saudi

en: Saudi Arabia is pushing to revamp its harsh justice system but reforms are overshadowed by executions and tough treatment of dissidents, raising questions about how much will change.
ny: Saudi Arabia ikukankhira kukonzanso chilungamo chake chokhwima koma kusintha kumaphimbidwa ndi kuphedwa ndi kuchitiridwa molimba kwa otsutsa, kudzutsa mafunso okhudza kuchuluka kwa zomwe zidzasintha.

en: The kingdom is known for its strict interpretation of Islamic sharia law, which forms the basis of its judicial system.
ny: Ufumuwu umadziwika chifukwa cha kutanthauzira kwake kokhwima kwa malamulo a Islamic sharia, omwe amapanga maziko a dongosolo lake lachiweruzo.

en: But in recent months it has moved ahead with reforms that analysts say could make its courts function more like others in the Middle East.
ny: Koma m'miyezi yaposachedwapa yapita patsogolo ndi kusintha kumene akatswiri akuti kungapangitse makhoti ake kugwira ntchito mofanana ndi ena ku Middle East.

en: That effort hinges on a series of new laws for sensitive issues like women's divorce rights and judges' power to determine criminal sentences.
ny: Kuyesayesa kumeneko kumadalira pa mndandanda wa malamulo atsopano a nkhani zovuta monga ufulu wa chisudzulo cha akazi ndi mphamvu ya oweruza kuti adziwe zilango za milandu.

en: Announced last year by de facto ruler Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the measures, including the first written penal code, appear to align with Saudi Arabia's goal of opening up to the world and softening its extremist image.
ny: Yolengezedwa chaka chatha ndi de facto wolamulira Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, miyeso, kuphatikizapo malamulo oyamba olembedwa a chilango, akuwoneka kuti akugwirizana ndi cholinga cha Saudi Arabia chotsegulira dziko lapansi ndikufewetsa chithunzi chake chonyanyira.

en: Even critics concede the changes could make Saudi courts more predictable, in some cases.
ny: Ngakhale otsutsa amavomereza kuti kusintha kungapangitse makhoti a Saudi kukhala odziwika bwino, nthawi zina.

en: But there is no expectation that restrictions on free speech will ease, or that the legal system will treat more favorably perceived opponents of the government.
ny: Koma palibe chiyembekezo chakuti ziletso pa ufulu wa kulankhula zidzachepa, kapena kuti dongosolo la zamalamulo lidzachitira anthu otsutsa boma mokomera.

en: And despite the reforms, authorities have simultaneously provided reminders of what gave Saudi Arabia its ruthless reputation in the first place, notably the mass execution of 81 men in a single day in March for offenses related to "terrorism."
ny: Ndipo ngakhale kusintha, akuluakulu a boma panthawi imodzimodziyo apereka zikumbutso za zomwe zinapatsa Saudi Arabia mbiri yake yopanda chifundo poyamba, makamaka kuphedwa kwa amuna 81 tsiku limodzi mu Marichi chifukwa cha milandu yokhudzana ndi "uchigawenga."

en: 'Notorious' system
ny: Dongosolo 'lodziwika bwino'

en: Two new laws have already been approved by the Saudi Cabinet. One governs the admissibility of evidence, previously at the judges' discretion.
ny: Malamulo awiri atsopano avomerezedwa kale ndi Saudi Cabinet. Wina akulamulira kuvomerezedwa kwa umboni, kale pa nzeru za oweruza.

en: The second, a family law, is to take effect in June. In a traditionally male-dominated system, it expands the rights of divorced women to alimony and custody of their children.
ny: Lachiwiri, lamulo la banja, ndilo kuyamba kugwira ntchito mu June. Mu dongosolo lachikhalidwe la amuna, limakulitsa ufulu wa akazi osudzulidwa kukhala alimony ndi kusunga ana awo.

en: Announcing the new law in March, Prince Mohammed said it represented "a major qualitative leap" for women's rights and "family stability."
ny: Kulengeza lamulo latsopanoli mu Marichi, Prince Mohammed adati likuimira "kulumphira kwakukulu kwa khalidwe" kwa ufulu wa akazi ndi "kukhazikika kwa banja."

en: The reforms seem partly to cater to foreign firms whose investment the kingdom is courting, said Adel al-Saeed, vice president of the European Saudi Organization for Human Rights.
ny: Zosinthazo zikuwoneka kuti mwapang'ono zikusamalira makampani akunja omwe ndalama zawo ufumuwo ukuchitira chibwenzi, adatero Adel al-Saeed, wachiwiri kwa pulezidenti wa European Saudi Organization for Human Rights.

en: "The owners of capital are afraid of investing in this country, which is notorious in the legal aspect, so these laws are intended to change the image," he said.
ny: "Eni ake a likulu akuopa kuika ndalama m'dziko lino, lomwe ndi lodziwika bwino pa mbali ya malamulo, choncho malamulowa cholinga chake ndi kusintha chithunzichi," adatero.

en: The new penal code, yet to be unveiled, could bring further dramatic changes.
ny: Lamulo latsopano la chilango, limene silinavumbulidwe, lingabweretse kusintha kwina kwakukulu.

en: Under sharia, only apostasy, theft, revolt, armed robbery, adultery, drinking alcohol and slander carry prescribed sentences. Judges are left to determine punishment in other cases.
ny: Pansi pa sharia, mpatuko wokha, kuba, kuwukira, kuba ndi mfuti, chigololo, kumwa mowa ndi kusinjirira kumanyamula zilango zolembedwa. Oweruza amasiyidwa kuti adziwe chilango pa milandu ina.

en: With a penal code in place, "the state will expect judges to rely not on their own training in sharia but instead on the legal rules (based on sharia) approved by the state," said Nathan Brown, an academic at George Washington University.
ny: Pokhala ndi malamulo a chilango, "boma lidzayembekezera oweruza kudalira osati maphunziro awo ku sharia koma m'malo mwake pa malamulo alamulo (ozikidwa pa sharia) ovomerezeka ndi boma," adatero Nathan Brown, wophunzira ku yunivesite ya George Washington.

en: "As a result, Saudi Arabia will look much more like a civil law system, much like most states in the region," said Brown, who has studied the Saudi reforms.
ny: "Chotsatira chake, Saudi Arabia idzawoneka kwambiri ngati dongosolo la malamulo a boma, mofanana ndi mayiko ambiri m'derali," adatero Brown, yemwe waphunzira za kusintha kwa Saudi.

en: The result should be more "predictability," said Abdullah Alaoudh, a U.S.-based legal expert and government critic, as new rules "take away from the leeway ... that the judges used to have."
ny: Zotsatira zake ziyenera kukhala "zolosera" zambiri, anatero Abdullah Alaoudh, katswiri wa zamalamulo wa ku United States komanso wotsutsa boma, pamene malamulo atsopano "amachotsa ku leeway ... zimene oweruza anali nazo kale."

en: But tighter regulation by the monarchy also "creates a larger problem: lack of independence," he added.
ny: Koma malamulo okhwima a ufumu wa monarchy nawonso "amapanga vuto lalikulu: kusowa ufulu," anawonjezera motero.

en: The king is the head of the Saudi judiciary and acts as the final court of appeal.
ny: Mfumuyi ndi mtsogoleri wa bungwe la milandu la Saudi ndipo imakhala ngati khoti lomaliza la apilo.

en: Alaoudh's own father, prominent cleric Salman al-Awdah, has been held since 2017, seemingly in retaliation for a Twitter post that clashed with Saudi Arabia's policy at the time of isolating Qatar.
ny: Bambo a Alaoudh mwiniwake, mtsogoleri wotchuka Salman al-Awdah, wakhala akuchitika kuyambira 2017, akuwoneka kuti akubwezera positi ya Twitter yomwe idakangana ndi ndondomeko ya Saudi Arabia panthawi yodzipatula Qatar.

en: He is one of many detained in an apparent crackdown on dissent and those who could challenge Prince Mohammed's power.
ny: Iye ndi mmodzi mwa anthu ambiri omwe asungidwa mu chiwonetsero chowonekera chotsutsana ndi omwe angatsutse mphamvu za Prince Mohammed.

en: One of the most prominent examples is former crown prince Mohammed bin Nayef, the CIA ally respected in the West for his efforts to counter violent extremism, but who King Salman ousted from the line of succession.
ny: Chimodzi mwa zitsanzo zotchuka kwambiri ndi kalonga wachifumu wakale Mohammed bin Nayef, mnzake wa CIA yemwe amalemekezedwa ku West chifukwa choyesetsa kulimbana ndi chiwawa, koma yemwe Mfumu Salman adachotsa pa mzere wotsatira.

en: Prince Nayef has not been seen in public since reports of his arrest in March 2020. His detention was never officially confirmed.
ny: Prince Nayef sanawonedwe pagulu kuyambira malipoti a kumangidwa kwake mu March 2020. Kusungidwa kwake sikunatsimikiziridwe mwalamulo.

en: Shadow of Khashoggi
ny: Mthunzi wa Khashoggi

en: For government opponents, such cases reinforce questions about what difference the ongoing justice reforms will make.
ny: Kwa otsutsa boma, milandu yoteroyo imalimbikitsa mafunso ponena za kusiyana kumene kusintha kwa chilungamo kumene kukuchitika kudzapanga.

en: "In my view, this is all window-dressing," said Madawi al-Rasheed, a U.K.-based academic and spokesperson for the opposition National Assembly Party founded by exiles.
ny: "M'malingaliro anga, zonsezi ndi zovala za pawindo," adatero Madawi al-Rasheed, wophunzira wa ku UK komanso wolankhulira chipani chotsutsa cha National Assembly Party chomwe chinakhazikitsidwa ndi anthu ogwidwa ukapolo.

en: "It's very, very difficult to see what the meaning is of these reforms apart from the project of portraying (Prince Mohammed) as a reformer."
ny: "Ndizovuta kwambiri, zovuta kwambiri kuwona tanthauzo la kusintha kumeneku kupatula polojekiti yosonyeza (Prince Mohammed) ngati wosintha."

en: Hanging over any discussion of justice and legal reform in Saudi Arabia is the 2018 murder and dismemberment of critic and columnist Jamal Khashoggi in the kingdom's Istanbul consulate.
ny: Kupachikidwa pa zokambirana zilizonse za chilungamo ndi kusintha kwa malamulo ku Saudi Arabia ndi kuphedwa kwa 2018 ndi kudulidwa kwa wotsutsa ndi wolemba nkhani Jamal Khashoggi mu ufumu wa Istanbul consulate.

en: A U.S. intelligence assessment found Prince Mohammed himself "approved" an operation to capture or kill Khashoggi, though Saudi officials deny this and say it was a "rogue" operation.
ny: Kufufuza kwa nzeru za ku United States kunapeza kuti Prince Mohammed mwiniwakeyo "anavomereza" ntchito yogwira kapena kupha Khashoggi, ngakhale akuluakulu a Saudi akukana izi ndikunena kuti inali ntchito "yowonongeka".

en: In April, before Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan visited Riyadh on Thursday and embraced Prince Mohammed, Turkey transferred the trial in absentia of 26 suspects in the Khashoggi case to Saudi Arabia.
ny: Mu Epulo, Purezidenti wa Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan asanapite ku Riyadh Lachinayi ndikukupatira Prince Mohammed, Turkey inasamutsa mlanduwu popanda anthu 26 omwe akukayikira mlandu wa Khashoggi ku Saudi Arabia.

en: Turkey's decision drew anguished protest from lawyers and Khashoggi's fiancée, who insisted Saudi courts couldn't possibly hold a credible trial.
ny: Chigamulo cha Turkey chinachititsa zionetsero zosautsa kuchokera kwa maloya ndi chibwenzi cha Khashoggi, omwe adaumirira kuti makhoti a Saudi sangathe kuchita mlandu wodalirika.

en: For the loved ones of those locked away, Khashoggi's killing fuels a uniform fear of speaking out.
ny: Kwa okondedwa a omwe atsekeredwa, kuphedwa kwa Khashoggi kumayambitsa mantha a yunifolomu kuti adzalankhula.

en: "I want to, many do, but we're scared," said a friend of Prince Salman bin Abdulaziz, who has been detained along with his father since 2018.
ny: "Ndikufuna, ambiri amatero, koma tikuchita mantha," adatero mnzake wa Prince Salman bin Abdulaziz, yemwe wasungidwa pamodzi ndi bambo ake kuyambira 2018.

en: "Everyone knows what happened to Khashoggi."
ny: "Aliyense akudziwa zomwe zinachitikira Khashoggi."

en: Moroccan Prison Program Sets Out to De-Radicalize IS Veterans
ny: Pulogalamu ya Ndende ya Moroccan Imakhazikitsa De-Radicalize IS Veterans

en: As a combatant for the Islamic State group who left his native Morocco to join what he felt was a holy fight in Syria, Mohsin says he saw all the horrors of war. "A terrifying experience," he says.
ny: Monga msilikali wa gulu la Islamic State yemwe adachoka kwawo ku Morocco kuti alowe nawo zomwe adaganiza kuti ndi nkhondo yopatulika ku Syria, Mohsin akuti adawona zoopsa zonse za nkhondo. "Chochitika choopsa," iye akutero.

en: Now a prisoner, the 38-year-old claims he is no longer the fanatic he was then, enraged with a murderous hatred for non-Muslims. Captured in Turkey and extradited to Morocco, he is serving a 10-year prison term on terrorism charges.
ny: Tsopano mkaidi, wazaka 38 akuti iye salinso wokonda kwambiri iye anali pamenepo, anakwiya ndi chidani chakupha kwa anthu omwe sanali Asilamu. Atagwidwa ku Turkey ndikuperekedwa ku Morocco, akugwira ntchito m'ndende zaka 10 pa milandu ya uchigawenga.

en: Now the former fighter has graduated with 14 other prisoners convicted of terror offenses from a Morocco de-radicalization program that might make them more eligible for an early release.
ny: Tsopano msilikali wakale wamaliza maphunziro ndi akaidi ena a 14 omwe amapezeka ndi milandu yoopsa kuchokera ku pulogalamu ya Morocco de-radicalization yomwe ingawapangitse kukhala oyenera kwambiri kumasulidwa msanga.

en: The Associated Press and other media were invited to observe their graduation ceremony Thursday in a prison in Sale near the Moroccan capital, Rabat, and to interview some prisoners under monitored and controlled conditions. Prison administration officials picked out three men they said were willing to be interviewed.
ny: Associated Press ndi atolankhani ena adaitanidwa kuti akachite mwambo wawo womaliza maphunziro Lachinayi m'ndende ku Sale pafupi ndi likulu la Morocco, Rabat, ndikufunsa akaidi ena pansi pa mikhalidwe yoyang'aniridwa ndi yolamulidwa. Akuluakulu oyang'anira ndende anasankha amuna atatu amene ananena kuti anali ofunitsitsa kufunsidwa.

en: Officials stipulated that the inmates shouldn't be identified by their full names and that their faces mustn't be shown, citing privacy reasons.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma ananena kuti akaidiwo sayenera kudziwika ndi mayina awo onse ndipo nkhope zawo siziyenera kuwonetsedwa, potchula zifukwa zachinsinsi.

en: But prison officials didn't listen to the interviews or intervene to shut down media lines of questioning or inmates' answers.
ny: Koma akuluakulu a ndende sanamvere zokambiranazo kapena kulowerera kuti atseke mizere yofalitsa nkhani ya mafunso kapena mayankho a akaidi.

en: The 15 inmates in crisp shirts and trousers stood solemnly for Morocco's national anthem and were handed certificates. Prison officials said the de-radicalization program consisted of three months of classes in prison on religion, law and economics, and that inmates also received training on how to start a business. These most recent graduates were the ninth batch since the program started in 2017.
ny: Akaidi 15 ovala malaya a crisp ndi mathalauza anaimirira mwamphamvu nyimbo ya dziko la Morocco ndipo anapatsidwa zikalata. Akuluakulu a ndende adati pulogalamu ya de-radicalization inali ndi miyezi itatu ya makalasi m'ndende pa chipembedzo, malamulo ndi zachuma, ndikuti akaidi adalandiranso maphunziro a momwe angayambire bizinesi. Omaliza maphunziro aposachedwa kwambiri awa anali gulu lachisanu ndi chinayi kuyambira pamene pulogalamuyi inayamba mu 2017.

en: Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, the director of social-cultural action and prisoner reintegration at Morocco's prison administration, said the program is entirely voluntary and works with inmates "to change their behavior and improve their life path."
ny: Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, mtsogoleri wa chikhalidwe cha anthu komanso kubwezeretsa akaidi ku ndende ya Morocco, adati pulogalamuyi ndi yodzifunira kwathunthu ndipo imagwira ntchito ndi akaidi "kusintha khalidwe lawo ndikuwongolera njira yawo ya moyo."

en: "It enables prisoners to form an awareness of the gravity of their mistakes," he said.
ny: "Zimathandiza akaidi kupanga chidziwitso cha kukula kwa zolakwa zawo," adatero.

en: Graduating from the program doesn't make inmates automatically eligible for early release, but does increase their chances of getting a royal pardon or a reduced sentence. That's been the case for just over half the program's 222 graduates so far, the prison administration says. Since 2019, the training has also been offered to women convicted under Morocco's Anti-Terrorism Act. Ten women have graduated so far — all of them since released, including eight with pardons.
ny: Kumaliza maphunziro a pulogalamuyi sikumapangitsa akaidi kukhala oyenerera kumasulidwa msanga, koma kumawonjezera mwayi wawo wopeza chikhululukiro chachifumu kapena chilango chochepetsedwa. Zimenezo zakhala zikuchitika kwa oposa theka la omaliza maphunziro 222 a pulogalamuyi mpaka pano, akutero oyang'anira ndende. Kuyambira 2019, maphunzirowa aperekedwanso kwa amayi omwe amapezeka ndi mlandu pansi pa Morocco's Anti-Terrorism Act. Azimayi khumi amaliza maphunziro mpaka pano - onsewo kuyambira atamasulidwa, kuphatikizapo asanu ndi atatu ndi chikhululukiro.

en: Called "Moussalaha," meaning "reconciliation" in Arabic, the program is offered to prisoners who have demonstrated a readiness to disavow extremism.
ny: Wotchedwa "Moussalaha," kutanthauza "kuyanjanitsa" m'Chiarabu, pulogalamuyi imaperekedwa kwa akaidi omwe asonyeza kukonzekera kukana chiwawa.

en: Mohsin said he left to fight in Syria in 2012. A school dropout as a teen, he said he "was virtually illiterate and couldn't discern good from bad." He said he was radicalized by people who showed him extremist videos "about the divine obligation to battle those who don't follow Islamic principles and to murder non-Muslims."
ny: Mohsin adati adachoka kukamenya nkhondo ku Syria mu 2012. Munthu wina amene anasiya sukulu ali wachinyamata, ananena kuti "anali wosaphunzira kwenikweni ndipo sankatha kuzindikira zabwino ndi zoipa." Iye anati anali radicalized ndi anthu amene anamuonetsa mavidiyo onyanyira "za udindo waumulungu kulimbana ndi anthu amene satsatira mfundo za Chisilamu ndi kupha anthu omwe si Asilamu."

en: In Syria, "I saw massacres, rapes, and thefts," he said. "I concluded after a time that the fight being conducted in the name of Islam had nothing to do with our religion."
ny: Ku Syria, "ndinaona kuphedwa kwa anthu, kugwirira chigololo, ndi kuba," iye anatero. "Ndinamaliza patapita nthawi kuti kumenyana komwe kukuchitika m'dzina la Chisilamu kulibe chochita ndi chipembedzo chathu."

en: He escaped to Turkey in 2018 and was detained for a year there before being extradited to Morocco.
ny: Anathawira ku Turkey mu 2018 ndipo anamangidwa kwa chaka chimodzi kumeneko asanaperekedwe ku Morocco.

en: He says he has now disavowed extremism.
ny: Iye akuti tsopano wakana uchitsiru.

en: "That period of my life has passed," he said.
ny: "Nthawi imeneyo ya moyo wanga yapita," iye anatero.

en: Numerous Moroccans have traveled to Syria, Iraq and elsewhere to join extremist groups. Morocco has also experienced multiple attacks itself. Five suicide attacks in Casablanca in 2003 killed 33 people. In 2011, an explosion destroyed a cafe in Marrakech, killing 17 people, most of them foreign tourists.
ny: Anthu ambiri a ku Morocco apita ku Syria, Iraq ndi kwina kulikonse kukagwirizana ndi magulu otsutsa. Morocco yakumananso ndi kuukira kochuluka kwenikweniko. Kudzipha kwa asanu ku Casablanca mu 2003 kunapha anthu 33. Mu 2011, kuphulika kunawononga malo ogulitsira ku Marrakech, ndipo anthu 17 anapha anthu 17, ndipo ambiri mwa iwo anali alendo ochokera kunja.

en: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, a clinical psychologist and member of the program's scientific committee, said among 156 people who have been released after attending the courses, just one has been caught committing a crime again.
ny: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, yemwe ndi katswiri wa zamaganizo komanso membala wa komiti ya sayansi ya pulogalamuyi, adati pakati pa anthu 156 omwe atulutsidwa atapita ku maphunzirowa, mmodzi yekha wagwidwa akuchita upandu kachiwiri.

en: That person was convicted of a non-terrorism-related offense, he said.
ny: Munthu ameneyo adapezeka ndi mlandu wokhudzana ndi uchigawenga, adatero.

en: Iran Gets Opportunity to Sell Auto Parts to Russian Carmaker
ny: Iran Imapeza Mwayi Wogulitsa Magalimoto a Magalimoto ku Russian Carmaker

en: A member of Iran's syndicate of car parts manufacturers says Iranian producers have an opportunity to export their wares to a Russian carmaker, state media reported.
ny: Membala wa Iran syndicate wa opanga magalimoto mbali akuti opanga Iran ndi mwayi kutumiza katundu wawo kwa carmaker Russian, atolankhani boma inanena.

en: The late Monday report quoted Hossein Bahrainian as saying "a prominent Russian car maker" requested parts from Iran. He did not name the manufacturer. He said it requested brake parts, airbags, air-conditioner parts and other components.
ny: Lipoti la Lolemba mochedwa linagwira mawu a Hossein Bahrainian kuti "wopanga magalimoto wotchuka wa ku Russia" adapempha mbali kuchokera ku Iran. Iye sanatchule dzina la wopanga. Iye anati anapempha mbali ananyema, airbags, mbali mpweya wofewetsa ndi zigawo zina.

en: Both Iran and Russia are under U.S. sanctions but the export of Iranian cars and car parts is not subject to sanctions.
ny: Onse Iran ndi Russia ali pansi pa zilango US koma kunja kwa magalimoto Iran ndi magalimoto mbali si pansi pa zilango.

en: The import of automobiles to Iran is also not subject to sanctions. However, Tehran has not imported cars since 2018, after the U.S. withdrew from a nuclear deal between Iran and world powers and imposed oil and banking sanctions on Iran.
ny: Kulowetsedwa kwa magalimoto ku Iran komanso sikuli pansi pa zilango. Komabe, Tehran sinalowetse magalimoto kuyambira 2018, pambuyo poti dziko la United States linachoka pa mgwirizano wa nyukiliya pakati pa Iran ndi mayiko apadziko lonse lapansi ndikuyika zilango za mafuta ndi mabanki ku Iran.

en: Western nations stopped exporting to Russia after the invasion of Ukraine.
ny: Maiko akumadzulo anasiya kutumiza ku Russia pambuyo pa kuwukira kwa Ukraine.

en: Iran in recent years has exported car radiators and suspension systems to Russia. In the past it exported cars to Iraq, Syria and Venezuela.
ny: Iran m'zaka zaposachedwapa yatumiza ma radiator a galimoto ndi njira zoyimitsidwa ku Russia. M'mbuyomu inatumiza magalimoto ku Iraq, Syria ndi Venezuela.

en: Tehran and Moscow have had close relations in recent years, especially after Iran's sole nuclear power plant went online in 2011 with help from Russia.
ny: Tehran ndi Moscow akhala akugwirizana kwambiri m'zaka zaposachedwapa, makamaka pambuyo poti mphamvu yokhayo ya nyukiliya ya Iran idapita pa intaneti mu 2011 mothandizidwa ndi Russia.

en: Separately on Tuesday, Iran said it has played a mediatory role in the war in Ukraine.
ny: Mwapadera Lachiwiri, Iran inanena kuti yachita mbali ya mediatory mu nkhondo ku Ukraine.

en: "So far twice I have conveyed messages from the foreign minister of Ukraine to my Russian counterpart," said Foreign Minister Hossein Amir Abdollahian in a phone conversation with his Irish counterpart. He said Iran supports diplomatic solutions for restoring peace and stability.
ny: "Pakali pano kawiri ndapereka mauthenga ochokera kwa nduna ya zakunja ya Ukraine kwa mnzanga wa ku Russia," adatero Unduna wa Zakunja Hossein Amir Abdollahian pokambirana pafoni ndi mnzake wa ku Ireland. Iye adati Iran imathandizira njira zothetsera mavuto kuti abwezeretse mtendere ndi bata.

en: Abdollahian did not elaborate but said Iran "opposes war and displacement of human beings in Ukraine," and other paces like Yemen, the Palestinian lands and Afghanistan.
ny: Abdollahian sanafotokoze mwatsatanetsatane koma anati Iran "imatsutsa nkhondo ndi kusamutsidwa kwa anthu ku Ukraine," ndi mayendedwe ena monga Yemen, mayiko a Palestina ndi Afghanistan.

en: Diversity, New Perspectives Are Applied to Middle East Coverage
ny: Kusiyanasiyana, Malingaliro Atsopano Amagwiritsidwa Ntchito ku Middle East Coverage

en: Natalia Sancha has always adopted a collaborative approach to journalism. When out on assignment, she speaks to others covering the same story about their perspectives.
ny: Natalia Sancha nthawi zonse wakhala akugwiritsa ntchito njira yogwirizana pa nkhani zofalitsa nkhani. Pamene ali pa gawo, amalankhula ndi ena akufotokoza nkhani imodzimodziyo ponena za malingaliro awo.

en: This partly stems from an interest in telling underreported stories, but as a female journalist in a male-dominated region, she says collaboration and supporting the women she works with have always been important.
ny: Izi mwapang'ono zimachokera ku chidwi chofotokozera nkhani zosadziwika bwino, koma monga mtolankhani wamkazi m'chigawo cholamulidwa ndi amuna, akuti mgwirizano ndi kuthandizira akazi omwe amagwira nawo ntchito nthawi zonse akhala ofunika.

en: "I would talk to male and female journalists, and I always realized that women had a similar perspective, because we had similar experiences while covering the story," the 42-year-old journalist said.
ny: "Ndinkalankhula ndi atolankhani achimuna ndi achikazi, ndipo nthawi zonse ndinazindikira kuti azimayi ali ndi malingaliro ofanana, chifukwa tinali ndi zochitika zofanana pamene tikufotokoza nkhaniyi," mtolankhani wazaka 42 adatero.

en: That collaborative approach came into play in 2020 when a publisher asked Sancha if she was interested in writing a book about Syria.
ny: Njira yogwirizana imeneyo idayamba kugwira ntchito mu 2020 pamene wofalitsa anafunsa Sancha ngati anali ndi chidwi cholemba buku lonena za Syria.

en: She countered with a better offer.
ny: Iye anatsutsa ndi mwaŵi wabwino.

en: "I told him that a collective narrative by women journalists about the broader region would have a different effect," she said. "I could have written the book myself, but it would not have the same sense."
ny: "Ndinamuuza kuti nkhani yogwirizana ya atolankhani azimayi yokhudza dera lalikulu idzakhala ndi zotsatira zosiyana," adatero. "Ndikanatha kulemba bukulo ndekha, koma silikanakhala ndi lingaliro lomwelo."

en: Originally from Andalusia in southern Spain, Sancha spent the past 14 years in the Middle East covering conflicts in Iraq, Syria and Yemen, and reporting from Egypt, Lebanon and Tunisia.
ny: Wochokera ku Andalusia kum'mwera kwa Spain, Sancha adakhala zaka 14 zapitazo ku Middle East akufotokoza za nkhondo ku Iraq, Syria ndi Yemen, ndikupereka lipoti kuchokera ku Egypt, Lebanon ndi Tunisia.

en: She has been working more recently with the European Union communications department, after leaving Beirut for health reasons following a mass explosion that rocked the city in 2020.
ny: Iye wakhala akugwira ntchito posachedwapa ndi dipatimenti yolankhulana ya European Union, atachoka ku Beirut pazifukwa zaumoyo pambuyo pa kuphulika kwakukulu komwe kunagwedeza mzindawu mu 2020.

en: Women "have a different experience because we would go to places that our male colleagues were not used to. Not because we're smarter, but just because the majority of the region is still Arab, Muslim and gender-segregated," Sancha told VOA.
ny: Akazi "ali ndi chokumana nacho chosiyana chifukwa tikanapita kumalo amene anzathu achimuna sanazolowere. Osati chifukwa chakuti ndife anzeru, koma chifukwa chakuti anthu ambiri m'derali adakali Aluya, Asilamu komanso osiyana ndi amuna kapena akazi," Sancha adauza VOA.

en: Having women reporters has an impact, she noted.
ny: Kukhala ndi atolankhani akazi kuli ndi chiyambukiro, adatero.

en: "If I put myself in the position of the reader, I would prefer to have a woman telling me the story because it is going to be about 100 percent of the population, which means you are going to have a more inclusive narrative on the conflict."
ny: "Ndikadziika m'malo mwa wowerenga, ndingakonde kukhala ndi mkazi kundiuza nkhaniyi chifukwa idzakhala pafupifupi 100 peresenti ya anthu, zomwe zikutanthauza kuti mudzakhala ndi nkhani yowonjezereka pa nkhondo."

en: For her book, Sancha reached out to other women who cover the Middle East, to ensure diverse perspectives from foreign and local reporters.
ny: Kwa buku lake, Sancha adafikira azimayi ena omwe amafotokoza za Middle East, kuti atsimikizire malingaliro osiyanasiyana ochokera kwa atolankhani akunja ndi am'deralo.

en: The result of the nearly two-year collaboration is Bullets for All, released in Spanish in April.
ny: Zotsatira za mgwirizano wa zaka pafupifupi ziwiri ndi Bullets for All, yotulutsidwa m'Chisipanishi mu Epulo.

en: In the book, "we tell one story with different voices that represent all the women" from the region, Sancha said.
ny: M'bukuli, "timafotokoza nkhani imodzi ndi mawu osiyanasiyana omwe amaimira akazi onse" ochokera m'deralo, Sancha adatero.

en: Each offers a personal perspective on covering historic moments, including the collapse of autocratic governments, popular protest movements and war. It also examines the discrimination and harassment women face in the newsroom and on assignment.
ny: Aliyense amapereka lingaliro laumwini pakuphimba nthawi zakale, kuphatikizapo kugwa kwa maboma a autocratic, magulu otsutsa otchuka ndi nkhondo. Limapendanso tsankho ndi kuvutitsidwa kumene akazi amakumana nako m'chipinda cha nkhani ndi pa gawo.

en: Making connections
ny: Kupanga kulumikizana

en: Understanding language and culture goes a long way toward making progress in the region, says Maya Gebeily. The Reuters bureau chief for Lebanon, Syria and Jordan is one of the contributors to the book.
ny: Kumvetsetsa chinenero ndi chikhalidwe kungathandize kwambiri kupita patsogolo m'deralo, akutero Maya Gebeily. Mkulu wa bungwe la Reuters ku Lebanon, Syria ndi Jordan ndi mmodzi mwa omwe amathandizira bukuli.

en: "There's a lot to say and show from the perspective of women reporters who were also then influenced by the women that they met as they were doing their reporting," she said.
ny: "Pali zambiri zonena ndikuwonetsa kuchokera ku malingaliro a atolankhani azimayi omwe nawonso kenako anasonkhezeredwa ndi azimayi omwe adakumana nawo pamene akuchita malipoti awo," adatero.

en: Born in the U.S. to Lebanese parents, Gebeily started her journalism career in 2013 with a local news site in Beirut, Lebanon. She went on to cover the region for Agence France-Presse before joining Reuters.
ny: Wobadwira ku US kwa makolo a ku Lebanon, Gebeily adayamba ntchito yake yofalitsa nkhani mu 2013 ndi malo a nkhani ku Beirut, Lebanon. Anapitiriza kuphimba dera la Agence France-Presse asanalowe Reuters.

en: Gebeily said her American and Lebanese background helped her understand the region better, which in turn has shaped her reporting. Knowing the local language is an important part of that.
ny: Gebeily adati chiyambi chake cha ku America ndi ku Lebanon chinamuthandiza kumvetsetsa bwino chigawocho, chomwe chapanga malipoti ake. Kudziwa chinenero chakomweko ndi mbali yofunika kwambiri ya zimenezo.

en: "When interviewing a minister or a displaced person or an activist, the most important element is getting their trust," she said. "If you're able to speak the language and make them feel comfortable from the beginning, it changes everything. It grants you a very beautiful kind of access."
ny: "Pofunsa mtumiki kapena munthu wothamangitsidwa kapena wolimbikitsa, chinthu chofunika kwambiri ndikupeza chidaliro chawo," adatero. "Ngati mutha kulankhula chinenerocho ndi kuwapangitsa kukhala omasuka kuyambira pachiyambi, zimasintha zonse. Zimakupatsani mtundu wokongola kwambiri wa mwayi."

en: In addition to Iraq and Lebanon, Gebeily, 30, has also traveled to Syria to cover the war against the Islamic State (IS) militant group.
ny: Kuwonjezera pa Iraq ndi Lebanon, Gebeily, 30, nayenso wapita ku Syria kukaphimba nkhondo yolimbana ndi gulu lankhondo la Islamic State (IS).

en: "Ive been very privileged to access some communities directly without having to work with a translator or a fixer, which also shapes the way that the stories come out," she said.
ny: "Ive yakhala ndi mwayi waukulu wopeza madera ena mwachindunji popanda kugwira ntchito ndi womasulira kapena wokonza, zomwe zimapanganso njira yomwe nkhani zimatuluka," adatero.

en: Syrian-Kurdish journalist Khabat Abbas, who has covered the war in Syria, attests to the importance of that.
ny: Mtolankhani wa ku Syria-Kurdish Khabat Abbas, yemwe wafotokoza za nkhondo ku Syria, akutsimikizira kufunika kwa zimenezo.

en: "Its knowing the language and the culture that gives people a sense of comfort to open up to you," she told VOA from Qamishli, Syria.
ny: "Kudziwa kwake chinenero ndi chikhalidwe chomwe chimapatsa anthu chitonthozo kuti akutsegulini," adauza VOA kuchokera ku Qamishli, Syria.

en: That knowledge helped when Abbas, 34, was on assignment with Sancha in March 2021. They traveled to a Kurdish-run detention camp in northeast Syria and interviewed female jihadists affiliated with IS, for a story in El Pais.
ny: Chidziwitso chimenecho chinathandiza pamene Abbas, 34, anali pa gawo ndi Sancha mu March 2021. Iwo anapita ku msasa wosungirako anthu a ku Kurdish kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa Syria ndipo anafunsa akazi a jihadist omwe akugwirizana ndi IS, kuti apeze nkhani ku El Pais.

en: "While in Qamishli [in northeast Syria], I ran into two British journalists, very good colleagues of mine, who were disappointed after Shamima Begum and other women at the camp refused to talk to them," Sancha said, referring to a young woman who left her home in Britain aged 15 to join IS.
ny: "Ndili ku Qamishli [kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa Syria], ndinathamangira atolankhani awiri a ku Britain, anzanga abwino kwambiri, omwe anakhumudwa pambuyo poti Shamima Begum ndi azimayi ena pamsasapo anakana kulankhula nawo," adatero Sancha, ponena za mtsikana wina yemwe anachoka kunyumba kwake ku Britain ali ndi zaka 15 kuti alowe IS.

en: "Their fixer was a man, so the jihadist women didnt talk to them because they are radical, and they dont talk to men. But then I was able to sit with Shamima and other women, who gave fantastic interviews from inside their tents," Sancha said.
ny: "Wokonza wawo anali mwamuna, choncho azimayi a jihadist sanalankhule nawo chifukwa ndi otsutsa, ndipo salankhula ndi amuna. Koma kenako ndinatha kukhala ndi Shamima ndi azimayi ena, omwe anapereka mafunso abwino kwambiri kuchokera mkati mwa mahema awo," adatero Sancha.

en: Abbas had a role in getting to talk to those women, she added.
ny: Abbas anali ndi mbali m'kupeza kulankhula ndi akazi amenewo, anawonjezera motero.

en: Unlike Sancha and Gebeily, Abbas grew up in the marginalized Kurdish region of Syria, where until the war began in 2011, journalism effectively didnt exist.
ny: Mosiyana ndi Sancha ndi Gebeily, Abbas anakulira m'chigawo cha Kurdish chotsalira cha Syria, komwe mpaka nkhondo inayamba mu 2011, utolankhani sunakhalepo.

en: "Ordinary people in our region were used to seeing women pick up arms and fight, but they werent used to seeing a woman hold a camera on the streets and on front lines," Abbas said. "It took a lot of sacrificing for me to convince my family and society that Im as good, if not better, as my male colleagues."
ny: "Anthu wamba m'chigawo chathu anazolowera kuona azimayi akutenga zida ndi kumenyana, koma sanazolowere kuona mayi wina akugwira kamera m'misewu komanso kutsogolo," adatero Abbas.
