The Rwanda government argues that allowing a range of opinions would be dangerous in a country struggling to come to terms with its bloody past.
ny: Lipotilo likunena kuti asilikali akulamulira moyo wa anthu ndipo pali kudzudzulidwa kochepa poyera kwa boma, kaya m'manyuzipepala kapena ndi otsutsa. Boma la Rwanda likutsutsa kuti kulola malingaliro osiyanasiyana kungakhale koopsa m'dziko lomwe likuvutika kuvomereza zakale zake zamagazi.

en: But Mr. Grignon says dissent is simply being driven underground or outside Rwanda's borders.
ny: Koma a Grignon akuti kusagwirizana kumangoyendetsedwa mobisa kapena kunja kwa malire a Rwanda.

en: "Opponents to the regime have to flee the country or to join in rebel movements outside the country or in the Congo and no chance to express a different view," he says. "All the good policies that the government has been implementing - including the organization of the elections, national elections, presidential and parliamentary, in 2003 - will lack the credibility because they were not implemented in an environment that actually allowed a fair contest to take place," he says.
ny: "Otsutsa boma ayenera kuthawa m'dzikoli kapena kugwirizana ndi magulu oukira boma kunja kwa dziko kapena ku Congo ndipo palibe mwayi wofotokoza maganizo osiyana," iye akutero. "Ndondomeko zonse zabwino zomwe boma lakhala likugwiritsa ntchito - kuphatikizapo bungwe la zisankho, zisankho za dziko lonse, pulezidenti ndi nyumba ya malamulo, mu 2003 - zidzasowa kukhulupirika chifukwa sizinagwiritsidwe ntchito m'malo omwe kwenikweni analola kuti mpikisano wachilungamo uchitike," iye akutero.

en: Mr. Grignon says greater freedom of expression would strengthen Rwanda's reconciliation process and enhance its chances of a peaceful future.
ny: Bambo Grignon akuti ufulu waukulu wolankhula ungalimbitse ndondomeko yoyanjanitsa dziko la Rwanda komanso kupititsa patsogolo mwayi wake wokhala ndi tsogolo lamtendere.

en: He says the international community's involvement in reconstruction projects gives it the leverage to make this plain to the Rwandan government.
ny: Iye akuti kugwira ntchito yomanga zinthu m'mayiko ena kumapatsa mphamvu kuti zimenezi ziwachititse kuti boma la Rwanda likhale lomveka bwino.

en: Rwanda Welcomes the Arrest of Former Rebel Leader
ny: Rwanda Yalandira Kugwidwa kwa Mtsogoleri Wakale wa Opanduka

en: Rwandas Justice Minister said his government is pleased with the arrest Monday of a former rebel leader accused of masterminding genocide and violating human rights against Rwandans and Congolese villagers in 1994.
ny: Nduna ya zachilungamo ku Rwanda inati boma lake likukondwera ndi kumangidwa Lolemba kwa mtsogoleri wakale wa oukira boma yemwe akuimbidwa mlandu wotsogolera kupha anthu komanso kuphwanya ufulu wachibadwidwe kwa anthu a ku Rwanda ndi anthu a ku Congo mu 1994.

en: French authorities arrested Callixte Mbarushimana, a former leader of the infamous Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR), an ethnic Hutu rebel group.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma la France anagwira Callixte Mbarushimana, yemwe kale anali mtsogoleri wa gulu loipa kwambiri la Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR), lomwe ndi gulu loukira fuko la Ahutu.

en: Tharcisse Karugarama welcomed the decision of French authorities to enforce the international arrest warrant issued by his government and the International Criminal Court (ICC) against the former rebel leader.
ny: Tharcisse Karugarama adalandira chigamulo cha akuluakulu a ku France kuti akhazikitse chilolezo chomangidwa padziko lonse choperekedwa ndi boma lake komanso International Criminal Court (ICC) motsutsana ndi mtsogoleri wakale woukira.

en: "It is good news that Callixte Mbarushimana has been (arrested) by the French judicial authority. Good news in the sense that, first, there was an international arrest warrant against him issued by the Rwandan government in respect of (the alleged) act of genocide committed in Rwanda in 1994."
ny: "Ndi nkhani yabwino kuti Callixte Mbarushimana wakhala (amangidwa) ndi ulamuliro wachiweruzo wa ku France. Nkhani yabwino m'lingaliro lakuti, choyamba, panali chilolezo chom'manga padziko lonse chomwe boma la Rwanda linapereka polemekeza (mchitidwe womwe akuti) wa kupululutsa anthu womwe unachitika ku Rwanda mu 1994."

en: Karugarama said the Hague-based court sought the arrest of the former rebel leader who was believed to be hiding in France.
ny: Karugarama adati khoti la ku Hague linafuna kumangidwa kwa mtsogoleri wakale wa oukira yemwe akukhulupirira kuti akubisala ku France.

en: Genocide memorial in Rwanda
ny: Chikumbutso cha kupha anthu ku Rwanda

en: "The International Criminal Court (ICC) conducted its own investigation about his other activities and they found sufficient evidence to support the charge of war crimes and crimes against humanity perpetrated in the DRC and they issued an arrest warrant, which the French judicial authorities have executed."
ny: "Khoti la International Criminal Court (ICC) linachita kafukufuku wake pa ntchito zake zina ndipo anapeza umboni wokwanira wothandizira mlandu wa milandu yankhondo komanso milandu yotsutsana ndi anthu yomwe ikuchitika ku DRC ndipo anapereka chilolezo chom'manga, chomwe akuluakulu a zachiweruzo ku France apha."

en: The Hague-based court accused Mbarushimana and other rebels in the FDLR of using violence against unarmed civilians as their main tool in a campaign to forcefully obtain political power for the rebel group.
ny: Khoti la ku Hague linaimba mlandu Mbarushimana ndi zigawenga zina ku FDLR kuti akugwiritsa ntchito chiwawa kwa anthu wamba opanda zida ngati chida chawo chachikulu pofuna kupeza mwamphamvu mphamvu zandale kwa gulu loukira.

en: According to the ICC, "as a result of this deadly blackmail (by the FDLR rebels), victims were killed, raped, and forcibly displaced, and entire villages were razed to the ground."
ny: Malinga ndi ICC, "chifukwa cha chinyengo chakupha chimenechi (ndi oukira a FDLR), anthu amene anaphedwa anaphedwa, kugwiriridwa chigololo, ndi kuthamangitsidwa mokakamiza, ndipo midzi yonse inawonongedwa pansi."

en: Karugarama said Mbarushimana and his FDLR rebel forces played a pivotal role in the countrys 1994 genocide in which hundreds of thousands of people were killed.
ny: Karugarama adati Mbarushimana ndi magulu ake oukira a FDLR adachita mbali yofunika kwambiri pa kupululutsa anthu m'dziko la 1994 komwe anthu zikwi mazana ambiri anaphedwa.

en: "We believe that, in the next couple of weeks after due process has taken place in France, he should be able to be transferred to The Hague in the Netherlands to face charges and be prosecuted for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed within the territory of the DRC."
ny: "Tikukhulupirira kuti, m'masabata angapo otsatira pambuyo poti ndondomeko yoyenera yachitika ku France, ayenera kukhala wokhoza kusamutsidwira ku The Hague ku Netherlands kukayang'anizana ndi milandu ndikuzengedwa mlandu wa milandu yankhondo ndi milandu yotsutsana ndi anthu yomwe yachitidwa m'dera la DRC."

en: The Justice Minister also said Kigali will be cooperating with the International Criminal Court in the imminent prosecution of Mbarushimana.
ny: Nduna ya zachilungamo inanenanso kuti Kigali idzagwirizana ndi International Criminal Court pa mlandu womwe wayandikira wa Mbarushimana.

en: British, French Foreign Ministers to Re-Invigorate DRC Peace Process - 2002-01-18
ny: Atumiki Akunja a ku Britain, France Kuti Ayambirenso Mtendere wa DRC - 2002-01-18

en: The British and French foreign ministers travel to the Democratic Republic of Congo Monday to kickoff a three-day, four-nation tour of the troubled region of Central Africa.
ny: Atumiki akunja a ku Britain ndi ku France akupita ku Democratic Republic of Congo Lolemba kukayamba ulendo wa masiku atatu, wa mayiko anayi m'chigawo chovuta cha Central Africa.

en: The mission will be jointly led by British Foreign Secretary Jack Straw and his French counterpart Hubert Vedrine.
ny: Ntchitoyi idzatsogoleredwa limodzi ndi Mlembi wa Zakunja wa Britain Jack Straw ndi mnzake wa ku France Hubert Vedrine.

en: They will be visiting the Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda.
ny: Adzakhala akuyendera Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi ndi Uganda.

en: Their primary objective is to breathe new life into the peace process in the war-torn Congo.
ny: Cholinga chawo chachikulu ndi kupuma moyo watsopano mu mtendere ku Congo yomwe ili ndi nkhondo.

en: Specifically, the British and French want to see the withdrawal of foreign troops who back the Congolese government (n Kinshasa, demobilization of rebels who occupy more than half the country, and peace talks to end the conflict.
ny: Makamaka, a British ndi French akufuna kuwona kuchotsedwa kwa asilikali akunja omwe amathandizira boma la Congo (n Kinshasa, demobilization ya oukira omwe amatenga oposa theka la dziko, ndi zokambirana zamtendere kuti athetse nkhondo.

en: British Foreign Secretary Straw said the mission also has a broader goal of making sure the Congo does not become another Afghanistan.
ny: Mlembi wa zakunja wa Britain Straw adati ntchitoyi ilinso ndi cholinga chachikulu chotsimikizira kuti Congo isakhale Afghanistan ina.

en: "The 11th of September has made it much more urgent that we take earlier action against failed, and failing states," he said.
ny: "Chaka cha 11 cha Seputembala chapangitsa kuti zikhale zofulumira kwambiri kuti titenge zochita zoyambirira zotsutsana ndi boma lolephera, komanso lolephera," adatero.

en: In Kinshasa, the ministers will meet Congolese President Joseph Kabila. He took power one year ago, after his father, President Laurent Kabila, was assassinated by one of his bodyguards.
ny: Ku Kinshasa, nduna zidzakumana ndi Purezidenti wa Congo Joseph Kabila. Anatenga ulamuliro chaka chimodzi chapitacho, pambuyo poti bambo ake, Purezidenti Laurent Kabila, anaphedwa ndi mmodzi wa alonda ake.

en: Their next stop will be Kigali for talks with Rwandan President Paul Kagame, and the leader of the Rally for Congolese Democracy rebels, Adolphe Onusumba.
ny: Malo awo otsatira adzakhala Kigali kukakambirana ndi Purezidenti wa Rwanda Paul Kagame, komanso mtsogoleri wa gulu la Rally for Congolese Democracy rebels, Adolphe Onusumba.

en: The ministers will make a brief visit to Burundi to discuss that country's civil war with President Pierre Buyoya.
ny: Atumikiwo adzapanga ulendo wachidule ku Burundi kukambirana za nkhondo yapachiweniweni ya dziko limenelo ndi Purezidenti Pierre Buyoya.

en: The tour will end in Uganda, where meetings are scheduled with President Yoweri Museveni and Jean-Pierre Bemba, who leads the Movement for the Liberation of Congo guerrillas.
ny: Ulendowu udzatha ku Uganda, komwe misonkhano ikukonzedwa ndi Purezidenti Yoweri Museveni ndi Jean-Pierre Bemba, omwe akutsogolera gulu la Movement for the Liberation of Congo guerrillas.

en: UNICEF Pushes for Demobilizing Child Soliders Near Africa's Great Lakes - 2002-10-07
ny: UNICEF Ikukankhira Kuchotsa Ana Olimba Pafupi ndi Nyanja Zazikulu za Africa - 2002-10-07

en: The United Nations children's agency, UNICEF, is pushing for child soldiers to be demobilized in Africa's Great Lakes region, as several peace drives there build momentum. The agency says funding is in place to help the children leave the military and restart their lives.
ny: Bungwe la ana la United Nations, la UNICEF, likukakamiza kuti ana asilikali athetsedwe ntchito m'chigawo cha Great Lakes ku Africa, pamene njira zingapo zamtendere kumeneko zikukula. Bungweli likuti ndalama zilipo zothandizira anawo kuchoka m'gulu lankhondo ndikuyambitsanso miyoyo yawo.

en: UNICEF's top child protection official, Manuel Fontaine, says peace initiatives in Uganda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda are making it possible to get more children under the age of 18 out of fighting units. "We insist that child soldiers could be demobilized, even in conflict situations. We should never wait for peace to get children out of any form of armed group. But, obviously, that's a better timing at the moment. It's more conducive to demobilization," Mr. Fontaine said.
ny: Mkulu woyang'anira chitetezo cha ana ku UNICEF, Manuel Fontaine, akuti njira zamtendere ku Uganda, Democratic Republic of Congo ndi Rwanda zikupangitsa kuti ana ambiri osakwana zaka 18 atuluke m'magulu omenyana. "Timaumirira kuti ana asilikali akhoza kuchotsedwa ntchito, ngakhale m'mikhalidwe ya nkhondo. Sitiyenera kuyembekezera mtendere kuti ana atuluke m'gulu lililonse la zida. Koma, mwachiwonekere, imeneyo ndi nthawi yabwino pakali pano. Zimathandiza kwambiri demobilization," Bambo Fontaine anati.

en: He says there are currently 1,200 child soldiers in Uganda, fighting mainly with the rebel Lord's Resistance Army. He says that over the past 14 years, the group has abducted some 10,000 children, boys to fight and girls to serve as sex slaves.
ny: Iye akuti pakali pano pali ana asilikali 1,200 ku Uganda, akumenya nkhondo makamaka ndi gulu loukira la Lord's Resistance Army. Iye akuti pa zaka 14 zapitazi, gululi laba ana, anyamata pafupifupi 10,000 kuti amenyane ndi atsikana kuti akhale akapolo ogonana.

en: According to UNICEF, The Democratic Republic of Congo still has some 10,000 children recruited to fight, while Rwanda has up to 2,000 children involved in combat.
ny: Malinga ndi bungwe la UNICEF, dziko la Democratic Republic of Congo lidakali ndi ana pafupifupi 10,000 olembedwa ntchito kuti amenyane nawo, pamene Rwanda ili ndi ana mpaka 2,000 omwe akugwira nawo nkhondo.

en: UNICEF says, even though some of the children do not directly engage in fighting, they are exposed to many dangers. They may be used as porters, carrying very heavy loads, or as messengers or spies passing information and scouting out enemy territory.
ny: UNICEF ikuti, ngakhale kuti ena mwa anawo sachita nawo nkhondo mwachindunji, amakhala pangozi zambiri. Iwo angagwiritsidwe ntchito monga onyamula katundu, kunyamula katundu wolemera kwambiri, kapena monga amithenga kapena azondi akupereka chidziŵitso ndi kufufuza dera la adani.

en: Sometimes, boys, but mainly girls, are used as sex slaves. They are exposed to violence and HIV-AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases. The girls may become pregnant, making it harder for them to reintegrate into their communities.
ny: Nthawi zina, anyamata, koma makamaka atsikana, amagwiritsidwa ntchito ngati akapolo ogonana. Amapezeka ndi chiwawa ndi HIV-AIDS ndi matenda ena opatsirana pogonana. Atsikanawo angakhale ndi pakati, zomwe zimawavuta kubwereranso m'madera awo.

en: UNICEF's Manuel Fontaine says demobilization takes time and money. He says the children must first be found, and then removed from their government or rebel units. Then, resources are needed to help them rebuild their lives. That involves providing schools, vocational training and health care.
ny: Manuel Fontaine wa UNICEF akuti demobilization imatenga nthawi ndi ndalama. Iye akuti anawo ayenera kuyamba kupezeka, kenako n'kuchotsedwa m'magulu awo a boma kapena oukira. Kenaka, chuma chikufunika kuti awathandize kukonzanso miyoyo yawo. Zimenezo zimaphatikizapo kupereka masukulu, maphunziro a ntchito ndi chisamaliro chaumoyo.

en: "You do not want to stigmatize them and individualize them. They are basically going back to communities where there are a lot of other children, many of whom have suffered from consequences of war, even if they were not recruited. So, you are trying to build services in those communities that are broad services, that would be made available to all those children," Mr. Fontaine said.
ny: "Inu simukufuna stigmatize iwo ndi individualize iwo. Iwo kwenikweni akubwerera kumadera kumene kuli ana ena ambiri, ambiri a iwo avutika ndi zotulukapo za nkhondo, ngakhale ngati sanalembedwe ntchito. Choncho, mukuyesera kumanga ntchito m'madera amenewo omwe ndi ntchito zazikulu, zomwe zingaperekedwe kwa ana onsewo," a Fontaine adatero.

en: Mr. Fontaine says, as part of various peace packages in the Great Lakes region, the World Bank and other donors are providing $500 million to help demobilize children. He says, unfortunately, the needed government institutions are not yet in place in some countries to move the process ahead quickly enough. He says that's why UNICEF is pressing to see such structures develop, so that children can get back home and start to lead normal lives once again.
ny: Bambo Fontaine akuti, monga gawo la ma phukusi osiyanasiyana a mtendere m'dera la Great Lakes, World Bank ndi othandizira ena akupereka $ 500 miliyoni kuti athandize kuchotsa ana. Iye akuti, mwatsoka, mabungwe a boma ofunikira sanayambebe m'mayiko ena kuti apite patsogolo ndondomekoyi mwachangu mokwanira. Iye akuti ndichifukwa chake bungwe la UNICEF likukakamiza kuti zinthu ngati zimenezi zikule, kuti ana abwerere kwawo n'kuyambiranso kukhala ndi moyo wabwinobwino.

en: World Bank, Nike Team Up for 'The Girl Effect' Initiative
ny: Banki Yadziko Lonse, Nike Team Up for 'The Girl Effect' Initiative

en: The Adolescent Girls Initiative partners the World Bank, the Nike Foundation and governments of developing and developed nations to empower girls in poor countries.
ny: Bungwe la Adolescent Girls Initiative limagwirizana ndi World Bank, Nike Foundation ndi maboma a mayiko omwe akutukuka kumene komanso otukuka kuti apatse atsikana mphamvu m'mayiko osauka.

en: The two-year-old program is helping girls in Asia, Africa and the Middle East gain the education and skills they need to transition into the workforce.
ny: Pulogalamu ya zaka ziwiri ikuthandiza atsikana ku Asia, Africa ndi ku Middle East kupeza maphunziro ndi maluso omwe akufunikira kuti asinthe kukhala antchito.

en: "My name is Sanchita. I come from a small village called Ishwarpur in Bangladesh," American actress Anne Hathaway delivered her lines as powerfully from behind a podium at the World Bank as she does on the silver screen, telling the story of an impoverished girl.
ny: "Dzina langa ndi Sanchita. Ndimachokera kumudzi waung'ono wotchedwa Ishwarpur ku Bangladesh," wosewera wa ku America Anne Hathaway adapereka mizere yake mwamphamvu kuchokera kumbuyo kwa podium ku World Bank monga momwe amachitira pa chophimba cha siliva, akufotokoza nkhani ya mtsikana wosauka.

en: "When a baby is born in Ishwarpur, families desperately hope it will be a boy," she continued. "It has been this way for as long as anyone can remember.
ny: "Mwana akabadwa ku Ishwarpur, mabanja amayembekezera kwambiri kuti adzakhala mnyamata," anapitiriza motero. "Zakhala chonchi kwa nthawi yaitali yomwe aliyense angakumbukire.

en: It is believed that boys will contribute to the family income in a place where people are very poor.
ny: Akukhulupirira kuti anyamata adzapereka ndalama za banja pamalo amene anthu ali osauka kwambiri.

en: "These circumstances are familiar to those who benefit from the Adolescent Girls Initiative.
ny: "Mikhalidwe imeneyi ndi yodziwika kwa anthu amene amapindula ndi bungwe la Adolescent Girls Initiative.

en: Who benefits?A dozen such teenage girls and young women visited the World Bank from developing Asian, Middle Eastern and African countries.
ny: Ndani amapindula? Atsikana ndi atsikana khumi ndi awiri oterewa anapita ku World Bank kuchokera ku mayiko osauka a ku Asia, Middle East ndi Africa.

en: They were just a few of the girls who benefit from training and education programs that help them transition from school to employment.
ny: Iwo anali ochepa chabe mwa atsikana amene amapindula ndi maphunziro ndi maphunziro amene amawathandiza kusintha kuchoka kusukulu kupita kuntchito.

en: Hathaway told the audience that, with the help of a development organization, Sanchita gained an education and borrowed $60 to buy a cow and start a vegetable garden.
ny: Hathaway adauza omvera kuti, mothandizidwa ndi bungwe la chitukuko, Sanchita adapeza maphunziro ndipo adabwereka $ 60 kuti agule ng'ombe ndikuyamba munda wa masamba.

en: The teenage girl could then afford to pay her own school fees, as well as her brother's, and contribute to her family in such a way that Sanchita's parents hope she does not marry any time soon.Hathaway spoke of her own childhood in a comfortable suburban U.S. neighborhood, and of a time when she had no idea about the kind of circumstances Sanchita faced nor how much girls need safe spaces for education.
ny: Kenako mtsikana wachinyamatayo akanatha kulipira ndalama zake za sukulu, komanso za mchimwene wake, komanso kuthandizira banja lake m'njira yoti makolo a Sanchita akuyembekeza kuti asakwatire nthawi iliyonse posachedwa. Hathaway analankhula za ubwana wake m'dera labwino la m'tauni ya ku United States, ndi nthaŵi imene sanadziŵe za mtundu wa mikhalidwe imene Sanchita anakumana nayo kapena mmene atsikana amafunikira malo otetezereka kaamba ka maphunziro.

en: "Places that could teach them how to take the light they have as girls and ignite the world," explained Hathaway.
ny: "Malo omwe angawaphunzitse momwe angatenge kuwala komwe ali nawo ngati atsikana ndi kuyatsa dziko," anafotokoza Hathaway.

en: "I wouldn't know how much the world needs 'The Girl Effect.'"  Girl power"The Girl Effect" is what the Adolescent Girls Initiative wants to see happen for 600 million girls in developing countries.
ny: "Sindikanadziwa kuti dziko likufuna kwambiri 'The Girl Effect.'"  Mphamvu ya atsikana"The Girl Effect" ndi zomwe bungwe la Adolescent Girls Initiative likufuna kuwona zikuchitika kwa atsikana 600 miliyoni m'mayiko osauka.

en: Overall, an estimated one-third of young women in developing nations are not employed and not in school.World Bank President Robert Zoellick said underinvesting in girls impedes development.
ny: Cacikulu, pafupifupi gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu a atsikana m'mayiko osauka  analembedwa ntchito osati kusukulu. Purezidenti wa World Bank Robert Zoellick adati underinvesting atsikana kumalepheretsa chitukuko.

en: He added that educating girls also makes sense for poor families, noting that an extra year of secondary schooling can raise their wages by 10 to 20 percent.
ny: Iye anawonjezera kuti kuphunzitsa atsikana n'kwanzerunso kwa mabanja osauka, ndipo ananena kuti chaka chowonjezereka cha maphunziro a sekondale chingakweze malipiro awo ndi 10 mpaka 20 peresenti.

en: "If they earn greater income they also have greater access to reproductive health information and services, so then more likely to delay marriage and childbirth, have healthier babies and attain higher literacy rates," Zoellick said.
ny: "Ngati apeza ndalama zambiri amakhalanso ndi mwayi waukulu wopeza chidziwitso ndi ntchito zaumoyo wobereka, choncho ndiye kuti nthawi zambiri amachedwetsa ukwati ndi kubereka, amakhala ndi ana athanzi komanso amapeza chiwerengero chachikulu cha kuwerenga ndi kulemba," adatero Zoellick.

en: "The evidence strongly suggests that investing in adolescent girls is a key way to break inter-generational patterns of poverty."
ny: "Umboni ukusonyeza mwamphamvu kuti kuika ndalama mwa atsikana achinyamata ndi njira yofunika kwambiri yothetsera umphawi pakati pa mibadwo."

en: Current operations The Adolescent Girls Initiative public-private partnership, with its $20 million in funds, is already at work in seven countries, with plans to expand to Haiti and Yemen.         Mayra Buvinic talks about the Adolescent Girls Initiative
ny: Ntchito zamakono The Adolescent Girls Initiative mgwirizano wa boma ndi payekha, ndi ndalama zake za $ 20 miliyoni, zili kale pantchito m'mayiko asanu ndi awiri, ndikukonzekera kuwonjezera ku Haiti ndi Yemen.         Mayra Buvinic akulankhula za Adolescent Girls Initiative

en: "So where we are in Liberia and Nepal, young women are completing the first rounds of training," explained Mayra Buvinic, director of Gender and Development at the World Bank.
ny: "Choncho kumene tili ku Liberia ndi Nepal, atsikana akumaliza maphunziro oyamba," anafotokoza Mayra Buvinic, mkulu wa Gender and Development ku World Bank.

en: "In South Sudan, 100 adolescent girls' clubs will have opened in four states by the end of this month. In Jordan, female community college graduates are gaining access to vouchers.
ny: "Ku South Sudan, makalabu a atsikana achinyamata 100 adzakhala atatsegulidwa m'maboma anayi kumapeto kwa mwezi uno. Ku Jordan, akazi omaliza maphunziro ku koleji ya anthu akupeza mavocha.

en: In Afghanistan, Lao PDR and Rwanda, assessments are being completed, and the projects will be launched at the end of this quarter.
ny: Ku Afghanistan, Lao PDR ndi Rwanda, kuwunika kukumalizidwa, ndipo ntchitozo zidzayambitsidwa kumapeto kwa kotala uno.

en: "Thanks and praise Kebbeh Kamara tells the audience how she's benefited from the World Bank/Nike initiative
ny: "Zikomo ndi kutamanda Kebbeh Kamara akuuza omvera momwe akupindulira ndi ndondomeko ya World Bank / Nike

en: Kebbeh Kamara said she has benefited from training in Greater Monrovia, Liberia.
ny: Kebbeh Kamara adati wapindula ndi maphunziro ku Greater Monrovia, Liberia.

en: Wearing a pink dress and sporty black headband decorated with rhinestones, she addressed the World Bank audience from the stage.
ny: Atavala diresi la pinki ndi mutu wakuda wamasewera wokongoletsedwa ndi rhinestones, adalankhula ndi omvera a World Bank kuchokera pa siteji.

en: "I learned how to start a business, how to earn money on your own, how to be self-sustainable," she said, "how to save money and what to spend money for.
ny: "Ndinaphunzira momwe ndingayambitsire bizinesi, momwe angapezere ndalama nokha, momwe mungakhalire odzikhazikika," adatero, "momwe mungasungire ndalama ndi zomwe mungawononge ndalama.

en: " Sarah Poni Saturnino, 19, of Juba, Southern Sudan, told VOA she is enjoying her first trip to the United States and all the empowerment training and activities.
ny: " Sarah Poni Saturnino, wazaka 19, wa ku Juba, Southern Sudan, adauza VOA kuti akusangalala ndi ulendo wake woyamba ku United States ndi maphunziro onse opatsa mphamvu ndi ntchito.

en: She said she hopes to take the lessons she has learned here in workshops back to the Adolescent Girls Initiative clubs in Southern Sudan.
ny: Iye adati akuyembekeza kutenga maphunziro omwe waphunzira kuno m'maofesi kubwerera kumakalabu a Adolescent Girls Initiative ku Southern Sudan.

en: "I learned about how to express yourself. Eye contact. Speak loud," explained Saturnino. "This way can give me really a voice to speak in front of people.
ny: "Ndinaphunzira za mmene ndingafotokozere. Kuyang'ana maso. Lankhulani mokweza," anafotokoza Saturnino. "Njira imeneyi ikhoza kundipatsadi mawu olankhula pamaso pa anthu.

en: And even if I go back home, I'm not longer Sarah again -- I'm somebody now." Somebody who has earned the admiration of a fellow Southern Sudanese citizen, child-soldier-turned-rapper Emmanuel Jal.
ny: Ndipo ngakhale nditabwerera kunyumba, sindilinso Sarah -- ndine munthu tsopano." Wina yemwe wapeza chidwi cha nzika mnzake wa Kumwera kwa Sudan, mwana-msilikali-wotembenuka-rapper Emmanuel Jal.

en: A supporter of the Adolescent Girls Initiative, Jal performed at the World Bank event.
ny: Wothandizira wa Adolescent Girls Initiative, Jal adachita pa chochitika cha World Bank.

en: The girls joined him on stage, beaming as they danced behind him -- as did at least one World Bank official -- while the audience of staffers in business suits took to their feet and raised their hands in the air as well.
ny: Atsikanawo adagwirizana naye pa siteji, akumwetulira pamene akuvina kumbuyo kwake -- monga momwe anachitira mkulu wina wa World Bank -- pamene omvera a ogwira ntchito ovala masuti a bizinesi anaima ndikukweza manja awo mlengalenga.

en: Activists Press for Better Help to End Congo Rapes
ny: Ogwira Ntchito Akukakamiza Kuti Athandizidwe Bwino Kuthetsa Kugwiriridwa ku Congo

en: As U.N. Special Representative for Sexual Violence In Conflict Margot Wallstrom embarks on a new trip to the Democratic Republic of Congo, two activists recently concluded lobbying efforts in the United States for more effective action on trying to end conflict-related rapes in Congo.
ny: Pamene Woimira Wapadera wa UN wa Chiwawa cha Kugonana Mu Nkhondo Margot Wallstrom akuyamba ulendo watsopano wopita ku Democratic Republic of Congo, anthu awiri omwe amagwira ntchito posachedwapa adamaliza zoyesayesa zolimbikitsa ku United States kuti achitepo kanthu bwino poyesa kuthetsa kugwiriridwa kwa nkhondo ku Congo.

en: One of them, Justine Masika Bihamba, told a gathering of Washington, D.C., university students and concerned citizens that the area in which she works, Beni, in North Kivu province, is still overrun by Ugandan rebels who regularly rape women.She said in these situations women are considered victims, and are not implicated in the search for peace.
ny: Mmodzi wa iwo, Justine Masika Bihamba, adauza msonkhano wa ophunzira ku yunivesite ya Washington, D.C., komanso nzika zodera nkhaŵa kuti dera lomwe amagwira ntchito, Beni, m'chigawo cha North Kivu, lidakali lodzaza ndi oukira a ku Uganda omwe nthawi zonse amagwiririra akazi. Iye adati m'mikhalidwe imeneyi azimayi amaonedwa ngati minkhole, ndipo sakukhudzidwa ndi kufunafuna mtendere.

en: Striving for peace in the region
ny: Kuyesetsa kukhala ndi mtendere m'deralo

en: Bihamba coordinates an organization called the Synergy of Women Against Sexual Violence.
ny: Bihamba akugwirizanitsa bungwe lotchedwa Synergy of Women Against Sexual Violence.

en: Counselors with the group have been attacked and threatened because of their work. When Bihamba was at work one day, Congolese soldiers attacked her home, and sexually assaulted one of her daughters.
ny: Aphungu ndi gululi awukiridwa ndikuwopsezedwa chifukwa cha ntchito yawo. Pamene Bihamba anali kuntchito tsiku lina, asilikali a ku Congo anaukira nyumba yake, ndipo anagona mmodzi wa ana ake aakazi.

en: Bihamba explained that what is needed - above all - is peace in eastern Congo.
ny: Bihamba anafotokoza kuti chomwe chikufunika - koposa zonse - ndi mtendere kum'mawa kwa Congo.

en: She said she believes sexual crimes would go down drastically if fighting stopped.
ny: Iye adati akukhulupirira kuti milandu ya kugonana idzatsika kwambiri ngati kumenyana kutha.

en: Activist Donatella Rostagno, from the European network for Central Africa, accompanied Bihamba on her trip to the United States.
ny: Wogwira ntchito Donatella Rostagno, wochokera ku intaneti ya ku Ulaya ku Central Africa, anatsagana ndi Bihamba paulendo wake wopita ku United States.

en: She said she supports the work being done by the U.N. special representative for sexual violence in conflict.
ny: Iye adati akuthandizira ntchito yomwe ikugwiridwa ndi nthumwi yapadera ya U.N. ya chiwawa cha kugonana pa nkhondo.

en: Rostagno also said feels, however, the international community is not doing enough to stop Congo's war, despite having a large U.N. peacekeeping mission there.
ny: Rostagno adanenanso kuti akuona, komabe, anthu apadziko lonse sakuchita zokwanira kuletsa nkhondo ya Congo, ngakhale kuti ali ndi ntchito yaikulu yosungitsa mtendere ya UN kumeneko.

en: "The majority of the actions is made to look at the consequences, to work with the women who are victims, but not enough is done to look at the causes of the rapes and the conflict," said Rostagno.
ny: "Zochita zambiri zimapangidwa kuti ziyang'ane zotsatira zake, kugwira ntchito ndi azimayi omwe akuvutika, koma palibe zokwanira zomwe zimachitika kuti ayang'ane zomwe zimayambitsa kugwiriridwa ndi mkangano," adatero Rostagno.

en: Deteriorating situation amid global concern
ny: Mkhalidwe woipa pakati pa nkhaŵa ya dziko lonse

en: She fears the overall situation in eastern Congo is getting worse, not better - despite the international attention - with rebels, militias, and renegade soldiers still running rampant.
ny: Iye akuwopa kuti mkhalidwe wonse kum'mawa kwa Congo ukuipiraipira, osati bwino - mosasamala kanthu za chidwi cha mayiko - ndi oukira, magulu ankhondo, ndi asilikali opanduka akuthamangabe.

en: "A lot of these rebel groups are getting reorganized, and are even getting in a coalition so the movements that we see in the region, it is worrying us," said Rostagno.
ny: "Magulu ambiri oukira amenewa akukonzedwanso, ndipo akulowera ngakhale mu mgwirizano kotero mayendedwe omwe tikuwona m'deralo, akutidetsa nkhawa," adatero Rostagno.

en: "I think we were more optimistic on this region six months ago than today.
ny: "Ndikuganiza kuti tinali ndi chiyembekezo chachikulu pa dera lino miyezi isanu ndi umodzi yapitayo kuposa lero.

en: "The United Nations has identified three armed groups that gang raped dozens of people about two months ago in a week-long attack in Luvungi, another part of North Kivu province.
ny: "Bungwe la United Nations lazindikira magulu atatu okhala ndi zida omwe gulu linagwirira anthu ambirimbiri pafupifupi miyezi iwiri yapitayo pa nkhondo ya sabata ku Luvungi, mbali ina ya chigawo cha North Kivu.

en: Those implicated are the Mai Mai Cheka, the Democratic Liberation Forces of Rwanda, and followers of an army deserter, Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.
ny: Amene akukhudzidwa ndi Mai Mai Cheka, Democratic Liberation Forces of Rwanda, ndi otsatira a msilikali wothawa, Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.

en: Proposals for improvementDuring their presentation, the two activists, Bihamba and Rostagno, also offered concrete proposals to make the situation better.
ny: Malingaliro owongolera Kupititsa patsogolo ulaliki wawo, otsutsa awiriwa, Bihamba ndi Rostagno, adaperekanso malingaliro a konkire kuti zinthu zikhale bwino.

en: Rostagno explained that foreign non-governmental organizations get funding to tackle the issue of sexual violence, but local organizations often get ignored.
ny: Rostagno anafotokoza kuti mabungwe akunja omwe si aboma amapeza ndalama zothetsera nkhani ya chiwawa cha kugonana, koma mabungwe am'deralo nthawi zambiri amanyalanyazidwa.

en: She said complex applications to get outside funding favor bigger organizations.
ny: Iye anati ntchito zovuta kupeza kunja ndalama kukonda mabungwe akuluakulu.

en: "They can just do it, they send it, they receive the money.
ny: "Iwo akhoza kungochita izo, iwo kutumiza izo, iwo kulandira ndalama.

en: The problem is that the money in most cases is spent to pay for the fixed cost of the organization, for the salaries of expat people coming to the region and to the country, while the local non-governmental organizations, those working with the communities, with the women, with the children, in the villages, those who need need money to survive in order to do their work do not have access," said Rostagno.Bihamba said Congolese soldiers should be paid directly through bank withdrawals, rather than being paid through their superiors.
ny: Vuto ndiloti ndalamazo nthawi zambiri zimagwiritsidwa ntchito kulipira mtengo wokhazikika wa bungwe, malipiro a anthu a expat obwera m'deralo komanso mdziko muno, pomwe mabungwe omwe si aboma a m'deralo, omwe amagwira ntchito ndi madera, ndi azimayi, ndi ana, m'midzi, omwe akufuna ndalama kuti apulumuke kuti agwire ntchito yawo alibe mwayi, " adatero Rostagno.Bihamba adati asilikali a ku Congo ayenera kulipidwa mwachindunji kudzera mu kuchotsa mabanki, m'malo molipiridwa kudzera mwa akuluakulu awo.

en: Bihamba said with the current system they receive only about a third of their salary, which causes some soldiers to loot and rape.
ny: Bihamba adati ndi dongosolo lomwe lilipo lino amalandira pafupifupi gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu a malipiro awo, zomwe zimapangitsa asilikali ena kufunkha ndi kugwirira chigololo.

en: She also called for an international tribunal for the Congo to help end general impunity, as well as more local tribunals for raped victims to seek justice. In North Kivu, where more than 5 million people are estimated to live, she said there are only three tribunals.
ny: Iye anapemphanso kuti khoti lapadziko lonse la ku Congo lithandizire kuthetsa kupanda chilango kwa anthu onse, komanso makhoti ambiri a m'deralo kuti anthu ogwiriridwa chigololo afunefune chilungamo. Ku North Kivu, komwe anthu oposa 5 miliyoni akuti amakhala, adati pali makhoti atatu okha.

en: Desmond Tutu Retires From Public Life
ny: Desmond Tutu Akupuma pa Moyo wa Anthu

en: Desmond Tutu fought apartheid in South Africa, and was critical of the war in Iraq.
ny: Desmond Tutu anamenya nkhondo ya tsankho ku South Africa, ndipo anali wotsutsa nkhondo ku Iraq.

en: "We waged a war that shouldn't have happened," he said.He also spoke out against genocide in Rwanda.
ny: "Tinamenya nkhondo yomwe siyenera kuchitika," adatero. Iye analankhulanso motsutsana ndi kupululutsa fuko ku Rwanda.

en: "God have mercy on us," he said.The retired Anglican archbishop announced in July that he would retire from public life on his birthday."The time has come to slow down, and sip maybe rooibos tea with my beloved wife in the afternoons" he said.
ny: "Mulungu atichitire chifundo," iye anatero. Bishopu wamkulu wa Anglican amene anapuma pantchito analengeza mu July kuti adzapuma pantchito ya anthu pa tsiku lake lobadwa." Nthawi yafika yochepetsera pang'onopang'ono, ndikumwa mwina tiyi wa rooibos ndi mkazi wanga wokondedwa masana" adatero.

en: Tutu rose through the ranks of the Anglican church in South Africa to become the first black Anglican archbishop of Capetown.
ny: Tutu anakwera kudzera m'magulu a tchalitchi cha Anglican ku South Africa kukhala bishopu wakuda woyamba wa Anglican wa Capetown.

en: He was a vocal critic of South Africa's white-ruled government and encouraged non-violence to end apartheid. Tutu was the recipient of many awards, and in 1984, he received a Nobel Peace Prize for advocating "a democratic and just society without racial divisions.
ny: Iye anali wotsutsa kwambiri boma lolamulidwa ndi azungu ku South Africa ndipo analimbikitsa kupanda chiwawa kuti athetse tsankho. Tutu anali wolandira mphoto zambiri, ndipo mu 1984, analandira mphoto ya Nobel Peace Prize chifukwa cholimbikitsa "chitaganya cha demokalase ndi cholungama chopanda magaŵano a mafuko.

en: " He used the recognition to step up the anti-apartheid campaign, calling for an economic boycott against South Africa. After the end of apartheid, Tutu called it an incredible day when Nelson Mandela won South Africa's first all-race elections.
ny: " Iye anagwiritsa ntchito kuzindikira kuti apititse patsogolo ntchito yolimbana ndi tsankho, akuitanira kuti chuma cha boycott motsutsana ndi South Africa. Pambuyo pa kutha kwa tsankho, Tutu adaitcha tsiku lodabwitsa pamene Nelson Mandela adapambana chisankho choyamba cha mpikisano wonse ku South Africa.

en: "I would say the highest point for me was when I stood on the balcony in 1994 to introduce our new, brand new president to South Africa and the world," he said.
ny: "Ndinganene kuti mfundo yapamwamba kwambiri kwa ine inali pamene ndinaima pabalaza mu 1994 kuti ndiyambitse pulezidenti wathu watsopano, watsopano ku South Africa ndi dziko lonse," adatero.

en: To help mend the nation, President Mandela appointed Tutu as head of the country's Truth and Reconciliation Commission. The group issued a report that included numerous confessions of guilt under apartheid in return for amnesty.
ny: Pofuna kuthandiza kukonza mtunduwu, Pulezidenti Mandela anasankha Tutu kukhala mkulu wa bungwe la Truth and Reconciliation Commission mdziko muno. Gululo linatulutsa lipoti limene linaphatikizapo kuvomereza liwongo kochuluka pansi pa tsankho pofuna kukhululukidwa.

en: "It makes specific proposals on how we can cultivate a culture of human rights and of structures to insure that the atrocities of the past will not reoccur," Tutu said.Tutu also campaigned to fight poverty and AIDS.
ny: "Imapanga malingaliro enieni a momwe tingakulitsire chikhalidwe cha ufulu wachibadwidwe komanso zomangamanga kuti atsimikizire kuti nkhanza zakale sizidzachitikanso," adatero Tutu. Tutu nayenso anayamba kulimbana ndi umphawi ndi AIDS.

en: In recent years, he expressed his disappointment in post-apartheid South Africa, especially the level of violent crime.
ny: M'zaka zaposachedwapa, adasonyeza kukhumudwa kwake pambuyo pa tsankho la South Africa, makamaka mlingo wa upandu wachiwawa.

en: Despite his withdrawal from public life, Tutu says he will continue to support his peace foundation and will remain part of a group of elder statesmen who campaign for peace and human rights.
ny: Ngakhale kuti adachoka pa moyo wa anthu, Tutu akuti adzapitilizabe kuthandiza maziko ake a mtendere ndipo adzakhalabe m'gulu la akuluakulu a boma omwe akulimbikitsa mtendere ndi ufulu wa anthu.

en: But Tutu says he will no longer give interviews and, as he put it, will mostly "shut up."
ny: Koma Tutu akuti sadzaperekanso mafunso ndipo, monga momwe ananenera, makamaka "adzatseka."

en: "I have been part of our struggle for freedom and democracy, and I am part of the celebration that we did succeed," he said. "I have been part of the post apartheid dispensation and long for us to do infinitely better."Many say his voice will be missed.
ny: "Ndakhala mbali ya nkhondo yathu yomenyera ufulu ndi demokalase, ndipo ndine mbali ya chikondwerero chomwe tinachita bwino," adatero. "Ndakhala mbali ya post apartheid dispensation ndipo ndikulakalaka kuti tichite bwino kwambiri." Ambiri amati mawu ake adzasowa.

en: Malawi's Jacaranda School for Orphans Celebrates Christmas
ny: Sukulu ya Jacaranda ya ku Malawi ya Ana Amasiye Imakondwerera Khirisimasi

en: The management for the Jacaranda School for Orphans in Malawis commercial capital Blantyre recently hosted a party for its students as it closed for Christmas and New Years Day holidays.
ny: Oyang'anira sukulu ya Jacaranda School for Orphans ku Malawis commercial capital Blantyre posachedwapa adachita phwando kwa ophunzira ake pamene adatseka maholide a Tsiku la Khirisimasi ndi Zaka Zatsopano.

en: Around 500 people including students, staff members and others from surrounding areas attended the event, which was held at the schools premises in Chigumula area.
ny: Pafupifupi anthu 500 kuphatikizapo ophunzira, ogwira ntchito ndi ena ochokera m'madera ozungulira adapezeka pa mwambowu, womwe unachitikira pamalo a sukulu m'dera la Chigumula.

en: The party included gifts, Santa Claus, and a "dancing show case" by the students.
ny: Phwandolo linaphatikizapo mphatso, Santa Claus, ndi "nkhani yowonetsera kuvina" ndi ophunzira.

en: The school management told VOA that the yearly celebration has been a school tradition for the past 13years.
ny: Oyang'anira sukuluyi adauza VOA kuti chikondwerero cha pachaka chakhala mwambo wa sukulu kwa zaka 13 zapitazi.

en: The school's director, Luc Deschamps, said: "[We feel] it is very important for us to celebrate Christmas because the children do not have parents.
ny: Mkulu wa sukuluyi, Luc Deschamps, anati: "[Tikuona] n'kofunika kwambiri kuti tizikondwerera Khirisimasi chifukwa anawo alibe makolo.

en: They stay with either a grandmother or a distant aunt or uncle, and they are not able to cerebrate at home or have a party or a little bit of sweets and cake for the children. So, we provide a happy day for the children to celebrate the spirit of Christmas. And it is also a way of our children to learn to give."
ny: Iwo amakhala ndi agogo aakazi kapena azakhali akutali kapena amalume, ndipo sangathe ubongo kunyumba kapena kuchita phwando kapena pang'ono maswiti ndi keke kwa ana. Choncho, timapereka tsiku losangalatsa kwa ana kuti azikondwerera mzimu wa Khirisimasi. Ndiponso ndi njira imene ana athu angaphunzire kupereka."

en: No media source currently available
ny: Palibe gwero la media lomwe lilipo panopa

en: Deschamps, who is also an Honorary Consul of France in Malawi, said before the main event the patrons were treated to "a nice meal" from the students.
ny: Deschamps, yemwenso ndi Honorary Consul wa ku France ku Malawi, adati chochitika chachikulu chisanachitike othandizirawo adachitiridwa "chakudya chabwino" kuchokera kwa ophunzira.

en: "We had a big, big lunch with good meat and rice,[the dish made from maize flour called] nsima, of course, and vegetables. And it was the students themselves who cooked the meal for everybody, for over 500 people," he said.
ny: "Tinaphika chakudya chamasana chachikulu, chachikulu ndi nyama yabwino ndi mpunga,[chakudya chopangidwa ndi ufa wa chimanga chotchedwa] nsima, ndithudi, ndi ndiwo zamasamba. Ndipo anali ophunzira enieniwo amene anaphikira aliyense chakudya, kwa anthu oposa 500," adatero.

en: One of the students, Eddah Zimba, said, "The celebrations are really cool, ... I have enjoyed myself. I have eaten, and now I am here dancing. What has interested me most is the gift that we have received the like the puffs, the biscuits, the squash and the dance."
ny: Mmodzi mwa ophunzirawo, Eddah Zimba, adati, "Zikondwerero ndizozizira kwambiri, ... Ndasangalala kwambiri. Ndadya, ndipo tsopano ndili pano ndikuvina. Chomwe chandisangalatsa kwambiri ndi mphatso imene talandira yofanana ndi puffs, mabisiketi, squash ndi kuvina."

en: She thanked the schools management for hosting the Christmas party for students who in most cases do not have such celebrations at home.
ny: Iye anayamikira oyang'anira masukulu chifukwa chochititsa phwando la Khirisimasi kwa ophunzira omwe nthawi zambiri alibe zikondwerero zoterezi kunyumba.

en: Another student Emmanuel Chisale said good meal aside, the event has taught him the spirit of sharing.
ny: Wophunzira wina Emmanuel Chisale adati chakudya chabwino pambali, chochitikacho chamuphunzitsa mzimu wogawana.

en: "This party has brought a change in my life. I have learned that we have to have a heart for sharing one another as the Father Christmas was doing," he said.
ny: "Chipani ichi chabweretsa kusintha kwa moyo wanga. Ndaphunzira kuti tiyenera kukhala ndi mtima wogawana wina ndi mnzake monga momwe Atate Khirisimasi anali kuchitira," adatero.

en: Founded in 2002, the Jacaranda School for Orphans is the only one in Malawi which provides free primary, secondary and tertiary education to children without parents.
ny: Yakhazikitsidwa mu 2002, sukulu ya Jacaranda ya Orphans ndi yokhayo ku Malawi yomwe imapereka maphunziro aulere a pulayimale, sekondale ndi maphunziro apamwamba kwa ana opanda makolo.

en: A Malawian woman, Marie Da Silva, started the school after she returned from the United States where she spent nineteen years working as a nanny.
ny: Mayi wina wa ku Malawi, Marie Da Silva, anayamba sukuluyi atabwerera kuchokera ku United States komwe anakhala zaka khumi ndi zisanu ndi zinayi akugwira ntchito ngati nanny.

en: Economists Predict Bumpy Road for Malawi's Economy in 2015
ny: Akatswiri Azachuma Akulosera Msewu Wovuta wa Chuma cha Malawi mu 2015

en: Economists in Malawi say the country is likely to continue facing financial challenges in 2015 unless the government can regain the confidence of donors, who are still withholding 40 percent of budgetary support due to the corruption scandal known as Cashgate. More than $30 million were looted from government coffers in the scandal, and several people, including government officials, were arrested.
ny: Akatswiri azachuma ku Malawi ati dziko lino likuoneka kuti lingapitirize kukumana ndi mavuto azachuma mu 2015 pokhapokha boma litapezanso chidaliro cha othandizira, omwe akukanabe 40 peresenti ya chithandizo cha bajeti chifukwa cha chinyengo chomwe chimadziwika kuti Cashgate. Ndalama zoposa madola 30 miliyoni zinafunkhidwa m'bokosi la boma pa nkhaniyi, ndipo anthu angapo, kuphatikizapo akuluakulu a boma, anamangidwa.

en: The withholding of donor aid has forced Malawi's government to pass what is known as the Zero Aid national budget for the 2014-2015 fiscal year. Analysts, such as Abel Mwanyungwe, an economics lecturer at the Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, say the drop in spending has hurt the economy.
ny: Kusapereka chithandizo kwa othandizira kwakakamiza boma la Malawi kuti lipereke bajeti yomwe imadziwika kuti Zero Aid ya chaka cha zachuma cha 2014-2015. Ofufuza, monga Abel Mwanyungwe, mphunzitsi wa zachuma pa Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, ati kutsika kwa ndalama zowonongedwa kwavulaza chuma.

en: "This has been a bumpy year as we are coming from the Cashgate effects that have quite a major dent on the economys performance. We have seen that in most cases the very delicate and crucial departments and service providers have been affected, in the sense that we dont have enough drugs in the hospitals. In schools, in terms of teachers payments is not in time," said Mwanyungwe.
ny: "Ichi chakhala chaka chovuta pamene tikuchokera ku zotsatira za Cashgate zomwe zili ndi dent yaikulu ndithu pa ntchito ya chuma. Tawona kuti nthawi zambiri madipatimenti ovuta kwambiri komanso ofunika kwambiri komanso othandizira ntchito akhudzidwa, m'lingaliro lakuti tilibe mankhwala okwanira m'zipatala. M'masukulu, pankhani ya malipiro a aphunzitsi si nthawi," adatero Mwanyungwe.

en: Mwanyungwe also links Cashgate to the recent depreciation of Malawis currency, the kwacha, which has resulted in strikes by various government workers demanding higher pay.
ny: Mwanyungwe akugwirizananso ndi Cashgate ndi kutsika mtengo kwa ndalama za Malawis posachedwapa, kwacha, zomwe zachititsa kuti antchito osiyanasiyana a boma azigwira ntchito pofuna malipiro apamwamba.

en: For example, support staff for the judiciary have been on strike for six weeks, seeking a 45 percent pay increase which the government says it cannot afford because it has no money.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, ogwira ntchito zothandizira oweruza akhala akugwira ntchito kwa milungu isanu ndi umodzi, akufuna kuti malipiro awo awonjezeke ndi 45 peresenti omwe boma likuti sangakwanitse chifukwa alibe ndalama.

en: Workers at Malawi's Anti-Corruption Bureau went on strike demanding a 70 percent pay raise until the government threatened to forfeit their December salaries if they did not return.
ny: Ogwira ntchito ku bungwe la Anti-Corruption Bureau ku Malawi anayamba kugwira ntchito pofuna kuti malipiro awo akwezedwe ndi 70 peresenti mpaka boma litaopseza kuti lidzataya malipiro awo a mwezi wa December ngati sakubwerera.

en: Mwanyungwe said the government can only avoid further strikes in 2015 if it makes efforts to restore donor confidence in the management of its public finances.
ny: Mwanyungwe adati boma lingapewe kugwira ntchito kwina mu 2015 pokhapokha litayesetsa kubwezeretsa chidaliro cha othandizira pa kayendetsedwe ka ndalama zake za boma.

en: "My fear is that if we dont have this donor confidence and donor support coming back to the economy, we may force the government to go into serious local borrowing that would lead to serious repercussions in terms of inflation, in terms of interest rates and this may have a sort of catch-catch lose situation," said Mwanyungwe.
ny: "Mantha anga ndi akuti ngati tilibe chidaliro cha donor chimenechi komanso chithandizo cha othandizira kubwerera ku chuma, tikhoza kukakamiza boma kuti lipite ku ngongole yaikulu ya m'deralo zomwe zingayambitse zotsatira zoopsa pankhani ya kukwera kwa mitengo, malinga ndi chiwongoladzanja ndipo izi zingakhale ndi mtundu wina wa kugwira-kugwira kutaya mkhalidwe," adatero Mwanyungwe.

en: The donors are, among other things, demanding that the government prosecute all those involved in the scandal and strengthen its financial management system.
ny: Othandizirawo, pakati pa zinthu zina, akufuna kuti boma lizenge mlandu onse omwe akukhudzidwa ndi chipongwe ndi kulimbikitsa dongosolo lake loyang'anira ndalama.

en: Newton Kambala, the president of the Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, said the scandal rendered 2014 as "a very bad year for the business sector, because of huge debts that the government owes the private sector."
ny: Newton Kambala, yemwe ndi mtsogoleri wa bungwe la Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Viwanda, adati chipongwechi chinapangitsa kuti chaka cha 2014 chikhale "chaka choipa kwambiri kwa anthu ogwira ntchito zamalonda, chifukwa cha ngongole zazikulu zomwe boma lili nazo kwa anthu apadera."

en: He warned that if the situation persists, "2015 will be worse."
ny: Iye anachenjeza kuti ngati zinthu zikupitirira, "2015 idzaipa kwambiri."

en: In his state of the nation address last Saturday, Malawi president Peter Mutharika said his government is doing everything possible to address the problems caused by the Cashgate scandal.
ny: M'mawu ake a m'dziko muno Loweruka lapitalo, mtsogoleri wa dziko la Malawi Peter Mutharika adati boma lake likuchita zonse zotheka kuti lithetse mavuto omwe amachititsidwa ndi nkhani ya Cashgate.

en: "My government has strengthened the financial system to make sure that Cashgate never occurs again in Malawi. We have resourced fairly well the law enforcement institutions, including the Anti-Corruption Bureau, so that they do a thorough independent job, prosecute all suspects, and recover the stolen resources where possible," said Mutharika.
ny: "Boma langa lalimbitsa dongosolo la zachuma kuonetsetsa kuti Cashgate isachitikenso ku Malawi. Ife resourced mwachilungamo bwino mabungwe oteteza malamulo, kuphatikizapo Anti-Corruption Bureau, kotero kuti iwo agwire ntchito mwatsatanetsatane palokha, kuzenga mlandu onse omwe akukayikira, ndi kubwezeretsa chuma chobedwacho kumene kuli kotheka," adatero Mutharika.

en: Mutharika also said his government is implementing newly-adopted fiscal reforms that seek to grow the countrys economy by 5.5 percent in 2014, up from an estimated 5.0 percent in 2013.
ny: A Mutharika adanenanso kuti boma lake likugwiritsa ntchito zosintha zachuma zomwe zakhazikitsidwa kumene zomwe zikufuna kukulitsa chuma cha dziko ndi 5.5 peresenti mu 2014, kuchokera pa 5.0 peresenti mu 2013.

en: Malawi to Conduct Door-to-Door HIV Testing
ny: Malawi Idzachititsa Kuyezetsa HIV Khomo ndi Khomo

en: Malawians have mixed reactions to government plans to introduce door-to door HIV testing early next year. Supporters say the step is urgently needed because 100 Malawians get infected each day, and an average of 138 die from AIDS daily. Minister of Health Jean Kalirani announced the plans during the recent commemoration of World AIDS Day in the northern district of Karonga.
ny: A Malawi ali ndi zochita zosiyanasiyana pa zolinga za boma zoyambitsa kuyezetsa HIV khomo ndi khomo kumayambiriro kwa chaka chamawa. Othandizira akuti sitepeyi ikufunika mwachangu chifukwa a Malawi 100 amayambukiridwa tsiku lililonse, ndipo avareji ya 138 amafa ndi AIDS tsiku lililonse. Nduna ya Zaumoyo Jean Kalirani adalengeza mapulani pa chikumbutso chaposachedwa cha Tsiku la AIDS Padziko Lonse m'chigawo chakumpoto cha Karonga.

en: "We will go in the villages asking for blood samples to check whether that person is HIV positive or not. And those that will be found HIV positive will definitely be given the care they need. And those who are found negative will also be counseled so that they remain negative," said Kalirani.
ny: "Tidzapita m'midzi kukapempha zitsanzo za magazi kuti tione ngati munthuyo ali ndi HIV kapena ayi. Ndipo awo amene adzapezedwa ndi HIV adzapatsidwadi chisamaliro chimene akufunikira. Ndipo amene adzapezeke negative adzalangizidwanso kuti akhalebe negative," adatero Kalirani.

en: Kalirani said the campaign will start in mid-March and will aim to reach everyone in the country, including people who are far from health facilities that provide HIV testing and counseling services. She said the campaign is in line with the goal of ending HIV infection by 2030. Malawi's HIV infection rate is currently at 10 percent, a slight drop from three years ago.
ny: Kalirani adati kampeniyi idzayamba pakati pa mwezi wa Marichi ndipo idzayesetsa kufikira aliyense mdziko muno, kuphatikizapo anthu omwe ali kutali ndi malo azaumoyo omwe amapereka ntchito zoyezera NDI kupereka uphungu kwa HIV. Iye adati kampeniyi ikugwirizana ndi cholinga chothetsa matenda a HIV pofika 2030. Chiwerengero cha anthu odwala HIV ku Malawi pakali pano chili pa 10 peresenti, kutsika pang'ono kuchokera pa zaka zitatu zapitazo.

en: The announcement has raised fears in some Malawians, such as Steven Jailosi, a primary school teacher in rural Blantyre, who feel the campaign will likely infringe upon peoples privacy.
ny: Chilengezochi chadzutsa mantha mwa a Malawi ena, monga Steven Jailosi, mphunzitsi wa sukulu ya pulaimale m'midzi ya Blantyre, omwe akuona kuti kampeniyi ikhoza kuphwanya chinsinsi cha anthu.

en: "I think it is not okay because they will be invading our privacy. HIV testing is supposed to be private. No one is supposed to know that I went for an HIV testing unless I make a choice to tell them," said Jailosi.
ny: "Ndikuganiza kuti sizabwino chifukwa adzakhala akulowerera zachinsinsi chathu. Kuyezetsa HIV kumayenera kukhala kwachinsinsi. Palibe amene akuyenera kudziwa kuti ndinapita kukayezetsa HIV pokhapokha nditasankha kuwauza," adatero Jailosi.

en: Ester Makonokaya, a secretary in Blantyre, said that although she has been tested already, she feels the door-to-door HIV testing will violate people's privacy.
ny: Mlembi wa bungwe la Ester Makonokaya, ku Blantyre, adati ngakhale kuti wayesedwa kale, akuona kuti kuyezetsa HIV khomo ndi khomo kudzaphwanya chinsinsi cha anthu.

en: "Government should instead take the mobile clinics to the villages where people will be able to access them on their own rather than taking testing in their homes, because that might mean that some of the people who are not supposed to know other peoples status will know because, you know, when someone has been tested you show some reactions," said Makonokaya.
ny: "Boma m'malo mwake liyenera kutenga zipatala zoyendera kumidzi komwe anthu adzatha kuzipeza pawokha m'malo motenga mayeso m'nyumba zawo, chifukwa zimenezo zingakhale zikutanthauza kuti ena mwa anthu omwe sakuyenera kudziwa anthu ena udindo adzadziwa chifukwa, mukudziwa, pamene wina wayesedwa mumasonyeza zochita zina, " anatero Makonokaya.

en: Macpherson Maulana, a journalist in Blantyre and a producer of radio programs on health, told VOA that government would do better to educate Malawians on the need for HIV testing so that people will go for tests on their own "without being pushed."
ny: Macpherson Maulana, yemwe ndi mtolankhani ku Blantyre komanso wopanga mapulogalamu a pa wailesi pa zaumoyo, anauza VOA kuti boma lingachite bwino kuphunzitsa a Malawi za kufunika koyezedwa ndi HIV kuti anthu apite kukayezetsa paokha "popanda kukankhidwa."

en: "I fear it could end up into fights. You see it happened in Liberia recently where people who were coming to help people suspected to have contracted Ebola were even killed. So, civic education is the most important element for people to be encouraged to come out for testing voluntarily," said Maulana.
ny: "Ndikuopa kuti zikhoza kutha kukhala ndewu. Mukuona kuti zinachitika ku Liberia posachedwapa kumene anthu amene anali kubwera kudzathandiza anthu amene akuganiza kuti anadwala Ebola anaphedwa n'komwe. Choncho, maphunziro a anthu ndi chinthu chofunika kwambiri kuti anthu azilimbikitsidwa kutuluka kukayezetsa mwaufulu," adatero Maulana.

en: However, HIV/AIDS counselor David Odali, whose NGO Umunthu Foundation runs HIV-related projects, insisted privacy will be protected.
ny: Komabe, mlangizi wa HIV /AIDS David Odali, yemwe bungwe lake la NGO Umunthu Foundation limayendetsa ntchito zokhudzana ndi HIV, adaumirira kuti chinsinsi chidzatetezedwa.

en: "Confidentiality will be upheld. Lets consider the household setup. I think the first thing would be to provide group counseling to members of that family. [Of course] people can be tested while others are watching, but when it comes to disclosing the results, a counselor is supposed to disclose that results to each and every individual separately," said Odali.
ny: "Chinsinsi chidzachirikizidwa. Tiyeni tilingalire za kukhazikitsidwa kwa nyumba. Ndikuganiza kuti chinthu choyamba chikakhala kupereka uphungu wa gulu kwa anthu a m'banja limenelo. [Ndithudi] anthu akhoza kuyesedwa pamene ena akuyang'ana, koma pankhani yowulula zotsatira zake, phungu akuyenera kuulula zotsatira zimenezo kwa munthu aliyense payekha," adatero Odali.

en: Odali said it will be up to the person who has been tested to disclose his or her status.
ny: Odali adati zidzakhala kwa munthu yemwe wayesedwa kuti awulule udindo wake.

en: In 2006, the charity Development Aid from People to People conducted door-to-door HIV testing in the district of Thyolo and Blantyre, reaching 400,000 people. The organization says it worked well.
ny: M'chaka cha 2006, bungwe la Development Aid from People to People linachita mayeso a HIV khomo ndi khomo m'chigawo cha Thyolo ndi Blantyre, ndipo linafikira anthu 400,000. Bungweli likuti linagwira bwino ntchito.

en: Water Crisis Raises Fears of Waterborne Disease in Malawi
ny: Vuto la Madzi Ladzutsa Mantha a Matenda a M'madzi ku Malawi

en: Malawians in the country's commercial capital, Blantyre, usually rely on tap water. But for the past five months, the taps have often run dry, forcing residents to draw water from unprotected sources like rivers and wells, while work is being done at the city main pumping station.The risk of contracting water-borne diseases is rising.
ny: A Malawi ku likulu la zamalonda mdziko muno, Blantyre, nthawi zambiri amadalira madzi a m'mipope. Koma kwa miyezi isanu yapitayi, mipopeyi nthawi zambiri imakhala youma, zomwe zachititsa kuti anthu azitunga madzi kuchokera kuzinthu zopanda chitetezo monga mitsinje ndi zitsime, pamene ntchito ikuchitika pa malo akuluakulu opopa mumzindawu. Chiopsezo chotenga matenda opatsirana ndi madzi chikukwera.

en: In Blantyre and surrounding areas, residents have spent five days without tap water.
ny: Ku Blantyre ndi m'madera ozungulira, anthu akhala masiku asanu opanda madzi a m'mipope.

en: Women, who by Malawi tradition are responsible for household tasks, complain of the risks they face when fetching water from rivers far from residential areas.
ny: Azimayi, omwe mwa mwambo wa Malawi ndi amene amagwira ntchito zapakhomo, amadandaula za mavuto amene amakumana nawo potunga madzi m'mitsinje kutali ndi malo okhala.

en: Rhoda Milanzi, a housewife and mother of three, tells VOA the journeys through bushy footpaths are risky. "We wake up every day 2 a.m., sometimes 1 a.m., to go and collect water. There are so many risks. You see, sometimes we would meet witches, snakes on the way," she says, "even hyenas have been chasing us."
ny: Rhoda Milanzi, mkazi wa panyumba komanso mayi wa ana atatu, akuuza VOA kuti maulendo odutsa m'njira za bushy footpaths ndi oopsa. "Timadzuka tsiku lililonse 2 koloko m'mawa, nthawi zina 1 koloko m'mawa, kupita kukatenga madzi. Pali zoopsa zambiri. Mukuona, nthawi zina tinkakumana ndi mfiti, njoka panjira," iye akutero, "ngakhale afisi akhala akutithamangitsa."

en: Milanzi says to ease the burden of carrying water home for bathing, women prefer to bathe in the river. But she says they have been disturbed by youths who hide in the nearby bush.
ny: Milanzi akuti pofuna kuchepetsa mtolo wonyamula madzi kunyumba kukasamba, azimayi amakonda kusamba mumtsinje. Koma iye akuti asokonezeka maganizo ndi achinyamata omwe amabisala m'tchire lapafupi.

en: "These youths of today would come there and hide somewhere to see us naked. This has been a major embarrassment. In fact we complained to the chiefs about it.
ny: "Achinyamata amenewa a masiku ano ankabwera kumeneko n'kukabisala kwinakwake kudzationa ali maliseche. Izi zakhala zochititsa manyazi kwambiri. Ndipotu tinadandaula kwa mafumu za izo.

en: They punished some of them, but you know they would sometimes climb trees just to look at older women like us taking a bath," she explains.
ny: Analanga ena mwa iwo, koma mukudziwa kuti nthawi zina ankakwera mitengo kungoyang'ana azimayi achikulire ngati ife kusamba," akufotokoza motero.

en: The water problem also has affected the delivery of health services.
ny: Vuto la madzi lakhudzanso kuperekedwa kwa ntchito zaumoyo.

en: Three weeks ago, authorities at Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital in Blantyre confirmed that they had suspended surgical operations due to water scarcity.
ny: Masabata atatu apitawo, akuluakulu a chipatala cha Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital ku Blantyre anatsimikizira kuti aimitsa opaleshoni chifukwa cha kusowa kwa madzi.

en: Health rights campaigners warn of the possible outbreak of waterborne diseases, especially in densely populated areas, if the situation is left unresolved.
ny: Anthu omenyera ufulu wa zaumoyo akuchenjeza za kubuka kwa matenda oyambitsidwa ndi madzi, makamaka m'madera okhala anthu ambiri, ngati mkhalidwewo usiyidwa wosathetsedwa.

en: Officials at the Blantyre Water Board attribute the problem largely to an ongoing European Union-funded project that seeks to install new pumping machines at Walkers Ferry, the main pumping station.  Priscilla Mateyu, the spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, says the project is expected to increase water production capacity to 105,000 cubic meters per day from the current daily production of 78,000 cubic meters.
ny: Akuluakulu a bungwe la Blantyre Water Board akuti vutoli kwakukulukulu ndi ntchito yomwe ikuchitika yoperekedwa ndi European Union yomwe ikufuna kukhazikitsa makina atsopano opopa ku Walkers Ferry, malo akuluakulu opopa.  Priscilla Mateyu, yemwe ndi mneneri wa bungwe la Blantyre Water Board, akuti ntchitoyi ikuyembekezeka kuwonjezera mphamvu yopanga madzi kufika pa 105,000 cubic mita patsiku kuchokera pa kupanga kwa tsiku ndi tsiku kwa 78,000 cubic mita.

en: "January is when the project is finishing. But for the new machines and everything else to start working properly, we have to wait until March [2015]. That's when we expect the levels would increase and also production capacity improving to least what we expect it to be," Mateyu said.
ny: "January ndi pamene ntchitoyi ikumaliza. Koma kuti makina atsopano ndi zina zonse ziyambe kugwira ntchito bwino, tiyenera kudikira mpaka March [2015]. Ndi pamene tikuyembekezera kuti milingo idzawonjezeka komanso mphamvu yopanga ikuwongolera pang'ono zomwe tikuyembekezera kuti zikhale," adatero Mateyu.

en: The local consumer rights watchdog, the Consumers Association of Malawi, had been planning to hold vigils at the water board until the water supply was normalized, but the board asked protesters to hold off, promising to distribute water to residents through mobile water tanks.  The consumer rights group has given the water board two weeks to fulfill its commitment before proceeding with the protests.
ny: Bungwe loyang'anira ufulu wa ogula m'deralo, la Consumers Association of Malawi, lakhala likukonzekera kuyang'anira bungwe loyang'anira madzi mpaka madzi atakhala abwinobwino, koma bungwelo linapempha anthu otsutsa kuti aimitse, akulonjeza kugawira madzi kwa nzika kudzera m'matanki a madzi oyenda.  Gulu loona za ufulu wa ogula lapatsa bungwe la madzi masabata awiri kuti likwaniritse kudzipereka kwake lisanapitirize ndi zionetsero.

en: Malawi President Under Fire for Giving Money to Journalists
ny: Pulezidenti wa Malawi Akuwomberedwa Chifukwa Chopereka Ndalama kwa Atolankhani

en: Malawi President Peter Mutharika is under fire for giving envelopes containing $125 to more than 80 media people at a dinner he hosted last month in Blantyre. The editor of the privately owned Times Television said reporters were told the envelopes contained the presidents plans for the media - which has been critical of the governments economic performance.
ny: Mtsogoleri wa dziko la Malawi Peter Mutharika akuwomberedwa chifukwa chopereka maenvulopu okhala ndi $125 kwa anthu oposa 80 ofalitsa nkhani pa chakudya chamadzulo chomwe anachititsa mwezi watha ku Blantyre. Mkonzi wa Times Television yomwe ili payekha adati atolankhani adauzidwa kuti maenvulopuwo ali ndi mapulani a mapulezidenti a atolankhani - omwe akhala akutsutsa ntchito zachuma za maboma.

en: In his column published in Malawis Sunday Times newspaper, editor Grecian Tukula said he was not sure why the money was given to journalists at the state dinner.
ny: M'danga lake lofalitsidwa m'nyuzipepala ya Malawis Sunday Times, mkonzi Grecian Tukula adati sakutsimikiza chifukwa chake ndalamazo zinaperekedwa kwa atolankhani pa chakudya chamadzulo cha boma.

en: Tukula said he initially decided to return the money but reversed the decision to avoid "creating a scene."
ny: Tukula adati poyamba adaganiza zobwezera ndalamazo koma adasintha chisankho chopewa "kupanga malo."

en: But the editor for the Weekend Nation newspaper, George Kasakula, told VOA that he returned the money right away.
ny: Koma mkonzi wa nyuzipepala ya Weekend Nation, George Kasakula, adauza VOA kuti adabweza ndalamazo pomwepo.

en: "I just felt it was not right for me to receive the money, so I returned it. My understanding is that if someone invites me to a workshop, its their duty to ensure that they feed me, they accommodate me and they transport me. But in this case, I didnt see why I should get that allowance because I didnt spend anything to go to Sanjika [Palace]," said Kasakula.
ny: "Ndinkangoona kuti si bwino kuti ndilandire ndalamazo, choncho ndinazibweza. Kumvetsetsa kwanga ndikuti ngati wina andiitana ku malo ogwirira ntchito, ntchito yake yotsimikizira kuti andidyetsa, amandilandira ndipo amandinyamula. Koma pankhaniyi, sindinaone chifukwa chake ndiyenera kupeza allowance imeneyo chifukwa sindinawononge chilichonse chopita ku Sanjika [Palace]," adatero Kasakula.

en: The issue has attracted more public attention after privately owned Capital Radio aired a story questioning the meaning of the cash handouts from the president.
ny: Nkhaniyi yachititsa chidwi anthu ambiri pambuyo poti Capital Radio yomwe ili payekha idaulutsa nkhani yokayikira tanthauzo la ndalama zoperekedwa ndi pulezidenti.

en: "As Capital FM we serve the interest of the public. This issue has been all over the social media, and even we as a media are implicated [we believe] it is paramount that we follow up and get to the bottom of the matter," said Steven Dakalira, the head of news and current affairs at Capital Radio.
ny: "Monga Capital FM timatumikira chidwi cha anthu. Nkhaniyi yakhala yonse pa intaneti, ndipo ngakhale ife monga atolankhani tikukhudzidwa [timakhulupirira] ndizofunika kwambiri kuti titsatire ndikafika pansi pa nkhaniyi," adatero Steven Dakalira, mkulu wa nkhani ndi zochitika zamakono ku Capital Radio.

en: In his column in the Nyasa Times, Malawi professor of law Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa said what President Mutharika did by giving money handouts to journalists at a news event was tantamount to bribery. He has called on Mutharika to resign or face impeachment proceedings.
ny: M'danga lake mu nyuzipepala ya Nyasa Times, pulofesa wa zamalamulo ku Malawi Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa adati zomwe mtsogoleri wa dziko lino Mutharika anachita popereka ndalama kwa atolankhani pa mwambo wa nkhani zinali zofanana ndi ziphuphu. Iye wapempha a Mutharika kuti atule pansi udindo kapena kuyang'anizana ndi milandu ya impeachment.

en: Local civil society groups said that "by attempting to bribe the journalists" Mutharika subjected his leadership style to disrepute.
ny: Magulu a anthu a m'deralo ananena kuti "poyesa kupereka ziphuphu kwa atolankhani" a Mutharika anagonjetsa kalembedwe kake ka utsogoleri kuti anyoze.

en: Meanwhile, some journalists are donating the money to charity.
ny: Pakadali pano, atolankhani ena akupereka ndalamazo ku mabungwe othandiza anthu.

en: Brian Ligomeka, the Managing Editor for the Times Group, told Times Television that all four employees there have donated the money to an orphanage.
ny: Brian Ligomeka, yemwe ndi Mkonzi Woyang'anira gulu la Times Group, anauza nyuzipepala ya Times Television kuti antchito onse anayi kumeneko apereka ndalamazo ku nyumba ya ana amasiye.

en: "At first we decided to return the money to the president but we later thought it wise to buy assorted items like sugar, salt, notebooks and donate it to needy children," said Ligomeka.
ny: "Poyamba tinaganiza zobwezera ndalamazo kwa pulezidenti koma pambuyo pake tinaganiza kuti ndi nzeru kugula zinthu zosiyanasiyana monga shuga, mchere, zolemba ndikupereka kwa ana osowa," adatero Ligomeka.

en: In his latest Sunday Times column, Raphael Tenthani, who also writes for BBC, apologized on behalf of other journalists "for letting down the public that trust journalists unreservedly."
ny: M'danga lake laposachedwa la Sunday Times, Raphael Tenthani, yemwenso amalemba BBC, adapepesa m'malo mwa atolankhani ena "chifukwa cholekerera anthu omwe amakhulupirira atolankhani mosasunthika."

en: Tenthani has since donated the money for charity work and said that although the journalists could have done better if they returned the money right away, doing so would have been perceived as disrespect to the head of state.
ny: Kuyambira nthawi imeneyo Tenthani wapereka ndalamazo pa ntchito yothandiza anthu ndipo adati ngakhale kuti atolankhaniwo akanatha kuchita bwino ngati akanabweza ndalamazo nthawi yomweyo, kuchita zimenezi kukanaonedwa ngati kupanda ulemu kwa mtsogoleri wa boma.

en: Maclan Kanyangwa, who heads the Department of Journalism and Media Studies at the Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, said a media code of ethics bars journalists from accepting payment on a story.
ny: Maclan Kanyangwa, yemwe ndi mkulu wa dipatimenti yoona za utolankhani ndi zofalitsa nkhani pa yunivesite ya Polytechnic College of Malawi, adati malamulo ofalitsa nkhani okhudza makhalidwe abwino amaletsa atolankhani kulandira malipiro pa nkhani in chimodzi.

en: "Obviously the meeting at the palace was the newsworthy event. There was a possibility that something was going to be published. And in the event that this payment would have influenced journalist decision [on news judgment], then that becomes a problem," said Kanyangwa.
ny: "N'zachidziwikire kuti msonkhano wa panyumba yachifumu unali chochitika chofunika kwambiri pa nkhani. Panali kuthekera kwakuti chinachake chidzafalitsidwa. Ndipo ngati malipiro amenewa akanakhudza chigamulo cha atolankhani [pa chiweruzo cha nkhani], ndiye kuti chimenecho chimakhala vuto," adatero Kanyangwa.

en: Kanyangwa said he feels many journalists failed to return the money immediately because they might have been out of their ethical senses when they got the money.
ny: Kanyangwa adati akuona kuti atolankhani ambiri analephera kubweza ndalamazo nthawi yomweyo chifukwa mwina anali atatuluka m'maganizo mwawo a makhalidwe abwino pamene anapeza ndalamazo.

en: Efforts to talk to Presidential Press Officer Fredrick Ndala were not successful. But some government authorities say the payment was not a bribe but meant for a fuel refund to those who attended the night event.
ny: Zoyesayesa za kulankhula ndi Presidential Press Officer Fredrick Ndala sizinatheke. Koma akuluakulu ena a boma akuti malipirowo sanali chiphuphu koma anatanthauza kubwezeredwa mafuta kwa anthu omwe anapezeka pa mwambo wa usiku.

en: Report: Manufacturing Could Free Poorest Nations From Poverty
ny: Lipoti: Kupanga Zinthu Kungamasule Mayiko Osauka Kwambiri ku Umphawi

en: A new United Nations report urges the poorest countries in the world to shift from low- to high-productivity activities to improve their economies.
ny: Lipoti latsopano la bungwe la United Nations likulimbikitsa mayiko osauka kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi kuti asinthe kuchoka pa ntchito zochepa kupita ku ntchito zapamwamba kuti apititse patsogolo chuma chawo.

en: In its annual Least Developed Countries Report, UNCTAD — the U.N. Conference on Trade and Development — says these countries must structurally transform their economies to free themselves from the "poverty trap," which is stunting economic growth and development.
ny: Mu lipoti lake la pachaka la Least Developed Countries Report, UNCTAD - Msonkhano wa U.N. pa Zamalonda ndi Chitukuko - umati mayiko amenewa ayenera kusintha mwadongosolo chuma chawo kuti adzimasule ku "msampha wa umphawi," womwe ukulepheretsa chitukuko cha chuma ndi chitukuko.

en: Of the 48 nations the U.N. considers "Least Developed Countries" (LDCs), only one, Laos, is on track to achieve all seven of the Millennium Development Goals (MDG's) by 2015.
ny: Pa mayiko 48 omwe bungwe la UN limawaona kuti ndi "Mayiko Osatukuka Kwambiri" (LDCs), mmodzi yekha, Laos, ali pa njira yokwaniritsa zolinga zonse zisanu ndi ziwiri za Millennium Development Goals (MDG's) pofika 2015.

en: Only four African countries — Ethiopia, Malawi, Rwanda and Uganda — are likely to meet a majority of these targets.
ny: Maiko anayi okha a mu Afirika — Ethiopia, Malawi, Rwanda ndi Uganda — ndiwo angakwaniritse mbali yaikulu ya zolinga zimenezi.

en: This assessment is particularly grim in light of the even greater challenges awaiting these countries in the coming years. The MDGs set a goal for nations to halve their poverty levels by 2015. The so-called Sustainable Development Goals, which carry on from where the MDGs leave off, call for eradication of poverty by 2030.
ny: Kupenda kumeneku n'koipa kwambiri chifukwa cha mavuto aakulu kwambiri amene mayiko amenewa akukumana nawo m'zaka zikubwerazi. Ma MDG adakhazikitsa cholinga choti mayiko athetse umphawi wawo pofika 2015. Zolinga zotchedwa Sustainable Development Goals, zomwe zimapitirira kuchokera kumene ma MDG amasiya, zimaitanitsa kuthetsa umphawi pofika 2030.

en: According to Taffere Tesfachew, an UNCTAD official who works with African nations, it would be nothing short of a miracle for the LDCs to pull this off.
ny: Malinga ndi Taffere Tesfachew, mkulu wa UNCTAD yemwe amagwira ntchito ndi mayiko a ku Africa, sizingakhale zozizwitsa kuti ma LDC achotse izi.

en: In order for the least developed countries to achieve this miraculous performance, he says they will need to structurally change their economies.
ny: Kuti maiko osatukuka kwambiri akwaniritse ntchito yozizwitsa imeneyi, iye akuti adzafunikira kusintha chuma chawo mwadongosolo.

en: He tells VOA this means shifting labor from activities with low productivity, such as small-scale agriculture and services to more dynamic activities with higher productivity, such as manufacturing and high-value services.
ny: Iye akuuza VOA izi zikutanthauza kusintha ntchito kuchokera ku ntchito zomwe zili ndi zokolola zochepa, monga ulimi waung'ono ndi ntchito kupita ku ntchito zambiri zamphamvu ndi zokolola zapamwamba, monga kupanga ndi ntchito zamtengo wapatali.

en: "Countries that have moved up are the ones that are creating opportunities for those that are leaving agriculture to engage in things where they add value, where they get training and as it happens, manufacturing tends to have that sort of feature, that is why this call for manufacturing," he said. "Countries that are using policies to shift and influence capital and labor to move into this activity sector tend to do better."
ny: "Mayiko omwe apita patsogolo ndi omwe akupanga mwayi kwa iwo omwe akuchoka ku ulimi kuti achite zinthu zomwe amawonjezera phindu, komwe amapeza maphunziro ndipo monga momwe zimachitikira, kupanga zinthu kumakonda kukhala ndi mtundu umenewo, ndichifukwa chake izi zimaitanira kupanga," adatero. "Mayiko omwe akugwiritsa ntchito ndondomeko zosinthira ndi kusonkhezera ndalama ndi antchito kuti asamukire ku gawo la ntchitoyi amakonda kuchita bwino."

en: Tesfachew says these high-productivity sectors tend to pay higher wages and create a demand for goods. This, he says, encourages investment.
ny: Tesfachew akuti zigawo zapamwambazi zimakonda kulipira malipiro apamwamba ndikupanga kufunika kwa katundu. Izi, iye akuti, zimalimbikitsa ndalama.

en: On the surface, it appears that the LDCs are not doing badly. UNCTAD economic data show growth in these poor countries between 2002 and 2008 exceeded the seven percent target set by the international community. And, even after the 2008 financial crisis, UNCTAD notes the LDCs grew faster than other developing countries, at an average of 5.7 percent per year.
