ny: Pamwamba, zikuwoneka kuti ma LDC sakuchita zoipa. Deta yachuma ya UNCTAD imasonyeza kukula m'mayiko osauka awa pakati pa 2002 ndi 2008 kuposa cholinga cha peresenti isanu ndi iwiri chokhazikitsidwa ndi anthu apadziko lonse. Ndipo, ngakhale pambuyo pa mavuto azachuma a 2008, UNCTAD ikunena kuti ma LDC adakula mofulumira kuposa mayiko ena omwe akutukuka kumene, pa avareji ya 5.7 peresenti pachaka.

en: But U.N. economists say the outlook for the least developed countries in the short and medium term remains uncertain. They say increasing peoples productivity is the best way to break the patter of human and economic underdevelopment that continues to entrap them in poverty.
ny: Koma akatswiri azachuma a U.N. akunena kuti chiyembekezo cha maiko osatukuka kwenikweni m'nthaŵi yochepa ndi yapakati chidakali chosatsimikizirika. Iwo amati kuwonjezera zokolola za anthu ndi njira yabwino kwambiri yothetsera chitukuko cha anthu ndi chuma chomwe chikupitirizabe kuwagwira mu umphawi.

en: UN: Most African Nations to Miss 2015 MDG Goals
ny: UN: Mitundu Yambiri ya ku Africa Kuphonya Zolinga za 2015 MDG

en: Most African countries will not reach the Millennium Development Goals set for 2015 because of the gap between economic and human development. That is one of the conclusions in this years annual U.N. report on the Least Developed Countries, presented Thursday.
ny: Maiko ambiri a ku Africa sadzafika pa Zolinga za Chitukuko cha Millennium zomwe zinakhazikitsidwa mu 2015 chifukwa cha kusiyana pakati pa chitukuko cha chuma ndi anthu. Chimenecho ndi chimodzi mwa zotsatira mu lipoti la pachaka la U.N. la zaka zino la Mayiko Osatukuka Kwambiri, loperekedwa Lachinayi.

en: Junior Davis, U.N. economic affairs officer for Africa, said African countries have not been able to translate their economic growth into structural transformation.
ny: Junior Davis, woyang'anira nkhani zachuma wa UN ku Africa, adati mayiko a ku Africa sanathe kumasulira kukula kwawo kwachuma kukhala kusintha kwa kapangidwe.

en: "We think that is the case because these countries have not focused efficiently on building what we call their productive capacities," Davis said. "These are the basic human and economic development capacities that are needed to promote sustainable economic development. And the MDG, as they were constructed, largely ignored the need to develop the productive capacities."
ny: "Tikuganiza kuti ndi choncho chifukwa mayiko amenewa sanasumike maganizo bwino pa kumanga zomwe timati mphamvu zawo zokolola," adatero Davis. "Awa ndi mphamvu zazikulu za chitukuko cha anthu ndi zachuma zomwe zimafunikira kulimbikitsa chitukuko chokhazikika cha chuma. Ndipo A MDG, monga momwe anamangidwira, kwakukulukulu ananyalanyaza kufunika kokulitsa mphamvu zokolola."

en: Slow progress
ny: Kupita patsogolo pang'onopang'ono

en: African countries also are not on course to halve poverty by 2015, and their overall progress on reducing hunger is relatively slow. Poverty limits human development and undermines productivity. And economic development is needed to make gains in human development.
ny: Maiko a mu Afirika nawonso sali pa njira yochepetsera umphaŵi ndi theka po pofika 2015, ndipo kupita patsogolo kwawo konse pa kuchepetsa njala kuli kochedwa. Umphaŵi umachepetsa chitukuko cha anthu ndipo umafooketsa zokolola. Ndipo chitukuko cha zachuma chikufunika kuti apeze phindu pa chitukuko cha anthu.

en: Ethiopia, Rwanda, Uganda and Malawi are the only African countries on track to reach the majority of the development goals. They are making progress because they heavily invested in areas that create sustainable development such as infrastructure, health and education.
ny: Ethiopia, Rwanda, Uganda ndi Malawi ndi maiko okhawo a ku Africa omwe ali pa njira yokwaniritsa zolinga zambiri za chitukuko. Iwo akupita patsogolo chifukwa adaika ndalama zambiri m'madera omwe amapanga chitukuko chokhazikika monga zomangamanga, zaumoyo ndi maphunziro.

en: The post-2015 development agenda for fragile countries where governance remains an issue — such as South Sudan and the Democratic Republic of Congo — will still largely depend on support from the international community to achieve social and economic development, Davis said.
ny: Ndondomeko ya chitukuko cha pambuyo pa 2015 kwa mayiko osalimba kumene ulamuliro udakali nkhani - monga South Sudan ndi Democratic Republic of Congo - idzadalirabe kwambiri thandizo lochokera ku mayiko kuti akwaniritse chitukuko cha chikhalidwe ndi chuma, adatero Davis.

en: Improvements in rural development, industrial productivity, agriculture and the services sectors in these countries will require "ways in which we can have a pattern of growth which is not just sustainable but jobs-rich," Davis said. "Because we see the growth in jobs and employment is central to any development strategy that aims to reduce poverty in a sustainable way."
ny: Kupititsa patsogolo chitukuko cha kumidzi, zokolola za mafakitale, ulimi ndi zigawo za ntchito m'mayikowa kudzafuna "njira zomwe tingakhale nazo chitsanzo cha kukula zomwe sizimangokhala zokhazikika komanso ntchito zolemera," adatero Davis. "Chifukwa tikuwona kukula kwa ntchito ndi ntchito ndizofunika kwambiri pa njira iliyonse yachitukuko yomwe cholinga chake ndi kuchepetsa umphawi m'njira yokhazikika."

en: A country is placed on the Least Developed Countries list based on its per capita income, economic vulnerability, and human development indicators such as health and nutrition.
ny: Dziko limaikidwa pa mndandanda wa Least Developed Countries potengera ndalama zomwe limapeza pa munthu aliyense, kufooka kwa chuma, ndi zizindikiro za chitukuko cha anthu monga zaumoyo ndi zakudya.

en: Of the 48 least developed countries in the world, 34 are in Africa. Three countries have graduated from their least developed status: Botswana, Cape Verde and Samoa.
ny: Pa mayiko 48 osatukuka kwambiri padziko lonse, 34 ali ku Africa. Maiko atatu amaliza maphunziro awo osatukuka kwambiri: Botswana, Cape Verde ndi Samoa.

en: Strike Paralyzes Malawi's Judicial Services
ny: Strike Paralyzes Malawi's Judicial Services

en: A week-long strike by the support staff of Malawi's judiciary system has paralyzed the courts, causing overcrowding in police cells and the indefinite suspension of major cases - including government corruption trials. Court marshals, clerks and messengers are demanding the 30 percent salary increases promised by the government two years ago.
ny: Kugwira ntchito kwa sabata lonse kwa ogwira ntchito zothandizira a dongosolo lachiweruzo la Malawi kwalepheretsa makhoti, kuchititsa kuchuluka kwa anthu m'zipinda za apolisi komanso kuyimitsidwa kosatha kwa milandu yayikulu - kuphatikizapo milandu ya ziphuphu za boma. Akuluakulu a khoti, maofesi ndi amithenga akufuna kuti malipiro a 30 peresenti awonjezeke omwe boma linalonjeza zaka ziwiri zapitazo.

en: Chanting and singing around the court premises has become a pastime activity for the striking court workers since the onset of a sit-in last week.  Linley Hebert, a spokesperson for the striking workers, told VOA the strike is a result of the governments failure to honor a 2012 agreement.
ny: Kuimba ndi kuimba mozungulira malo a bwalo la milandu kwakhala ntchito yopuma kwa ogwira ntchito m'khoti omwe akumenya kuyambira kuyambika kwa sit-in sabata yatha.  Linley Hebert, mneneri wa ogwira ntchito omwe akumenya, adauza VOA kuti kugwira ntchito ndi chifukwa chakuti maboma akulephera kulemekeza mgwirizano wa 2012.

en: "In October [this year], the government reviewed the salaries of the civil servants, but we were not included in that revision," Hebert said.
ny: "M'mwezi wa Okutobala [chaka chino], boma linapenda malipiro a ogwira ntchito m'boma, koma sitinaphatikizidwe mu kukonzanso kumeneko," adatero Hebert.

en: "Yet in 2012, we had an agreement that each time they are revising the salaries of the civil servants, [they will be increasing our salaries as well].
ny: "Komabe mu 2012, tinali ndi mgwirizano kuti nthawi iliyonse yomwe akukonzanso malipiro a ogwira ntchito m'boma, [adzakhala akuwonjezera malipiro athu komanso].

en: So, [after adhering to the agreement in 2013], we are surprised to see that this time we are left out."  Government authorities say the failure to increase judicial workers salaries this year is largely because of financial constraints, following a donor aid freeze against Malawi's government.
ny: Choncho, [titatsatira mgwirizanowu mu 2013], tikudabwa kuona kuti ulendo uno tasiyidwa kunja."  Akuluakulu a boma ati kulephera kuwonjezera malipiro a ogwira ntchito zachiweruzo chaka chino kwakukulukulu chifukwa cha mavuto azachuma, potsatira lamulo la donor aid freeze motsutsana ndi boma la Malawi.

en: The freeze is a result of a government financial scandal in which more than $30 million was looted from government coffers.  Ministry of Finance spokesperson Nations Msowoya told a local radio station it is hard for the government to meet the workers' demand.
ny: Kuzizira kumeneku kunachitika chifukwa cha nkhani ya ndalama ya boma yomwe ndalama zoposa madola 30 miliyoni zinafunkhidwa m'bokosi la boma.  Mneneri wa Unduna wa Zachuma Nations Msowoya adauza wailesi ya mderalo kuti ndizovuta kuti boma likwaniritse zofuna za antchito.

en: "It is difficult to promise what the treasury will do. But suffice to say that the prevailing economic circumstances and budgetary constraints will make a little bit difficult for the treasury to bow down to the demands," "Msowoya said.
ny: "N'zovuta kulonjeza zomwe chuma chidzachita. Koma zokwanira kunena kuti mikhalidwe ya zachuma yomwe ilipo komanso zopinga za bajeti zidzapangitsa kuti chuma chikhale chovuta pang'ono kugwadira zofunazo," "adatero Mayiowoya.

en: But according to Hebert, the strikers will not resume work until their demands are met.  "Since I was born [there has been] no time the government said it had some money.
ny: Koma malinga ndi Hebert, omenyera sadzayambanso ntchito mpaka zofuna zawo zikwaniritsidwa.  "Kuyambira pamene ndinabadwa [pakhala] palibe nthawi imene boma linanena kuti lili ndi ndalama zina.

en: It has its own means [of finding the money] and it will find the same means to give us the money," Hebert insisted.  The ongoing strike is hampering progress of trials, as court operations remain suspended.
ny: Ili ndi njira zake [zopezera ndalamazo] ndipo idzapeza njira yomweyi yotipatsa ndalamazo," Hebert adaumirira.  Kugwira ntchito komwe kukuchitika kukulepheretsa kupita patsogolo kwa milandu, popeza ntchito za khoti zikuyimitsidwabe.

en: Several trials, including that of former justice minister Ralph Kasambara, who is answering charges in connection with the financial scandal, were indefinitely suspended last week.
ny: Milandu ingapo, kuphatikizapo ya yemwe kale anali nduna ya zachilungamo Ralph Kasambara, yemwe akuyankha milandu yokhudzana ndi nkhani ya zachuma, inaimitsidwa mpaka kalekale sabata yatha.

en: Police are complaining of congestion in jail cells, as no suspects are being taken to court.
ny: Apolisi akudandaula za kuchuluka kwa anthu m'ndende, popeza palibe anthu omwe akukayikira omwe akutengedwa kukhoti.

en: Malawi police spokesperson Rhoda Manjolo told VOA the only option they have is "giving police bail to those with minor offenses."   Human rights campaigners and legal experts say the strike is contributing to human rights violations.
ny: Mneneri wa apolisi ku Malawi Rhoda Manjolo anauza VOA njira yokhayo yomwe ali nayo ndi "kupereka bail kwa apolisi kwa omwe ali ndi milandu yaing'ono."   Anthu omenyera ufulu wachibadwidwe komanso akatswiri a zamalamulo akuti kugwira ntchito kumeneku kukuchititsa kuti anthu aziphwanya ufulu wa anthu.

en: "There are those people who have to be taken to court within 48 hours," noted Lawyer George Kadzipatike who works in a private practice in the northern city of Mzuzu. "We cannot make application for them to be granted bail.
ny: "Pali anthu amenewo omwe akuyenera kutengedwa ku khoti mkati mwa maola 48," adatero Loya George Kadzipatike yemwe amagwira ntchito payekha kumpoto kwa mzinda wa Mzuzu. "Sitingapange pempho loti apatsidwe bail.

en: There are those people who do not want to live with their partners, they would like the court to decree that they be divorced, we cannot file any petition through the courts."
ny: Pali anthu amenewo amene safuna kukhala ndi anzawo, angafune kuti khoti lilamula kuti asudzulidwe, sitingapereke pempho lililonse kudzera m'makhoti."

en: Government authorities say closed door negotiations to resolve the matter continue in the capital, Lilongwe.  But the striking workers told VOA whatever the case, they will accept nothing short of a 30 percent increase in their salaries.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma ati zokambirana zotsekedwa kuti athetse nkhaniyi zikupitirirabe ku likulu la dziko la Lilongwe.  Koma ogwira ntchito omwe akumenyawo adauza VOA mulimonse momwe zingakhalire, sadzalandira chilichonse chochepa cha kuwonjezeka kwa 30 peresenti kwa malipiro awo.

en: A similar strike lasted three months in 2012 after the magistrates and judges joined the labor action.
ny: Kugwira ntchito kofananako kunatenga miyezi itatu mu 2012 pamene oweruza ndi oweruza anagwirizana nawo pa ntchito ya antchito.

en: Famine in Southern Africa Worse Than Predicted - 2002-07-24
ny: Njala Kumwera kwa Africa Yoipa Kuposa Yonenedweratu - 2002-07-24

en: The United Nations World Food Program says the famine in southern Africa is even worse than predicted. WFP officials are warning that 13 million people in six countries: Malawi, Zambia, Lesotho, Zimbabwe, Swaziland and Mozambique are in danger of starvation if they do not get food aid.
ny: Bungwe la United Nations la World Food Program likuti njala kum'mwera kwa Africa ndi yoipa kwambiri kuposa momwe ananeneratu. Akuluakulu a WFP akuchenjeza kuti anthu 13 miliyoni m'mayiko asanu ndi limodzi: Malawi, Zambia, Lesotho, Zimbabwe, Swaziland ndi Mozambique ali pangozi ya njala ngati sakupeza chithandizo cha chakudya.

en: World Food Program officials say they need one million tons of food to alleviate hunger in southern Africa, but they are not confident they will get it. In an appeal to the international community at the beginning of July, WFP officials asked for more than $0.5 billion to buy food. So far they have received only 20 percent of that. WFP's director for the southern Africa region, Judith Lewis, says the situation is getting desperate. "The window of opportunity to avert what could be a major humanitarian crisis is closing," she said. "We need more assistance now. We need food on the high seas now, or we need cash to buy commodities that are still available in southern Africa, so we can avert this major, major crisis."
ny: Akuluakulu a bungwe la World Food Program ati akufunikira matani miliyoni imodzi a chakudya kuti achepetse njala kumwera kwa Africa, koma alibe chidaliro kuti adzachipeza. Popempha anthu a m'mayiko osiyanasiyana kumayambiriro kwa mwezi wa July, akuluakulu a WFP anapempha ndalama zoposa madola 0.5 biliyoni kuti agule chakudya. Pakadali pano alandira 20 peresenti yokha ya zimenezo. Mtsogoleri wa WFP m'chigawo cha kum'mwera kwa Africa, Judith Lewis, akuti zinthu zikuipa kwambiri. "Window ya mwayi wopewa zomwe zingakhale vuto lalikulu la anthu akutseka," adatero. "Tikufuna thandizo lambiri tsopano. Tikufuna chakudya panyanja zapamwamba tsopano, kapena tikufunikira ndalama zogulira zinthu zomwe zikupezekabe kum'mwera kwa Africa, kuti tipewe vuto lalikululi, lalikulu."

en: Currently, the WFP is assisting six million of the most vulnerable people in the six most severely affected countries. About half of these people are in Zimbabwe. The agency says it is sure the number of people needing its help will rise.
ny: Pakalipano, WFP ikuthandiza anthu mamiliyoni asanu ndi limodzi omwe ali pangozi kwambiri m'mayiko asanu ndi limodzi omwe akukhudzidwa kwambiri. Pafupifupi theka la anthu amenewa ali ku Zimbabwe. Bungweli likuti likutsimikiza kuti chiwerengero cha anthu ofunikira thandizo lake chidzakwera.

en: The World Health Organization notes southern Africa, in addition to having the highest prevalence of HIV/AIDS in the world, also has the world's highest chronic malnutrition rates. It predicts about 300,000 people could die over the next six months from diseases related to malnutrition.
ny: Bungwe Loona za Umoyo pa Dziko Lonse linanena kuti kum'mwera kwa Africa, kuwonjezera pa kukhala ndi HIV / AIDS yambiri padziko lonse lapansi, kulinso ndi matenda aakulu kwambiri padziko lonse a kuperewera kwa zakudya m'thupi. Limaneneratu kuti anthu pafupifupi 300,000 angafe m'miyezi isanu ndi umodzi yotsatira chifukwa cha matenda okhudzana ndi kuperewera kwa zakudya m'thupi.

en: Ms. Lewis says the dying has already begun. "We are seeing people moving from their villages," she said. "If they know there is going to be a food distribution, they immediately go there. The problem is we do not even have enough food to feed the people who are on the rolls, let alone add food for other people in the areas. Is there a potential to become chaotic? Yes. "
ny: Mayi Lewis ati kufa kwayamba kale. "Tikuona anthu akuchoka m'midzi yawo," adatero. "Ngati akudziwa kuti padzakhala kugawidwa kwa chakudya, nthawi yomweyo amapita kumeneko. Vuto ndiloti tilibe ngakhale chakudya chokwanira kudyetsa anthu omwe ali pa mipukutu, osati kuwonjezera chakudya cha anthu ena m'madera. Kodi pangakhale chisokonezo? Inde. "

en: WFP'S Judith Lewis says at this time of year the agency is usually planning how to get food supplies into the region before the rainy season hits in October. But she says since the WFP is already having difficulty meeting its present targets, it can't even begin to plan for future food deliveries.
ny: Judith Lewis wa WFP akuti panthawi ino ya chaka bungweli nthawi zambiri limakonzekera momwe angapezere chakudya m'derali nyengo ya mvula isanayambe mu Okutobala. Koma iye akuti popeza bungwe la WFP likuvutika kale kukwaniritsa zolinga zake zomwe zilipo panopa, silingathe ngakhale kukonzekera kutumiza chakudya mtsogolo.

en: Canadian PM Impressed With African Development Plan - 2002-04-05
ny: Canada PM Anachita Chidwi ndi Ndondomeko ya Chitukuko cha Africa - 2002-04-05

en: Canadian Prime Minister Jean Chretien says he is impressed with the progress being made towards implementing an African development plan.
ny: Nduna yaikulu ya dziko la Canada Jean Chretien ati akuchita chidwi ndi kupita patsogolo komwe kukuchitika pogwiritsa ntchito dongosolo la chitukuko cha Africa.

en: Mr. Chretien made the remarks Sunday after meeting with South African President Thabo Mbeki and other regional leaders in Pretoria.
ny: Bambo Chretien adanena mawuwa Lamlungu atakumana ndi mtsogoleri wa dziko la South Africa Thabo Mbeki ndi atsogoleri ena a m'madera ku Pretoria.

en: Mr. Chretien, the current chairman of the group of the seven most industrialized nations plus Russia, is visiting Africa to discuss the New Partnership for Africa's Development, known as NEPAD.
ny: Bambo Chretien, omwe panopa ndi wapampando wa gulu la mayiko asanu ndi awiri otukuka kwambiri kuphatikizapo Russia, akuyendera Africa kukakambirana za bungwe la New Partnership for Africa's Development, lomwe limadziwika kuti NEPAD.

en: He said NEPAD will be one of the top agendas at the June G-8 summit in Kananaskis, Canada.
ny: Iye anati NEPAD idzakhala imodzi mwa zolinga zapamwamba pamsonkhano wa June G-8 ku Kananaskis, Canada.

en: The G-8 nations are Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United States and Russia.
ny: Mitundu ya G-8 ndi Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, United States ndi Russia.

en: Mr. Chretien says topics such as human rights, democracy the rule of law, transparency and good governance will be discussed at the G8 summit.
ny: Bambo Chretien akuti nkhani monga ufulu wachibadwidwe, demokalase ulamuliro wa malamulo, kuwonekera ndi ulamuliro wabwino zidzakambidwa pamsonkhano wa G8.

en: NEPAD outlines objectives of promoting democracy and good governance in Africa in return for Western economic assistance. It seeks to achieve an annual growth rate of seven-percent on the African continent by 2015.
ny: NEPAD ikufotokoza zolinga zolimbikitsa demokalase ndi ulamuliro wabwino ku Africa pobwezera thandizo lachuma la Kumadzulo. Amafuna kukwaniritsa kukula kwa pachaka kwa zisanu ndi ziwiri peresenti pa dziko la Africa pofika 2015.

en: South African President Mbeki said he is convinced that Africa is ready for NEPAD saying there has been definite progress toward democracy in the continent.
ny: Purezidenti wa dziko la South Africa Mbeki adati akukhulupirira kuti Africa ndi wokonzeka ku NEPAD ponena kuti pakhala kupita patsogolo kotsimikizirika ku demokalase mu kontinentiyi.

en: Later, Mr. Chretien and Mr. Mbeki were joined by presidents Festus Mogae of Botswana, Bakili Muluzu of Malawi, Joaquim Chissano of Mozambique, Sam Nujoma of Namibia, Benjamin Makapa of Tanzania and Vice President Enoch Kavindele of Zambia.
ny: Pambuyo pake, a Chretien ndi a Mbeki adalumikizidwa ndi mapulezidenti Festus Mogae wa ku Botswana, Bakili Muluzu wa ku Malawi, Joaquim Chissano wa ku Mozambique, Sam Nujoma wa ku Namibia, Benjamin Makapa wa ku Tanzania ndi Wachiwiri kwa Purezidenti Enoch Kavindele wa ku Zambia.

en: Zimbabwe's President Robert Mugabe, who won re-election in disputed voting last month, was not invited.
ny: Mtsogoleri wa dziko la Zimbabwe Robert Mugabe, yemwe adapambana chisankho chachiwiri pa mavoti otsutsana mwezi watha, sanaitanidwe.

en: Reuters news agency reports the Canadian prime minister who has already visited Morocco, Algeria and Nigeria on his six-nation tour will visit Ethiopia and Senegal after South Africa.
ny: Bungwe lofalitsa nkhani la Reuters likunena kuti nduna yaikulu ya Canada yomwe idapita kale ku Morocco, Algeria ndi Nigeria paulendo wake wa mayiko asanu ndi limodzi adzapita ku Ethiopia ndi Senegal pambuyo pa South Africa.

en: Some information for this report provided by Reuters and AFP.
ny: Chidziwitso china cha lipoti ili loperekedwa ndi Reuters ndi AFP.

en: Child Labor in Malawi - 2002-02-28
ny: Ntchito ya Ana ku Malawi - 2002-02-28

en: The organization, Eye of the Child, is expressing concern about what is says is a large number of children who are being forced to work due to poverty.
ny: Bungweli, la Eye of the Child, likusonyeza kuti lili ndi nkhawa ndi zomwe zikunenedwa kuti ndi ana ambiri omwe akukakamizidwa kugwira ntchito chifukwa cha umphawi.

en: It says these children risk being abused.
ny: Limati ana amenewa ali pangozi ya kuchitiridwa nkhanza.

en: Some under aged children work as mini – bus call boys in the busy business district of Limbe in the commercial capital, Blantyre. They are some of the many children who have been forced into employment because of poverty.
ny: Ana ena osakwana zaka amagwira ntchito ngati mini – bus call boys in the busy business district of Limbe in the commercial capital, Blantyre. Iwo ndi ena mwa ana ambiri amene akakamizidwa kugwira ntchito chifukwa cha umphawi.

en: Maxwell Matewere is the executive director of Eye of the Child. He says many of the children come from rural areas. He says, "Currently we havent done a data analysis but the Ministry of Labor intends to do that as soon as possible with financial resources from the International Labor Organization.
ny: Maxwell Matewere ndi mkulu wa Eye of the Child. Iye akuti ana ambiri amachokera kumidzi. Iye akuti, "Pakali pano sitinachite kusanthula deta koma Unduna wa Ntchito ukufuna kuchita zimenezo mwamsanga ndi ndalama zochokera ku International Labor Organization.

en: But basing on our own assessment and through our works, we feel child labor is a serious problem particularly in the rural areas and you can tell that from trafficking of children from rural areas to urban areas where most of the young people are working in peoples houses.
ny: Koma pogwiritsa ntchito kafukufuku wathu komanso kudzera mu ntchito zathu, tikuona kuti kugwiritsa ntchito ana ndi vuto lalikulu makamaka m'madera akumidzi ndipo mutha kudziwa zimenezo kuyambira kugulitsa ana kuchokera kumidzi kupita kumadera a m'tawuni komwe achinyamata ambiri akugwira ntchito m'nyumba za anthu.

en: " Mr. Matewere says poor children often find work on large farm estates.
ny: " A Matewere akuti ana osauka nthawi zambiri amapeza ntchito pa malo akuluakulu a famu.

en: He said, "We have noticed that there are some indications that there are children who are working in tea estates and tobacco estates.
ny: Iye anati, "Tawona kuti pali zizindikiro zina zosonyeza kuti pali ana amene akugwira ntchito m'malo a tiyi ndi malo ogulitsa fodya.

en: There also are children who are working in brick making mostly their parents will facilitate for them to work in those kinds of employment. "
ny: Palinso ana amene akugwira ntchito yopanga njerwa makamaka makolo awo adzawathandiza kugwira ntchito zamtundu umenewo. "

en: Mr. Matewere says the Eye of the Child has established that there are gross violations of children rights in the country. These include, rape, defilement and being overworked.
ny: Bambo Matewere ati Diso la Mwana lakhazikitsa kuti m'dzikoli mukuphwanya kwambiri ufulu wa ana. Izi zikuphatikizapo, kugwirira chigololo, kuipitsa ndi kugwira ntchito mopitirira muyeso.

en: He says this violates the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child.
ny: Iye akuti izi zikuphwanya mgwirizano wa United Nations pa Ufulu wa Mwana.

en: "If you look at the Convention of the Rights of a Child," he said, "you will see that it provides for the protection for children from any kind of exploitation from any kind of harmful activities or act which threatens their health, their development which is a threat to education.
ny: "Mukayang'ana Pangano la Ufulu wa Mwana," iye anatero, "mudzaona kuti limapereka chitetezo kwa ana ku mtundu uliwonse wa kudyeredwa masuku pamutu kuchokera ku mtundu uliwonse wa ntchito zovulaza kapena zochita zomwe zikuwopseza thanzi lawo, chitukuko chawo chomwe chikuwopseza maphunziro.

en: So children who are found working in tea estates, who are found in brick making, obvious, their rights as it is provided for in the Convention for the Rights of the Children as well as in the constitution are violated. "
ny: Choncho ana omwe amapezeka akugwira ntchito m'malo a tiyi, omwe amapezeka popanga njerwa, zoonekeratu, ufulu wawo monga momwe amaperekedwera mu Convention for the Rights of the Children komanso m'konsichushoni amaphwanyidwa. "

en: The Eye of the Child executive director says his organization is looking at ways of protecting the rights of a child.
ny: Mkulu wa bungwe la Eye of the Child akuti bungwe lake likuyang'ana njira zotetezera ufulu wa mwana.

en: He says to achieve this, the group has started a number of programs. "We have recently started a new program and what we are trying to do is to inform the general public on the best interests of the child and to inform them on the rights of a child.
ny: Iye akuti kuti akwaniritse izi, gululi layamba mapulogalamu angapo. "Posachedwapa tayamba pulogalamu yatsopano ndipo zomwe tikuyesetsa kuchita ndikudziwitsa anthu onse za ubwino wa mwanayo komanso kuwadziwitsa za ufulu wa mwana.

en: At the same we want also to build up the capacity of the children themselves so that may be they can be use their authentic voice out their concerns. "
ny: Pa chimodzimodzi tikufuna komanso kumanga mphamvu ya ana okha kotero kuti mwina iwo akhoza kukhala ntchito mawu awo enieni kunja nkhawa zawo. "

en: According to the Ministry of Labor authorities, many children are forced to leave school and find work because parents cannot afford school fees.
ny: Malinga ndi akuluakulu a Unduna wa Ntchito, ana ambiri amakakamizidwa kusiya sukulu ndikupeza ntchito chifukwa makolo sangathe kulipira ndalama za sukulu.

en: Although primary school is free in Malawi, most children do not attend due to lack of necessities like clothes.
ny: Ngakhale kuti sukulu ya pulaimale ndi yaulere ku Malawi, ana ambiri samapita chifukwa chosowa zinthu zofunika monga zovala.

en: Over 60 per cent of Malawis nearly 11 million people live below the poverty line.
ny: Anthu oposa 60 pa 100 alionse a ku Malawi pafupifupi 11 miliyoni ali pa umphawi wadzaoneni.

en: Malawi Court Convicts 12 People in Albino Attack
ny: Khoti la ku Malawi Lapereka Mlandu kwa Anthu 12 pa Nkhondo ya Albino

en: A high court in Malawi has convicted five people of murder for the 2018 killing of a 22-year-old albino man, including the victims brother.
ny: Khoti lalikulu ku Malawi lapereka mlandu kwa anthu asanu wakupha chifukwa cha kupha munthu wa albino wazaka 22 mu 2018, kuphatikizapo m'bale wa anthu omwe anaphedwawo.

en: The court convicted seven other people of selling the victim's body parts.
ny: Khotili linagamula kuti anthu ena asanu ndi awiri akugulitsa ziwalo za thupi la wophedwayo.

en: Malawi officials say more than 170 albinos have been attacked in the country since 2014 by people who believe their body parts bring luck and wealth.
ny: Akuluakulu a dziko la Malawi ati ma albino oposa 170 aukiridwa m'dzikoli kuyambira mu 2014 ndi anthu omwe amakhulupirira kuti ziwalo za thupi lawo zimabweretsa mwayi ndi chuma.

en: Family members of the deceased, MacDonald Masambuka, left the courtroom Thursday with hopes of justice being served after the court convicted all 12 people accused in his death.  F
ny: Anthu a m'banja la wakufayo, MacDonald Masambuka, adachoka m'bwalo la milandu Lachinayi ndi chiyembekezo chakuti chilungamo chidzaperekedwa pambuyo poti khoti lapereka mlandu kwa anthu onse 12 omwe akuimbidwa mlandu wa imfa yake.  F

en: amily members, including Masambukas mother, appeared calm and composed as Judge Dorothy NyaKaunda Kamanga read the judgments.
ny: amily members, kuphatikizapo amayi a Masambukas, anaoneka odekha komanso olembedwa mtima pamene Woweruza Dorothy NyaKaunda Kamanga anawerenga ziweruzo.

en: Those convicted included a Catholic priest, Father Thomas Muhosa, police officer Chikondi Chileka, clinician Lumbani Kamanga, and the deceaseds brother, Cassim Masambuka. Charges included murder, extracting human tissues, causing harm to a person with disability, and trafficking in persons.
ny: Amene anapezeka ndi mlanduwu anali wansembe wachikatolika, Bambo Thomas Muhosa, wapolisi Chikondi Chileka, dokotala Lumbani Kamanga, ndi mchimwene wa anthu amene anamwalira, Cassim Masambuka. Milandu inaphatikizapo kupha, kutulutsa minofu ya anthu, kuvulaza munthu wolumala, ndi kugulitsa anthu.

en: Kamanga convicted the victims brother and four others of murder.
ny: Kamanga anaimba mlandu m'bale wa anthu amene anaphedwawo komanso anthu ena anayi kuti anapha munthu.

en: The court convicted seven other people, including the priest and police officer, of selling the victim's body parts.
ny: Khotili linaweruza anthu ena asanu ndi awiri, kuphatikizapo wansembe ndi wapolisi, kuti akugulitsa ziwalo za thupi la wophedwayo.

en: Business with tissue  According to the court, Muhosha, Chileka and others offered to conduct business using human tissue extracted from a human corpse.
ny: Bizinesi yokhala ndi minofu Malinga ndi bwalo la milandu, Muhosha, Chileka ndi ena anadzipereka kuchita bizinesi pogwiritsa ntchito minofu ya anthu yotengedwa mu mtembo wa munthu.

en: The judge said the state proved beyond reasonable doubt the 12 people conspired to kill Masambuka to extract his bones based on a perception they would benefit financially.
ny: Woweruzayo adati boma linatsimikizira popanda kukayikira kuti anthu 12 adakonza chiwembu chofuna kupha Masambuka kuti atulutse mafupa ake potengera malingaliro omwe angapindule nawo ndalama.

en: She said Masambuka is the latest victim of violent attacks on persons with albinism who have not been protected by the community.
ny: Iye adati Masambuka ndi mnkhole waposachedwapa wa ziwawa pa anthu omwe ali ndi alubino omwe sanatetezedwe ndi anthu a mderalo.

en: Director of Public Prosecutions Steve Kayuni represented the state in the case. He said he was pleased the court agreed on all the seven charges he presented.
ny: Mtsogoleri wa Public Prosecutions Steve Kayuni anaimira boma pa mlanduwu. Iye adati adakondwera kuti khoti linagwirizana pa milandu yonse isanu ndi iwiri yomwe adapereka.

en: "Its really something overwhelming on the part of the state considering that this matter, if you notice, there is a police officer involved, a priest involved and there is a brother involved.
ny: "Its really something overwhelming on the part of the state considering that this matter, if you notice, there is a police officer involved, a priest involved and there is a brother involved.

en: If you notice, it all revolves around the position of trust — that somebody like the late Macdonald Masambuka trusted so much, they are the ones who ended up betraying him," Kayuni said.
ny: Mukaona, zonse zimazungulira malo odalirika - kuti wina ngati malemu Macdonald Masambuka ankakhulupirira kwambiri, iwo ndi amene anamaliza kumupereka," adatero Kayuni.

en: Masambuka went missing from his village on March 9, 2018, and his limbless body was found buried in a garden on April 2, 2018, in his home district of Machinga south of Malawi.
ny: Masambuka anasowa m'mudzi mwawo pa March 9, 2018, ndipo mtembo wake wopanda ziwalo unapezeka utaikidwa m'munda pa April 2, 2018, m'chigawo chakwawo cha Machinga kumwera kwa Malawi.

en: Enticement  Court documents show that Masambuka was enticed by his brother to meet his friends, who he claimed had found a girl for him to marry.
ny: Zikalata za khoti la Enticement zikuwonetsa kuti Masambuka adakopeka ndi mchimwene wake kuti akakumane ndi anzake, omwe adati adapeza mtsikana kuti akwatire.

en: But when they reached the scene, the alleged friends grabbed Masambuka by the neck and dragged him to a garden where they killed him. Here, his assailants cut off his limbs, burned his body using petrol and buried it there.
ny: Koma atafika pamalopo, anthu omwe akuti anali anzawo anagwira Masambuka pakhosi n'kumukokera kumunda kumene anamupha. Pano, anthu amene anamuukirawo anamudula ziwalo, kutentha thupi lake pogwiritsa ntchito mafuta n'kulikwirira kumeneko.

en: This was the first such case involving high-profile community members involved in attacks on persons with albinism.
ny: Iyi inali nkhani yoyamba yotereyi yokhudza anthu apamwamba a m'deralo omwe amagwira nawo ntchito yowukira anthu omwe ali ndi alubino.

en: Masauko Chamkakala, the lawyer for the 12 defendants in the case, said he would comment once he had gone through the judgment.
ny: Masauko Chamkakala, yemwe ndi loya wa anthu 12 omwe akuimbidwa mlanduwu, adati adzapereka ndemanga atadutsa chigamulocho.

en: "We are still waiting to see the perfected judgment so that we can read it and study it and talk to our clients," Chamkakala said.
ny: "Tikudikirabe kuti tiwone chiweruzo changwiro kuti tithe kuchiwerenga ndikuchiphunzira ndikulankhula ndi makasitomala athu," adatero Chamkakala.

en: Rights activists said they expected the court to give stiffer punishment to those convicted.
ny: Anthu omenyera ufulu anati akuyembekezera kuti khotili lipereke chilango chokhwima kwa anthu omwe ali ndi mlandu.

en: 'Serious sentencing'
ny: 'Chilango chachikulu'

en: Ian Simbota represented the Association of Persons with Albinism at the court.
ny: Ian Simbota anaimira bungwe la Association of Persons with Albinism ku khoti.

en: "When the judge was reading, what concerned me was that part of a [Priest] Father Muhosha [and others] who have been convicted of transacting body parts.
ny: "Pamene woweruzayo anali kuŵerenga, chimene chinandidetsa nkhaŵa chinali mbali imeneyo ya Bambo [Wansembe] Muhosha [ndi ena] amene apezedwa ndi mlandu wa kugaŵa ziwalo za thupi.

en: If you go to the Anatomy Act, it is not so hard on such offenses.
ny: Ngati mupita ku Anatomy Act, sizovuta kwambiri pa zolakwa zoterezi.

en: So, we are really looking forward to the judge, if at all its possible, to put a human face to the case so that at least we really need to see serious sentencing on this case," Simbota said.
ny: Choncho, tikuyembekezeradi woweruza, ngati n'kotheka konse, kuika nkhope yaumunthu pa mlanduwu kuti osachepera tifunikiradi kuwona chilango chachikulu pa mlanduwu," adatero Simbota.

en: The high court is expected to sentence the perpetrators on May 30.
ny: Khoti lalikululi likuyembekezeka kupereka chilango kwa anthu amene anachita zimenezi pa 30 May.

en: In another case, a high court on Thursday sentenced a 37-year-old man to life in prison for the 2020 murder of a 14-year-old-boy with albinism in Phalombe district.
ny: Pa mlandu wina, khoti lalikulu Lachinayi linalamula mwamuna wina wa zaka 37 kuti akhale m'ndende moyo wake wonse chifukwa chopha mnyamata wa zaka 14 wa zaka 14 ndi alubino m'chigawo cha Phalombe.

en: Zimbabwe Official Defends Crackdown on Protests, Urges Patience with Economy
ny: Mkulu wa dziko la Zimbabwe Akuteteza Kuwononga Zionetsero, Akulimbikitsa Kuleza Mtima ndi Chuma

en: Zimbabwe's minister of foreign affairs and international trade on Monday defended crackdowns on anti-government demonstrations and urged patience in turning around the country's foundering economy.
ny: Nduna yoona za mayiko akunja komanso zamalonda padziko lonse ku Zimbabwe Lolemba inateteza zionetsero zotsutsana ndi boma ndipo inalimbikitsa kuleza mtima potembenuza chuma choyambitsa dzikoli.

en: Though "everybody's got the right to demonstrate," there have "been a lot of insinuations and campaigns of violence," Sibusiso B. Moyo told VOA in an interview. Citing public safety, he endorsed a Zimbabwe court's ruling hours earlier to uphold a police ban on a protest organized by the opposition Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) alliance.
ny: Ngakhale kuti "aliyense ali ndi ufulu wowonetsera," pakhala "zisonyezero zambiri ndi makampeni a chiwawa," Sibusiso B. Moyo adauza VOA poyankhulana. Potchula chitetezo cha anthu, adavomereza chigamulo cha khoti la Zimbabwe maola angapo m'mbuyomo kuti lichirikize chiletso cha apolisi pa zionetsero zomwe bungwe lotsutsa la Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) linakonza.

en: Alliance leaders are pressing President Emmerson Mnangagwa and the ruling ZANU-PF party for a role in a transitional government. They had organized a demonstration Monday in Bulawayo, the country's second-largest city, but police authorities banned it hours before its intended start. Two other opposition demonstrations still are planned this week: for the central city of Gweru on Tuesday and the southeastern city of Masvingo on Wednesday.
ny: Atsogoleri a mgwirizano akukakamiza mtsogoleri wa dziko lino Emmerson Mnangagwa ndi chipani cholamulira cha ZANU-PF kuti akhale ndi udindo m'boma losintha. Iwo adakonza zionetsero Lolemba ku Bulawayo, mzinda wachiwiri waukulu kwambiri mdziko muno, koma akuluakulu apolisi adaletsa maola ambiri asanayambe cholinga chake. Ziwonetsero zina ziwiri zotsutsa zikukonzedwabe sabata ino: kwa mzinda wapakati wa Gweru Lachiwiri ndi mzinda wa kum'mwera chakum'mawa kwa Masvingo Lachitatu.

en: Police also had pre-emptively banned a demonstration in Harare last Friday, a decision upheld by a Zimbabwe court. Hundreds of MDC supporters ignored the ban, leading to clashes between civilians and police. Video and photographs showed police hitting and kicking some demonstrators among actions that drew complaints of excessive force from civil and human rights groups, including the United Nations human rights office.
ny: Apolisi nawonso anali ataletsa zionetsero ku Harare Lachisanu lapitalo, chigamulo chochirikizidwa ndi khoti la ku Zimbabwe. Othandizira a MDC mazana ambiri ananyalanyaza chiletsochi, zomwe zinayambitsa mikangano pakati pa anthu wamba ndi apolisi. Kanema ndi zithunzi zinasonyeza apolisi akumenya ndi kukwapula anthu ena owonetsa zionetsero pakati pa zochita zomwe zinachititsa madandaulo a mphamvu yopitirira muyeso kuchokera ku magulu omenyera ufulu wa anthu ndi ufulu wa anthu, kuphatikizapo ofesi ya United Nations yoona za ufulu wa anthu.

en: Police, not demonstrators, showed up in force on Bulawayo streets Monday, with foot patrols wielding shields, batons and, in some cases, pistols. The Associated Press reported police trucks and water cannons positioned in the downtown area.
ny: Apolisi, osati zionetsero, adawonetsa mwamphamvu m'misewu ya Bulawayo Lolemba, ndi maulendo apazi akugwira zishango, ndodo ndipo, nthawi zina, mfuti. Nyuzipepala yotchedwa Associated Press inanena kuti magalimoto apolisi ndi mizinga yamadzi yomwe ili m'dera la mzindawu.

en: A young man in Bulawayo, identifying himself only as James, told VOA that negotiations between the government and opposition leaders were even more important than demonstrations.
ny: Mnyamata wina ku Bulawayo, yemwe amangodzidziwitsa kuti ndi James, anauza VOA kuti zokambirana pakati pa boma ndi atsogoleri otsutsa ndizofunika kwambiri kuposa zionetsero.

en: "Honestly, to demonstrate, we can end up being hurt by being beaten, being chased around. There's really nothing that we see coming out of it," James said. "But these men should sit down and see what they can do for us, especially us, the youth. … We have been affected a lot, and we are getting old just running."
ny: "Moona mtima, kuwonetsera, tikhoza kutha kupwetekedwa mwa kumenyedwa, kuthamangitsidwa mozungulira. Palibe kwenikweni chimene tikuona chikutulukamo," anatero James. "Koma amuna amenewa ayenera kukhala pansi n'kuona zimene angatichitire, makamaka ifeyo, achinyamata. ... Takhudzidwa kwambiri, ndipo tikukalamba tikungothamanga."

en: Moyo, the foreign minister, told VOA the administration is "undertaking economic reforms [that] are fundamental and they are key to ensuring that even the youth would finally have jobs created for them, so that we can create an environment where investors and the capital will find it easy to come into this country, where jobs will be created, and the youth will be part and parcel of economic activity."
ny: Moyo, nduna ya zakunja, adauza VOA kuti boma "likuchita kusintha kwachuma [kuti] ndizofunikira kwambiri ndipo ndizofunikira kuonetsetsa kuti ngakhale achinyamata potsiriza adzakhala ndi ntchito zopangidwira iwo, kuti tithe kupanga malo omwe ogulitsa ndalama ndi likulu adzapeza kuti ndizosavuta kubwera m'dziko lino, komwe ntchito zidzapangidwe,  ndipo achinyamata adzakhala mbali ya ntchito zachuma."

en: Moyo said Zimbabwe is midway into a two-year "transition stabilization program" to revive the country's devastated economy: "We have got one year to go and we are saying we should by then be out of the doldrums."
ny: Moyo adati Zimbabwe ili pakati pa zaka ziwiri "pulogalamu yokhazikika yosinthira" kuti itsitsimutse chuma chowonongeka cha dziko: "Tili ndi chaka chimodzi chopita ndipo tikunena kuti panthawiyo tiyenera kukhala kunja kwa doldrums."

en: The southern African country of nearly 16 million is experiencing its worst financial crisis since 2008, beset by hyperinflation and the fallout of decades of corruption. Many struggle to buy basics such as food and medicine. With the poor economy and crops devastated by drought and a spring cyclone, the UN World Food Program anticipates that 5.5 million people will need emergency food aid by next April.
ny: Dziko la kum'mwera kwa Africa lomwe lili ndi anthu pafupifupi 16 miliyoni likukumana ndi mavuto aakulu kwambiri azachuma kuyambira mu 2008, chifukwa cha kukwera mtengo kwa zinthu komanso kugwa kwa ziphuphu kwa zaka zambiri. Ambiri amavutika kugula zinthu zofunika monga chakudya ndi mankhwala. Popeza kuti chuma ndi mbewu zawonongeka chifukwa cha chilala ndi mphepo yamkuntho ya m'ngululu, bungwe la UN World Food Program likuyembekezera kuti anthu 5.5 miliyoni adzafunikira thandizo la chakudya mwadzidzidzi pofika mwezi wa April wamawa.

en: Finance Minister Mthuli Ncube, who had predicted 3.1% growth for 2019, offered a sobering update to Zimbabwe's parliament in early August. "The revised 2019 GDP growth is expected to be negative," Reuters news service reported him as saying.
ny: Nduna ya zachuma Mthuli Ncube, yemwe adaneneratu za kukula kwa 3.1% kwa 2019, adapereka chidziwitso chowopsa ku nyumba ya malamulo ya Zimbabwe kumayambiriro kwa mwezi wa August. "Kusinthidwa kwa 2019 GDP kukula kumayembekezeredwa kukhala koipa," utumiki wa uthenga wa Reuters unamuuza kuti akunena.

en: Ncube did not provide any updated figure.
ny: Ncube sanapereke chiwerengero chilichonse chosinthidwa.

en: Civil Society Workers Run Afoul of Tanzania Security Officials in Sign of Increasing Clampdown
ny: Ogwira Ntchito za Civil Society Akuthamanga Molakwika ndi Akuluakulu a Chitetezo cha Tanzania Posaina Kuwonjezeka kwa Clampdown

en: African civil society campaigners attending a conference in Tanzania were questioned and warned over the weekend, in what human rights activists say is part of a continuing clampdown on free speech in the East African nation.
ny: Anthu omenyera ufulu wa anthu a ku Africa omwe akupezeka pamsonkhano ku Tanzania anafunsidwa ndi kuchenjezedwa kumapeto kwa sabata, zomwe anthu omenyera ufulu wachibadwidwe akuti ndi mbali ya kupitiliza kuletsa ufulu wa kulankhula m'dziko la East Africa.

en: Details are still emerging over what exactly happened to at least 40 civil society workers who ran afoul of security officials at this year's summit of the Southern African Development Community in Dar es Salaam.
ny: Tsatanetsatane ukutulukabe pa zomwe zinachitikadi kwa ogwira ntchito m'chitaganya cha anthu osachepera 40 omwe adathamanga molakwika ndi akuluakulu achitetezo pamsonkhano wa chaka chino wa Southern African Development Community ku Dar es Salaam.

en: But rights experts said Monday that the episode is another worrying sign of heightened paranoia and harassment from the government.
ny: Koma akatswiri a ufulu anati Lolemba kuti chochitikacho ndi chizindikiro china chodetsa nkhawa cha kuwonjezeka kwa paranoia ndi kuvutitsidwa kuchokera ku boma.

en: Catherine Eden, a lawyer for the Tanzania Human Rights Defenders Coalition, says the incident stemmed from a misunderstanding. South African delegates to the 15-nation conference, she said, wanted to hold a short commemoration of the seventh anniversary of South Africa's deadly Marikana mine massacre on Aug. 16. Thirty-four striking miners were killed by police in the deadliest security incident since the end of apartheid in 1994.
ny: Catherine Eden, yemwe ndi loya wa bungwe la Tanzania Human Rights Defenders Coalition, akuti nkhaniyi idachokera ku kusamvetsetsana. Nthumwi za ku South Africa ku msonkhano wa mayiko 15, adati, akufuna kuchita chikumbutso chachidule cha chikumbutso chachisanu ndi chiwiri cha kuphedwa kwa mgodi wa Marikana wakupha ku South Africa pa Aug. 16. Anthu makumi atatu ndi anayi ogwira ntchito m'migodi omwe akumenya anaphedwa ndi apolisi pa chochitika chakupha kwambiri cha chitetezo kuyambira kutha kwa tsankho mu 1994.

en: So delegates at a side event sang the South African anthem, held a moment of silence and availed on their government to better protect its people. But something they wrote on a piece of paper convinced security police the delegates had bigger plans.
ny: Chotero nthumwi pa chochitika china zinaimba nyimbo ya ku South Africa, zinachita chete kwakanthaŵi ndipo zinapindulitsa boma lawo kutetezera bwino anthu ake. Koma chinachake chimene iwo analemba pa pepala chinakhutiritsa apolisi achitetezo nthumwizo zinali ndi zolinga zazikulu.

en: "They wrote some messages on the flip charts, of which the little content that was captured in the flip charts read, 'Stop killing our people,'" she said. "... So I think there was a national security person in that meeting and he saw those messages and so he interpreted that as a plan to demonstrate. But if you look closely, you can't see any relationship as to why they would want to demonstrate for the Marikana shootings in Tanzania."
ny: "Iwo analemba mauthenga ena pa tchati cha flip, chomwe zinthu zazing'ono zomwe zinagwidwa m'makalata a flip zinalembedwa kuti, 'Lekani kupha anthu athu,'" adatero. "... Kotero ine ndikuganiza kuti panali munthu wa chitetezo cha dziko mu msonkhano umenewo ndipo adawona mauthenga amenewo ndipo kotero adatanthauzira kuti ngati dongosolo lowonetsera. Koma ngati mutayang'anitsitsa, simungathe kuona ubale uliwonse kuti n'chifukwa chiyani angafune kuwonetsera kuwombera kwa Marikana ku Tanzania."

en: It's not clear if anyone was actually arrested. Other rights groups say that some foreign campaigners were arrested, but not interrogated.
ny: Sizikudziwika bwino ngati wina anamangidwadi. Magulu ena omenyera ufulu akuti anthu ena omenyera ufulu wa kunja anamangidwa, koma sanafunsidwe.

en: 'Afraid, insecure'
ny: 'Mantha, osatetezeka'

en: Eden says she was summoned by authorities as she went to the police station Friday night to meet with a local coordinator and then was let go with a warning. Police later went to delegates' hotel rooms looking for materials that they thought were a security threat. They found nothing, she said.
ny: Eden akuti adaitanidwa ndi akuluakulu a boma pamene adapita ku polisi Lachisanu usiku kukakumana ndi wogwirizanitsa mderalo kenako adaloledwa kupita ndi chenjezo. Apolisi pambuyo pake anapita ku zipinda za hotelo za nthumwi kufunafuna zipangizo zomwe ankaganiza kuti ndizoopsa chitetezo. Iwo sanapeze kanthu, iye anatero.

en: Janet Zhou, director of the Zimbabwe Coalition on Debt and Development, was one of the campaigners questioned by security forces at her hotel.
ny: Janet Zhou, mtsogoleri wa bungwe la Zimbabwe Coalition on Debt and Development, anali mmodzi mwa anthu omwe anafunsidwa ndi asilikali achitetezo ku hotelo yake.

en: "I was afraid, I was insecure, I was traumatized to say the least," she told VOA, after returning home to Harare. "Because seven security details coming over after midnight and questioning me about a demonstration and placards that I wasn't going to be able to give them, was something else. I didn't understand it. It left me really terrified."
ny: "Ndinali ndi mantha, ndinali wopanda chitetezo, ndinakhumudwa kwambiri kunena pang'ono," adauza VOA, atabwerera kwawo ku Harare. "Chifukwa chakuti mfundo zisanu ndi ziwiri zachitetezo zomwe zikubwera pakati pa usiku ndi kundifunsa za chiwonetsero ndi zikwangwani zomwe sindinathe kuzipereka, zinali zina. Sindinamvetse. Zinandichititsa mantha kwambiri."

en: She said police then told her — and her 40-person delegation — to remain in their hotel all day Saturday. She asked them if they were under arrest, to which they did not reply.
ny: Iye adati apolisi kenako adamuuza - ndi nthumwi zake za anthu 40 - kuti akhalebe mu hotelo yawo tsiku lonse Loweruka. Iye anawafunsa ngati anamangidwa, kumene sanayankhe.

en: 'Perfectly valid'
ny: 'Zovomerezeka mwangwiro'

en: Oryem Nyeko, a Kampala-based researcher for Human Rights Watch, noted that Tanzanian police didn't do anything technically illegal. But, he said, that doesn't make it right, either.
ny: Oryem Nyeko, yemwe ndi wofufuza za ku Kampala wa bungwe la Human Rights Watch, adati apolisi a ku Tanzania sanachite chilichonse chosavomerezeka mwaukadaulo. Koma, iye anati, zimenezo sizikupangitsa kuti zikhale bwino, kapena.

en: "I think it's a perfectly valid thing for police to do," he said. "However, the challenge with that is that it speaks to a wider problem in Tanzania as far as a closing civic space and the opportunities that people in civic society have to freely express themselves. This is part of a wider pattern of civic repression in the country."
ny: "Ndikuganiza kuti ndi chinthu chovomerezeka mwangwiro kuti apolisi achite," adatero. "Komabe, vuto ndi limenelo ndiloti limalankhula za vuto lalikulu ku Tanzania ponena za malo otsiriza a anthu komanso mwayi womwe anthu m'chitaganya cha anthu ali nawo kuti afotokoze momasuka. Zimenezi ndi mbali ya njira yaikulu yopondereza anthu m'dzikoli."

en: International groups like the Committee to Protect Journalists have also warned of increased repression. Ahead of the SADC summit, the watchdog group noted its concerns about a "deeply troubling erosion of press freedom," and of "attacks on individual journalists, media suspensions, internet shutdowns, and restrictive legislation."
ny: Magulu apadziko lonse monga Committee to Protect Journalists achenjezanso za kuwonjezeka kwa kupondereza. Msonkhano wa SADC usanachitike, gulu loyang'anira linayang'ana nkhawa zake za "kuwonongeka kovutitsa kwambiri kwa ufulu wa atolankhani," komanso "kuukira atolankhani payekha, kuyimitsidwa kwa atolankhani, kutsekedwa kwa intaneti, ndi malamulo oletsa."

en: The CPJ made special mention of Tanzanian journalists Azory Gwanda, who has been missing since 2017, and Erick Kabendera, who was arrested last month and charged with economic crimes, which the organization says is in retaliation for his critical journalism.
ny: CPJ inatchula mwapadera atolankhani a ku Tanzania Azory Gwanda, yemwe wakhala akusowa kuyambira mu 2017, ndi Erick Kabendera, yemwe anamangidwa mwezi watha ndipo anaimbidwa mlandu wa milandu ya zachuma, yomwe bungweli likuti ikubwezera chifukwa cha utolankhani wake wotsutsa.

en: Kabendera remains behind bars. On Monday, Eden, his lawyer, said the court decided to adjourn to give prosecutors more time to investigate. That will keep him in jail for more than a week longer, until Aug. 30.
ny: Kabendera adakali m'ndende. Lolemba, Eden, loya wake, adati khoti linaganiza zoimitsa nthawi kuti apatse oimira milandu nthawi yambiri yofufuza. Zimenezo zidzamusunga m'ndende kwa nthaŵi yoposa mlungu umodzi, kufikira pa Aug. 30.

en: 'Worrying trend'
ny: 'Mchitidwe wodetsa nkhawa'

en: Anna Henga, director of the Legal and Human Rights Center, said police actions only further a worrying trend in Tanzania under President John Magafuli, whom critics say is becoming increasingly authoritarian.
ny: Anna Henga, mtsogoleri wa Legal and Human Rights Center, adati zochita za apolisi zikungowonjezera nkhawa ku Tanzania pansi pa Purezidenti John Magafuli, yemwe otsutsa akuti akukhala wolamulira kwambiri.

en: "This means the continuation of a limited civic space. Because this has happened since 2016. There are a lot of issues, there is a negative development toward limited civic space. And it is targeted to people like civil society organizations, the media, hindering the freedom of speech, the freedom of association."
ny: "Izi zikutanthauza kupitiriza kwa malo ochepa a anthu. Chifukwa izi zachitika kuyambira 2016. Pali nkhani zambiri, pali chitukuko choipa ku malo ochepa a anthu. Ndipo cholinga chake ndi anthu ngati mabungwe a anthu wamba, ofalitsa nkhani, kulepheretsa ufulu wa kulankhula, ufulu woyanjana."

en: Few Demonstrators Turn Up for Zimbabwe Protest in Bulawayo
ny: Owonetsera Ochepa Atembenukira ku Zimbabwe Protest ku Bulawayo

en: Few people have turned up for an opposition protest in Bulawayo, Zimbabwe's second city, on Monday as armed police maintained heavy presence on the streets and at a courthouse where the opposition is pressing to be allowed to hold the demonstration.
ny: Ndi anthu ochepa omwe atembenukira ku zionetsero zotsutsa ku Bulawayo, mzinda wachiwiri wa Zimbabwe, Lolemba pamene apolisi okhala ndi zida anakhalabe ndi anthu ambiri m'misewu komanso ku khoti komwe otsutsa akukakamiza kuti aloledwa kuchita zionetsero.

en: Business in Bulawayo's usually bustling downtown was subdued with the most traffic from police trucks, water cannons and dozens of police officers patrolling on foot.
ny: Bizinesi m'tauni ya Bulawayo yomwe nthawi zambiri imakhala yotanganidwa kwambiri inagonjetsedwa ndi magalimoto ambiri ochokera m'magalimoto apolisi, mizinga yamadzi ndi apolisi ambiri omwe amayendera pansi.

en: The opposition party, the Movement for Democratic Change, had called the protest as part of a planned series of demonstrations to push President Emmerson Mnangagwa to agree to a transitional government amid a rapidly deteriorating economy and rising political tensions.
ny: Chipani chotsutsa, cha Movement for Democratic Change, chidaitanitsa zionetsero monga gawo la zionetsero zomwe zinakonzedwa kukakamiza mtsogoleri wa dziko lino Emmerson Mnangagwa kuti avomereze boma losintha zinthu pakati pa kuwonongeka kwa chuma mofulumira komanso kukwera kwa mikangano ya ndale.

en: But the police banned the protest in the southern city, citing security concerns. A Bulawayo magistrate is hearing the opposition party's challenge to the ban.
ny: Koma apolisi analetsa zionetserozo kum'mwera kwa mzindawo, akumatchula nkhawa za chitetezo. Jasitisiti wina wa ku Bulawayo akumva chipani chotsutsa chikutsutsa chiletsochi.

en: The protest was planned as a follow up to demonstrations held in the capital, Harare, on Friday when several hundred demonstrators marched in defiance of a police ban that was upheld by the High Court. Police used tear gas and beatings with batons to quell the Harare protest.
ny: Chiwonetserochi chinakonzedwa monga chotsatira zionetsero zomwe zinachitika ku likulu la dziko la Harare, Lachisanu pamene anthu mazana angapo omwe anachita zionetsero anachita zionetsero mosemphana ndi chiletso cha apolisi chomwe khoti lalikulu linagwirizana. Apolisi anagwiritsa ntchito mpweya wamisozi ndi kumenya ndi ndodo kuti athetse zionetsero za ku Harare.

en: Zimbabweans Claim Police Brutality During Economic Protests
ny: Anthu a ku Zimbabwe Amati Apolisi Akuzunzidwa Pa Zionetsero Zachuma

en: Zimbabweans defied a police ban Friday and held demonstrations to protest the country's deteriorating economy.
ny: Anthu a ku Zimbabwe ananyalanyaza chiletso cha apolisi Lachisanu ndipo anachita zionetsero zotsutsa kuti chuma cha dzikoli chikuwonongeka.

en: Despite the High Court ban on planned protests, members of the Movement for Democratic Change took to the streets and clashed with police. Some of the injured accused police of derailing protests, which they said were meant to persuade President Emmerson Mnangagwa's government to breathe life into Zimbabwe's moribund economy.
ny: Ngakhale kuti Khoti Lalikulu linaletsa zionetsero zomwe zinakonzedwa, mamembala a bungwe la Movement for Democratic Change anapita m'misewu ndipo anamenyana ndi apolisi. Ena mwa ovulalawo adaimba mlandu apolisi kuti akuchotsa zionetsero, zomwe adati cholinga chake chinali kukopa boma la Pulezidenti Emmerson Mnangagwa kuti lipume moyo mu chuma cha moribund cha Zimbabwe.

en: With tears on her cheeks, 32-year-old Tafadzwa Bvuta said her degree had not helped her get anything for her three children.
ny: Ndi misozi pamasaya ake, Tafadzwa Bvuta wa zaka 32 adati digiri yake sinamuthandize kupeza chilichonse kwa ana ake atatu.

en: "They beat us up," she said of the police. "What have we done? All these security forces are supposed to protect us all — not just one person. Where will we go and survive? Shall we kill our kids since we are struggling to take care of them?"
ny: "Anatimenya," anatero ponena za apolisi. "Kodi tachita chiyani? Magulu achitetezo onsewa ayenera kutiteteza tonsefe — osati munthu mmodzi yekha. Kodi tidzapita kuti ndi kupulumuka? Kodi tidzapha ana athu popeza tikuvutika kuwasamalira?"

en: Make Nyashanu, 27, said he would continue protesting because he is miserable about being unemployed.
ny: Pangani Nyashanu, yemwe ali ndi zaka 27, adati adzapitilizabe kuchita zionetsero chifukwa ndi womvetsa chisoni chifukwa choti alibe ntchito.

en: He said police were indiscriminately beating demonstrators — even elderly ones and people not protesting. "Is this democracy?" he asked, adding that it was a peaceful demonstration but police were causing chaos.
ny: Iye adati apolisi akumenya mosasankha zionetsero - ngakhale okalamba ndi anthu osatsutsa. "Kodi iyi ndi demokalase?" adafunsa, ndipo adawonjezera kuti inali zionetsero zamtendere koma apolisi akuyambitsa chisokonezo.

en: The opposition said it will hold another protest Monday in Zimbabwe's second largest city, Bulawayo, and will go to other cities and places until the government addresses the economy.
ny: Otsutsawo adati adzachita zionetsero zina Lolemba mumzinda wachiwiri waukulu kwambiri ku Zimbabwe, Bulawayo, ndipo adzapita ku mizinda ndi malo ena mpaka boma litalankhula za chuma.

en: Government response
ny: Kuyankha kwa boma

en: Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa called the protests counterproductive, saying January's demonstrations against fuel price increases resulted in $20 million to $30 million in losses for businesses from looting and non-productive days.
ny: Nduna ya za chidziwitso Monica Mutsvangwa adati zionetserozo ndizotsutsa, ndipo adati zionetsero za Januware zotsutsana ndi kukwera mtengo kwa mafuta zinapangitsa kuti ndalama zokwana madola 20 miliyoni kufika pa madola 30 miliyoni ziwonongeke kwa mabizinesi chifukwa cha kufunkha ndi masiku opanda phindu.

en: "Government calls on all progressive Zimbabweans to desist from being used by negative forces to destabilize their own country, as this will only prolong the hardships which the government is tirelessly trying to address in a more sustainable manner," she said. "I wish to reiterate the call by His Excellency Comrade ED Mnangagwa for all patriotic Zimbabweans to resort to dialogue as a means to solve the challenges we face as a nation."
ny: "Boma likupempha anthu onse a ku Zimbabwe omwe akupita patsogolo kuti asiye kugwiritsidwa ntchito ndi magulu oipa kuti asokoneze dziko lawo, chifukwa izi zidzangotalikitsa mavuto omwe boma likuyesetsa mosatopa kuthana nawo m'njira yowonjezereka," adatero. "Ndikufuna kubwereza pempho la His Excellency Comrade ED Mnangagwa kuti anthu onse a ku Zimbabwe okonda dziko lawo atembenukire kukambirana ngati njira yothetsera mavuto omwe tikukumana nawo monga mtundu."

en: Daniel Molokhele, the spokesman for the opposition, said his party was against Mnangagwa leading talks and accused him of stealing Zimbabwe's last election in 2018. He said the protests would continue until Zimbabwe's economy gets back on track.
ny: Mneneri wa chipani chotsutsa, Daniel Molokhele, adati chipani chawo chikutsutsana ndi Mnangagwa kutsogolera zokambirana ndipo adamuimba mlandu wakuba chisankho chomaliza cha Zimbabwe mu 2018. Iye adati zionetsero zidzapitirira mpaka chuma cha Zimbabwe chiyambenso kuyenda bwino.

en: UN Condemns Government Crackdown on Peaceful Protests in Zimbabwe
ny: BUNGWE la UN Ladzudzula Boma Kuti Lizichita Zionetsero Zamtendere ku Zimbabwe

en: The U.N. human rights office is condemning a crackdown Friday in Zimbabwe by riot police on peaceful protesters in the capital, Harare. The agency is calling for an investigation into excessive use of force by security forces.
ny: Ofesi yoona za ufulu wa anthu ya bungwe la U.N. ikudzudzula lachisanu ku Zimbabwe ndi apolisi oletsa zipolowe pa zionetsero zamtendere ku likulu la dziko la Harare. Bungweli likufuna kuti pakhale kafukufuku wokhudza kugwiritsa ntchito mphamvu mopitirira muyeso kwa asilikali achitetezo.

en: U.N. Human Rights spokesman Rupert Colville says there are better ways to deal with the populations legitimate grievances on the economic situation in the country than by cracking down on peaceful protestors.
ny: Mneneri wa bungwe la U.N. Human Rights Rupert Colville akuti pali njira zabwino zothetsera madandaulo ovomerezeka a anthu pa mkhalidwe wa zachuma m'dziko muno kusiyana ndi kulimbana ndi zionetsero zamtendere.

en: "We are deeply concerned by the socio-economic crisis that continues to unfold in Zimbabwe. While acknowledging efforts made by the government, the international community and the U.N. in Zimbabwe to mitigate the effects of the crisis and reform process, the dire economic situation is now impacting negatively on the realization of economic and social rights of millions of Zimbabweans," Colville said.
ny: "Tili ndi nkhawa kwambiri ndi vuto la zachuma ndi zachuma lomwe likupitilizabe ku Zimbabwe. Ngakhale akuvomereza zoyesayesa zomwe boma, mayiko a padziko lonse komanso bungwe la U.N. ku Zimbabwe akuyesetsa kuchepetsa zotsatira za vutoli komanso ndondomeko yosintha zinthu, mkhalidwe woopsa wa zachuma tsopano ukukhudza kwambiri kukwaniritsidwa kwa ufulu wa zachuma ndi chikhalidwe cha anthu mamiliyoni ambiri a ku Zimbabwe," adatero Colville.

en: Zimbabwes citizens are struggling with hyperinflation, which has sent prices soaring for essential commodities such as fuel, food, transportation and health care. Compounding the problems is the ongoing impact of cyclone Idai that hit Zimbabwe in March and a severe drought.
ny: Nzika za Zimbabwe zikuvutika ndi hyperinflation, zomwe zachititsa kuti mitengo ikwere kwambiri pazinthu zofunika monga mafuta, chakudya, mayendedwe ndi zaumoyo. Chomwe chikuwonjezera mavutowa ndi mphepo yamkuntho ya Idai yomwe ikupitirizabe kugunda dziko la Zimbabwe mu March komanso chilala chachikulu.

en: The United Nations says one third of Zimbabwes population of 16 million people is in need of humanitarian aid.
ny: Bungwe la United Nations likuti gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu a anthu a ku Zimbabwe okwana 16 miliyoni akufunikira thandizo.

en: The fallout in terms of casualties and possible arrests from Fridays protests is not yet clear. But Colville tells VOA his office has received disturbing reports of human rights violations over the past few months.
ny: Kugwa kwa anthu ovulala komanso kumangidwa kotheka kuchokera ku zionetsero za Lachisanu sikunadziwikebe. Koma Colville akuuza VOA kuti ofesi yake yalandira malipoti osokoneza a kuphwanya ufulu wachibadwidwe pa miyezi ingapo yapitayi.

en: "There are, as I said, reports coming through right now of very recent abductions, beatings and so on of activists or human rights defenders. We have not had a chance to verify those and look in detail apart from the two that occurred a few days ago," Colville said. "So, it is clearly a very tense situation."
ny: "Pali, monga ndanenera, malipoti akubwera pakali pano a kuba anthu posachedwapa kwambiri, kumenyedwa ndi zina zotero za omenyera ufulu wachibadwidwe kapena oteteza ufulu wa anthu. Sitinakhale ndi mwayi wotsimikizira zimenezo ndikuyang'ana mwatsatanetsatane kupatula ziwiri zomwe zinachitika masiku angapo apitawo," adatero Colville. "Choncho, n'zoonekeratu kuti ndi mkhalidwe wovuta kwambiri."

en: Colville says state authorities have a duty to ensure peoples rights to freedom of expression and to protect the right to peaceful assembly.
ny: Colville akuti akuluakulu a boma ali ndi udindo woonetsetsa kuti anthu ali ndi ufulu wolankhula komanso kuteteza ufulu wosonkhana mwamtendere.

en: The U.N. human rights office is urging the government to engage in a national dialogue to ensure that civil society in all its guises can carry out its activities without fear of intimidation or reprisals for its work.
ny: Ofesi yoona za ufulu wa anthu ya bungwe la U.N. ikulimbikitsa boma kuti lizichita zokambirana za dziko lonse pofuna kuonetsetsa kuti anthu wamba m'njira zake zonse akhoza kuchita ntchito zake popanda kuopa kuopsezedwa kapena kubwezera ntchito yake.

en: Despite Oil and Gas Reserves, Africa Feels Pressure of Rising Energy Costs
ny: Mosasamala Kanthu za Malo Osungirako Mafuta ndi Gasi, Afirika Akumva Chitsenderezo cha Kukwera Mtengo kwa Mphamvu

en: Africans are feeling the pinch caused by soaring global energy prices, say analysts, even in countries like Nigeria and Angola that are major exporters of crude oil.
ny: Akatswiri ena amanena kuti anthu a ku Africa akuvutika kwambiri chifukwa cha kukwera kwa mitengo ya magetsi padziko lonse, ngakhale m'mayiko ngati Nigeria ndi Angola amene amagulitsa kwambiri mafuta.

en: While that handful of oil producers is seeing an increase in revenue – especially since the Russian invasion of Ukraine on February 24 – much of the continent lacks refining capability, forcing countries to pay high prices to import gasoline and other petroleum products from Asia and Europe.
ny: Ngakhale kuti ochepa omwe amapanga mafuta akuwona kuwonjezeka kwa ndalama - makamaka kuyambira pamene Russia inalowa ku Ukraine pa February 24 - mbali yaikulu ya kontinentiyi ilibe mphamvu yoyeretsa, kukakamiza mayiko kulipira mitengo yapamwamba kuti alowetse mafuta ndi zinthu zina zamafuta kuchokera ku Asia ndi Europe.

en: The continent is further affected by increasing costs for natural gas, a key component of nitrogen-based fertilizers used in food production.
ny: Dzikoli likukhudzidwanso ndi kuwonjezeka kwa ndalama za gasi, gawo lofunikira kwambiri la feteleza opangidwa ndi nayitrogeni omwe amagwiritsidwa ntchito popanga chakudya.

en: With salaries largely stagnant, more than two-thirds of Africans feel pressured by the rising prices, said Franklin Cudjoe, founding president of the Ghana-based Imani Center for Policy and Education.
ny: Pokhala ndi malipiro ambiri okhazikika, anthu oposa awiri mwa atatu alionse a ku Africa amamva kukakamizidwa ndi kukwera kwa mitengo, adatero Franklin Cudjoe, pulezidenti woyambitsa wa Imani Center for Policy and Education yomwe ili ku Ghana.

en: "The continent is affected simply because we depend largely on global oil suppliers, since not many African countries have [their own] oil products," Cudjoe told VOA.
ny: "Dzikoli likukhudzidwa chifukwa chakuti timadalira kwambiri ogulitsa mafuta padziko lonse lapansi, popeza si mayiko ambiri a ku Africa omwe ali ndi mafuta [awo]," Cudjoe adauza VOA.

en: Prices spiked on the global oil market after the invasion of Ukraine triggered a wave of international sanctions against Russia, one of the worlds leading exporters of crude. The price briefly climbed to over $120 per barrel this month before settling down to $103 per barrel on Friday.
ny: Mitengo spiked pa msika padziko lonse mafuta pambuyo kuwukira Ukraine anayambitsa mafunde a zilango mayiko Russia, mmodzi wa dziko kutsogolera amagulitsa kunja kwa yaiwisi. Mtengo unakwera mwachidule kuposa $ 120 pa bareli mwezi uno usanakhazikike ku $ 103 pa bareli Lachisanu.

en: The surge in energy prices is helping to fuel inflation across Africa. In Ghana, for example, overall consumer price inflation was pegged at 15.7% year-on-year in February compared with 13.9% in January, the countrys Statistical Service said last week.
ny: Kukwera kwa mitengo ya magetsi kukuthandiza kuyambitsa kukwera kwa mitengo ku Africa konse. Mu Ghana, Mwachitsanzo, lonse ogula mtengo mitengo anali pegged pa 15.7% chaka pa chaka mu February poyerekeza ndi 13.9% mu January, dziko Statistical Service anati sabata yatha.

en: In Zimbabwe, prices are climbing sharply – even overnight. At a TM supermarket in the capital of Harare, a crate of 30 eggs cost the $6.70 on Tuesday and about $7.81 on Wednesday. The price of a loaf of bread went from $1.49 to $1.84; for a kilo of beef, the price jumped from $3.35 to $5.22.
ny: Ku Zimbabwe, mitengo ikukwera kwambiri – ngakhale usiku umodzi. Pa supamaketi ya TM ku likulu la Harare, bokosi la mazira 30 linawononga $ 6.70 Lachiwiri ndi pafupifupi $ 7.81 Lachitatu. Mtengo wa mkate unachokera pa $1.49 kufika pa $1.84; kwa kilo ya nyama ya ng'ombe, mtengo unadumpha kuchokera pa $ 3.35 kufika pa $ 5.22.

en: Gasoline costs climbed, too. In Harare, the per-liter price climbed from $1.41 to $1.69 from Tuesday to Wednesday.
ny: Mtengo wa mafuta unakweranso. Ku Harare, mtengo wa pa lita imodzi unakwera kuchoka pa $1.41 kufika pa $1.69 kuyambira Lachiwiri mpaka Lachitatu.

en: The surge in food prices was the biggest driver behind consumer inflation in Egypt, it rose by 8.8% in February – the sharpest increase in nearly three years, according to the state statistics agency, CAPMAS.
ny: Kuwonjezeka kwa mitengo ya chakudya kunali dalaivala wamkulu kwambiri kumbuyo kwa kukwera mtengo kwa ogula ku Egypt, kunakwera ndi 8.8% mu February - kuwonjezeka kwakukulu pafupifupi zaka zitatu, malinga ndi bungwe la ziwerengero za boma, CAPMAS.

en: Cudjoe said it was crucial for governments and regional bodies such as the African Union to build defenses to cushion consumers in times of economic uncertainty.
ny: Cudjoe adati zinali zofunika kwambiri kuti maboma ndi mabungwe a m'madera monga African Union amange chitetezo kuti athetse ogula panthawi ya kusatsimikizika kwa chuma.

en: "Even if it means building defenses in terms of the provision of food," said Cudjoe, adding, "I could imagine Nigeria, if it had had its way, it could be selling foodstuff to most countries at reduced rates by now."
ny: "Ngakhale zitatanthauza kumanga chitetezo malinga ndi kuperekedwa kwa chakudya," anatero Cudjoe, ndipo anawonjezera kuti, "Ndikhoza kulingalira kuti Nigeria, ngati inali ndi njira yake, ikhoza kukhala ikugulitsa zakudya ku mayiko ambiri pa mitengo yochepetsedwa tsopano."

en: "There must be that urgency of building for themselves defenses, funds that would make us sustain ourselves -- at least to prevent us from being completely annihilated by these uncertainties in the world."
ny: "Payenera kukhala kufulumira kumeneko kwa kudzimangirira okha chitetezo, ndalama zomwe zingapangitse kuti tidzichirikize tokha -- osachepera kutiletsa kuwonongedwa kwathunthu ndi kusatsimikizika kumeneku padziko lapansi."

en: Chibamba Kanyama, an economist in the Zambian capital of Lusaka, said suspending fuel taxes would be "the most ideal thing to do now under the circumstances" to cushion consumers and industries.
ny: Chibamba Kanyama, katswiri wa zachuma ku likulu la Zambia la Lusaka, adati kuyimitsidwa kwa misonkho ya mafuta kudzakhala "chinthu chabwino kwambiri kuchita tsopano pansi pa mikhalidwe" kuti athetse ogula ndi mafakitale.

en: "African governments must find a way of responding," he said. 'It is a choice of whether to reduce taxes to lower the prices or to maintain the price levels and use the revenues to subsidize the most vulnerable in society."
ny: "Maboma a ku Africa ayenera kupeza njira yoyankhira," adatero. 'Ndi chisankho choti muchepetse misonkho kuti muchepetse mitengo kapena kusunga mitengo ndikugwiritsa ntchito ndalama zomwe zimapezeka pothandizira anthu ovutika kwambiri m'chitaganya."

en: But Kanyama also suggested that the geopolitical crisis involving Russia and Ukraine – both big grain exporters to Africa – may create opportunities for African producers.
ny: Koma Kanyama adanenanso kuti vuto la geopolitics lomwe likukhudza Russia ndi Ukraine - onse akuluakulu ogulitsa tirigu ku Africa - lingapange mwayi kwa alimi aku Africa.

en: "Supply countries like South Africa, with robust and highly mechanized systems, may find a window of exporting [commodities] like wheat and other products to fill the gaps left by Russia and Ukraine," Kanyama said.
ny: "Mayiko ogulitsa katundu ngati South Africa, omwe ali ndi njira zolimba komanso zamagetsi kwambiri, angapeze zenera lotumiza kunja [katundu] monga tirigu ndi zinthu zina kuti akwaniritse mipata yomwe yasiyidwa ndi Russia ndi Ukraine," adatero Kanyama.

en: Kanyama also said support by the international community – for instance, in the form of debt relief for some African nations – is welcome.
ny: Kanyama adanenanso kuti thandizo la anthu apadziko lonse lapansi – mwachitsanzo, mu mawonekedwe a ngongole zothandizira mayiko ena a ku Africa – ndilolandiridwa.

en: He noted that the Group of 20 – which encompasses seven industrialized nations, some countries with strong or fast-growing economies, and the European Union – "is trying to offer some debt relief."
ny: Iye adanena kuti Gulu la 20 - lomwe limaphatikizapo mayiko asanu ndi awiri otukuka, mayiko ena omwe ali ndi chuma champhamvu kapena chomwe chikukula mofulumira, komanso European Union - "akuyesera kupereka ngongole zina."

en: "Some other countries, such as Zambia, [are] undergoing debt restructuring processes and an IMF program, and to me, this is the only way out of the crisis," Kanyama added.
ny: "Mayiko ena, monga Zambia, [ali] akuchita ndondomeko zokonzanso ngongole ndi pulogalamu ya IMF, ndipo kwa ine, iyi ndi njira yokhayo yotulukira pa vutoli," adawonjezera Kanyama.

en: This story originated in VOA's English-to-Africa service, with contributions from the Zimbabwe service.
ny: Nkhaniyi inayambika mu utumiki wa VOA wa Chingerezi ndi Africa, ndi zopereka kuchokera ku utumiki wa Zimbabwe.

en: WHO Says Africa's COVID Vaccinations Rose by 15% in February
ny: WHO Ikuti Katemera wa COVID ku Africa Adakwera ndi 15% mu February

en: The World Health Organization says Africas COVID-19 vaccinations rose by 15% between January and February, as several countries embarked on mass inoculation drives to expand coverage and protect populations from the pandemic.
ny: Bungwe Loona za Umoyo Padziko Lonse limati katemera wa COVID-19 ku Africa adakwera ndi 15% pakati pa Januware ndi February, pamene mayiko angapo adayamba kuyendetsa katemera wambiri kuti awonjezere chidziwitso ndi kuteteza anthu ku mliriwu.

en: Zimbabwes government says it is launching a "national vaccination blitz" targeting those who have not yet been vaccinated in a country where resistance to the shots has been an issue since the program started last year. The drive come amid government concern over rising COVID-19 cases.  Dr. Matshidiso Moeti, WHO regional director for Africa, said in a statement that the increase in COVID-19 vaccinations on the continent was driven mainly by campaigns in populous countries, including the Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya, and Nigeria.
ny: Boma la Zimbabwes likuti likuyambitsa "national vaccination blitz" cholinga cha anthu omwe sanapatsidwebe katemera m'dziko lomwe kukana kuwombera kwakhala nkhani kuyambira pamene pulogalamuyi inayamba chaka chatha. Kuyendetsa kumabwera pakati pa nkhawa ya boma pa kukwera kwa milandu ya COVID-19.  Dr. Matshidiso Moeti, mtsogoleri wa chigawo cha WHO ku Africa, adanena m'mawu kuti kuwonjezeka kwa katemera wa COVID-19 pa kontinentiyi kunayendetsedwa makamaka ndi makampeni m'mayiko okhala ndi anthu ambiri, kuphatikizapo Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya, ndi Nigeria.

en: Dr. Thierno Balde, the WHO Africa regional COVID-19 incident manager, he says the continent must remain vigilant.
ny: Dr. Thierno Balde, woyang'anira zochitika za dera la WHO Africa la COVID-19, akuti kontinentiyi iyenera kukhalabe tcheru.

en: "We have seen what is happening around, in China, and the risk of also having new imitations, new variants still possible. We really need to continue to safeguard our population by taking the vaccine by not relaxing totally. The situation might change. So we really need to continue adapting some of these social measures and also to get vaccination," Balde said.
ny: "Tawona zomwe zikuchitika mozungulira, ku China, komanso chiopsezo chokhala ndi kutsanzira kwatsopano, mitundu yatsopano idakalipo. Tiyenera kupitirizabe kuteteza anthu athu mwa kumwa katemera mwa kusapuma kotheratu. Mkhalidwewo ungasinthe. Choncho tikufunikira kwenikweni kupitiliza kusintha zina mwa njira zachikhalidwe zimenezi komanso kuti tipeze katemera," adatero Balde.

en: The WHO said to boost African COVID-19 vaccine acceptance, it and other organizations were supporting mass vaccination drives in at least 10 priority countries to reach 100 million people by the end of next month.
ny: Bungwe la WHO linanena kuti lipititse patsogolo kuvomereza katemera wa COVID-19 ku Africa, izo ndi mabungwe ena anali kuthandizira kuyendetsa katemera wambiri m'mayiko osachepera 10 oyambirira kuti afikire anthu 100 miliyoni kumapeto kwa mwezi wamawa.

en: Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu, Zimbabwes acting information minister, said his country would not be left behind.
ny: Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu, yemwe akugwira ntchito ya nduna ya zachidziwitso ku Zimbabwe, adati dziko lake silidzasiyidwa kumbuyo.

en: "Regarding the vaccination program, as of 15 March, 2022, a total of 159,628 third doses have been administered to date. The national vaccination blitz campaign will kick off on Monday, 21 March, 2022, and [the] government is urging those that have not yet been vaccinated to take advantage of this exercise to do so," Ndlovu said.
